review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Had a Great time.  Hotel was close to everything.  Thanks

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location if you prefer Fishermans wharf area. Personally would stay elsewhere. Did not like the area and parking was too expensive $40-50 per night so hire a car when you need it only but book in advance as limited availability. Hotel was strangely laid out and we ended up at the Holiday express when we booked the Holiday Inn on Columbus and had to walk a block to our room.. So not so happy

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I would stay here again because of the location. It is within walking distance of Pier 39 and all other San Francisco activities. The hotel is old and is in need of new carpeting etc. But over all experience was comfortable and  very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 and Alcatraz excursions are within walking distance.

review.title: Very close to the Wharf & restaurants.
review.reviewText: I am  a creature of habit. If I like a hotel, their staff & their services , I return. It is that simple. I find this hotel fits my needs when I travel to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Did not smell stuffy. My room smelled very clean. Very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: When checking in, one singular line should be formed. Like a bank. Sometimes I can't tell who is next to be checked in. First come first serve concept
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants, great transportation options.

review.title: customer service by hotel manager at our arrival
review.reviewText:
my name is Aviv kalinski and my hotel confirmation is 66413589.
we have booked and payed for our stay at the hotel before arrival, we have payed for the room and for breakfast ahead of our arrival, we have noticed when we booked and payed that there was an option for parking and the amounts specified where: $20.00 for over night or $50.00 for over night if you wish to take your car out more than once. 
when we arrived late in the evening we where told by the clerk at the front desk that parking is $50.00, when i said we have noticed there are 2 options one for 420.00 and one for $50.00 i was told there is not but she will talk to here manager, the manager said there is only 1 option and if i do not like it i can go somewhere else, i was shocked to my core, i was never treated like that before especially not by a hotel that i have chosen to stay at, and when i said to him i have made my choice to stay at this hotel and i saw the rate while booking with Expedia he said he will not honor the Expedia deal at his hotel. i have said to him that it is late and i will stay but i am not happy at all he just shrugged and said i could go somewhere else. if your hotel is promoted through Expedia i would assume you will except the terms of the promotion you have chosen, i can not believe that you will allow your manager to behave this way.
i have stayed at your hotels before but this is unbelievable  i am shocked by this behavior.
please respond to my review. aviv 630-650-1780
review.negativeRemarks: customer service

review.title: convenient location - fair price
review.reviewText: Generally satisfied with stay - I stayed there several times - My two issues are - bathroom - in two stays had problems with toilet - second issue - why they made me checkout and then checkin when I extended my stay or why they need to charge $50 deposit - hopefully refundable - I normally expect they would charge my card if I use extra services - why the upfront $50

review.title: Hotel is average, but close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is average in regard to service, cleanliness and amenities, but close to Fisherman's Wharf and other sites in the area.  Parking turns out to be $57 per night with tax, which is excessive.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and other things to do
review.negativeRemarks: The attitude and helpfulness of the staff - from check in to the concierge to the bartender, I was made to feel my questions were an interruption.

review.title: The worse management at this Holiday Inn hotel
review.reviewText:
Front desk was told smelled smoking marijuana  every day on our floor during our staying. However, the manager did little or nothing to our complaints. Also our room window was facing the back alley where garbage truck came to collect garbage at 2 in the morning :( 
Overall the location is excellent.

review.title: Superior staff and location
review.reviewText:
All I can say is "WOW"....the staff is amazing!!  The woman that checked us in was so accommodating, kind and helpful (unfortunately, I did not get her name). We stayed at the "wharf" building, just a short walk from the 1300 Columbus location.  The location was perfect.  Reception was clean.  Denny's restaurant was located inside the building....overpriced, but convenient.
The rooms were super clean, very comfortable and had nice amenities.
We received superior service from the front desk clerk (Jade), who helped us with transportation and airline information.
I can't wait to go back!!
review.negativeRemarks: To offer coffee in reception area.
review.locationRemarks: Omgosh!!  There are restaurants and shopping galore!!  Pier 39, ferry excursions, street entertainment...you name it.

review.title: Close to touristy areas but away from noise.
review.reviewText: Rooms are spacious but outdated. Location is great. Expensive parking fee ($57!)
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee too high.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman Wharf and North beach restaurantes.

review.title: Staff
review.reviewText: Front desk guy was a jerk.. I reserved the room with Expedia, breakfast was included in price he said NO but yet when I awoke there were tickets under my door for buffer.  He was rude and belligerent to work with
Wish parking is not too pricey. Room rate also expensive

review.title: Conveniently located.
review.reviewText:
We were allowed to check in early.  However, our room was on a very noisy corner.  There was a bar across the street which was quite active.  The staff was not very familiar with a new system of check in and credit card holds.  I did request that my son who dropped us off be allowed to park his car for 2 hours the management said we could not do that unless we paid an overnight fee of $50.  I found that to be poor customer service.  The reservation included a complimentary breakfast which was not complimentary so we went elsewhere.  
Overall, an average stay.  However, it is a prime location.  I would recommend staying at the Express if it was less expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to many tourist attractions such as Ghiradeli Square, The Cannery, The Aquarium, the Wax Museum, Pier 39 and tourist shopping.

review.title: Close to the wharf and shopping. Near great food.
review.reviewText: Hotel check was slow at best. Once checked in all was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Faster check in

review.title: Very close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Great stay, convenient location to attractions. Very safe area.

I feel employees are very snotty and treat you stupid. I asked to have buffet added to my hotel rate and the manager said no. 
Next day I went to check out and lady was too busy talking to co worker to address me. Didn't even give me receipt.
review.negativeRemarks: employees attitudes and customer service

review.reviewText: Close to many of my favorite sites and the staff was great.

review.title: very noisy
review.reviewText: the windows are so outdated that you can hear everything outside! the beds are ok but room is kinda looks old and depressing. the good thing is that garage is right downstars and you can come and go as much as you please. the location is very good, no doubt, but bc the room is soo depressing the whole experience on SF is kinda going down:(
review.positiveRemarks: location, garage ( bit expensive, but too convinient)
review.negativeRemarks: windows, wall paint,
review.locationRemarks: location is very good, right next to fisherman wharf, which is the place you want to be in SF if you are a tourist.

review.title: one of the nicest holiday inn's
review.reviewText:
clean and current hotel, with very friendly staff with good standard features and ample parking even if it is high priced on the parking. location is choice, just a few short blocks to the Wharf area. I stayed on the 5th floor, nice sized room with clean bathroom. in the morning ate the buffet breakfast, which was great as expected, the food and the service was on point and excellent.
the I needed a taxi the bell staff called a taxi and gave me options and offered maps of the local area.
review.negativeRemarks: lower the cost of parking, 50 is too high. 30 would be more appropriate
review.locationRemarks: walk to the wharf and aquarium great restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great Hotel- great location!
review.reviewText:
Holiday Inn was really good! In fact, I was very pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel is. If first impressions matter, the lobby is nice... if your into that sort of thing. Front desk staff "Flora" was very helpful & pleasant. We got to check in early- big plus! The room was nicely furnished and actually a good size, it was always clean (ed)  and very quiet.  
I want to say how handy this hotel is to all the stuff you go to see when in SF. It is right in the middle of everything and is not too far to just walk it. In fact we loved doing that!!  We loved adventuring around never felt un-safe although there are some homeless people around here and there. (Total Footnote here...Made me really stop and realize what a problem this is all over our country... makes my heart sad.) We gave a few meals out to the ones that were not completely gone- mentally! 
The restaurants are all pretty good. Some are down right fantastic!! I'm GF for the most part & had no trouble there... but that was not always the case on this trip... you must try the Sour dough bread! 
Everything in this city is made for people who love to be entertained, sight see and eat good food! Amen to that! Cheers and remember- Your attitude will reflect the attitude's around you! (We saw some really pushy tourist - chill your on vaca!) As my mom used to say "Treat people the way you like to be treated" Crazy simple ....but it works!!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the location first and foremost,  then the room was nice, clean and quiet! All the staff was very helpful and kind. Would stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: Put in a Mini refrigerator and a bath fan so the mirrors didn't fog up!
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Little Italy, Cable cars, Pier to Alcatraz, lots of great restaurants! McCormick's was great...btw! Go cars too or bike

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything!
review.reviewText: We were right there by Fishermans Wharf  with a lot to do and experience

review.title: Hotel is perfectly located.
review.reviewText: Walk to wharf, pier 39, aquarium and Exploratorium! Room nice and clean. Restaurant food in hotel was great. Wifi not too good. Extra parking fee of $57.00 a day should be added to your budget.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Convenience
review.reviewText: Great location, nice clean and comfortable room. Got the breakfast option and was not disappointed. Great selection of food...had a nice fruit and melon choice every day. In addition to the Wharf, the cable car turnaround was only a couple blocks away.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, breakfast and staff were all great.
review.negativeRemarks: cheaper parking would be nice, but it's in line with other hotels in the area

review.title: Nice hotel, bad experience.
review.reviewText: Hotel facilities are excellent; it was a big surprise for us the cost of parking, specially  that we didn't know it was going to be that much. Another surprise is that they announce breakfast is included; we were 3 and only gave 2 passes for room when we book 3 people, also didn't know until there.

review.title: Perfect location for travelers.
review.reviewText:
Perfect location for sight seeing and taking in San Francisco. $5 uber ride to any sight. 
The only thing we lacked was a microwave and refrigerator in pur room.

review.title: Adjacent to the places we want to visit
review.reviewText: The parking rate is outrageous. It should be complimented to the guests.  For the cost of room plus parking per night is really too much. $50.00  per day parking is way too much. The room itself is expensive already to begin with. No coffee in the lobby. You have to pay that too.

review.title: Family Hotel close to Pier 39 Alkatraz
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, rooms are okay, close to tourist sites.  Most within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: More attention to detail when cleaning the rooms

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: This hotel would be wonderful except that it was too noisy.  They were kind enough to provide complimentary earplugs, otherwise I never would have been able to sleep.  If noise doesn't bother you, this hotel is nice for the price and in a good location to explore the wharf area of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, clean, courteous staff, Bath & Body toiletries.
review.negativeRemarks: To noisy for me.  I don't know if this could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to both Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirdardelli Square.

review.title: Not as expected
review.reviewText: Our room was on the first floor and was beside of an alley. The homeless people would come and stay outside of our room at night. You could hear them talking, coughing all night. There were people taking tours on segways past our window. The trucks emptied the dumpsters very early each morning. It was very noisy. This is the first time I have never been asked about my stay as I checked out. Would not recommend this hotel. Expedias website stated $45 parking fee  per night but when we arrived, we were charged $50 per night. When I questioned this, I was told "parking is $50. you will need to contact Expedia." Not a friendly staff at all.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: If you are going to charge for parking, you could at least include breakfast.

review.reviewText: Room OK on short notice (same day) - don't use hide-a-bed for older child, not comfortable.  Spend the buck and get 2 queens.
Faucets not working.  Toilet not flushing properly. mold around shower.  Creepy.  Would have left except it was 8 pm or so and only staying one night to catch a cruise.
review.positiveRemarks: Dining room looked nice but way overpriced!
review.negativeRemarks: Complete remodel
review.locationRemarks: Location not far from cruise port

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Holiday Inn occupies one block.  We were fortunate to be located just in front of Fisherman's Wharf on Beach Street at 4th Floor. It was a bit noisy at night but there were ear plugs provided in the room. Very clean and Denny's Restaurant is at the ground floor. Parking is very limited but did not bother us since we did not have a rented car. Wallgreen's was just diagonally across the street so very easy to get water and some grocery items. E and F tram line station in front of Wallgreen's. Excellent location!

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay for the Fishermans Warf area. Everything is within walking distance, and they have rooms overlooking the Bay, Piers, Alcatraz< etc. they have a parking fee of $50 a night which is crazy, but your gonna pay a lot to park around there anyway and its good till 6:00 pm of your checkout day.

review.title: Clean hotel, close to the wharves
review.reviewText: I thought this was a great location and very clean facility. The breakfast buffet was good but very pricey. It was nice to be able to leave our car parked in the hotel parking garage even after checkout.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: It was a pretty nice hotel within walking distance of the main attractions. Most importantly, it was quiet and I actually got a good night's rest.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that I was able to walk to places and upon return, I was able to get some rest in a comfortable environment.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was outdated.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect, up the street from Fisherman's place, lots of restaurants. Also close to pier 33 where the boat tour for Alcatraz departs from.

review.title: Close to Pier 39
review.reviewText: Walking distance from Pier 39. Friendly staff. Check in was quick and easy.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all the action but far enough away to still be quiet ... Has all the facilities you could need including a guest laundry

review.title: nice hotel and close to everything.
review.reviewText: nice hotel. staff was great. expensive parking and they don't provide free coffee for guests which was disappointing.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good location; close to Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants, Lombard street, Ghiradelli square, Golden Gate Park
review.negativeRemarks: complimentary coffee in lobby
review.locationRemarks: Fisherrman's Wharf says it all

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Comfortable with good wifi. Perfectly located near Fishermans Wharf to access tourist attractions, cable car and tour buses. 24hour Denny's restaurant in house useful for early starts or finishes and great breakfast. Safe area to wander round. Really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Close to fisherman ward.
review.reviewText: The waitress at breakfast buffet couldn't remember what we ordered and expected us to leave her a tip. The computer to print out boarding pass was not working. We checked in late and had to walk out on the street to the next block to our room at midnight. Even though we had reserved a room a month in advance.

review.title: SF  Business trip
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff. The bed was the only negative, too hard of a mattress.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed the stay.  The hotel was right in the wharf area and so very convenient to all tourist attractions.

The only thing I did not like was the fee of 57$ for parking overnight.
Room wasn't  fully cleaned when we got there, but was cleaned well thereafter . Rose at the information desk was lovely and helpful.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is fine.  Staff was nice and location was great.  Could walk to cable car, wharf and shops.  There were good places to eat near.  It is in need of an update--but then the price would be a lot higher.  It is loud because of the location.

review.title: Safe and Clean Hotel in a Great Area
review.reviewText: We were looking for a cheaper hotel just to sleep in within walking distance of some fun activities for the night and this place was perfect! It was clean and felt safe for the night. And allowed us to walk around the wharf, Lombard street, and Ghirardelli square! Good reliable, Holiday Inn!

review.title: Excellent location to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much. Easy walk to everything along Fisherman's Wharf.  Even though check out was at noon, they allowed us to leave our car until 6:00PM, which allowed for a short walk to Alcatraz tour!  Will definitely choose this location again when we visit.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to offer suites for families with more than 2 children.  Rooms are very small, and beds are very small, not even Queen size.

review.title: Good hotel in an excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an excellent location (2 blocks from the wharf, right up the street from the Italian district, near Pier 39, near fort mason and all the local beaches.  The hotel was very nice and clean and the staff was very nice and professional.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is tight and the bathroom curtain rail was about to fall off the wall.

review.title: location location location
review.reviewText: Good overall hotel and buffet breakfast cleanliness staff very polite all good. The only downside was we asked for electric water pot twice that they offer and the staff did not bring one. Otherwise I definitely recommend the hotel for location, breakfast and safety for family was also good.

review.title: Very close to many of the things we wanted to see
review.reviewText:
The concierge made directions on the BART overly detailed / difficult to follow. We did, however, figure it out on our own.

The boarding ticket computer was EXTREMELY SLOW, as in, we needed an hour to process.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was ideal. Through Expedia, the price was pretty good.
review.negativeRemarks: See above

review.reviewText: Convenient and within walking distance of a lot of activities in San Francisco. Kuereg coffee in room was a plus. Helpful and pleasant staff. Would recommend.

review.title: Good location but...
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly which is the best thing I can say. Room was fairly clean but beds were not comfortable. The shower was way to low for anyone over 5 ft tall. The worst thing was the noise- even after I spoke with hotel staff several times before we got there requesting a room far from the street noise. We were put in the back of the hotel and our room over looked an alley. We were awoken every night by garbage trucks, police sirens, a gang fight, and even a gunshot. Would not stay here again. The only thing saving this hotel is it's close proximity to the wharf.

review.title: Location was the major selling point.
review.reviewText: Much of what we wanted to see and do was within walking distance. Transportation terminals for more distance attractions were also conveniently located. The hotel itself was comfortable, attractive, and provided what we needed.
review.positiveRemarks: Attractive lobby, comfortable (and clean) room, and no wait for the elevators.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel's workout facility was tiny and not very well equipped. The daytime concierge was rude and very dismissive. He provided no help at all.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to most attractions on Fishermans Wharf. Bus stops are fairly close, and trolley lines were within a few blocks.

review.title: Weekend trip with the wife
review.reviewText: Travelled to San Fran for sight seeing. Picked this hotel due to price and location. Awesome location 1 block walk on flat ground I might add to fishermans wharf.

review.title: Close to the wharf.
review.reviewText: We were sad there was no complimentary coffee in the lobby. we were on the second floor and it was NOISY. Lots of traffic noise. Staff was friendly and room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary coffee and breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: We did it all! Alcatraz, SF Dungeon, Ripley's, Madam Tousads, Jeremiah O Brien, sea lions, and more. We parked at theory and then walked everywhere.

review.title: Location is the key
review.reviewText: This hotel is ok. Everything in SF is expensive, so pick what you like. We picked location. It was easy to walk to most everything we needed. I do have an issue with other people's  hair in multiple areas of the bathroom, though.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Embarcadara, but overpriced
review.reviewText:
After paying $500+ charged another 57 for parking
It's a Overpriced Holiday Inn

review.title: Great location, but desperately needs updating
review.reviewText: The hotel is well situated for Fishermans wharf, our first room was very average but after complaining to the front desk was upgraded to a better room which was appreciated, but the hotel in general needs updating the towels are quite thin and noise coming from exhaust in the bathroom is very noisey which adds to noise from garbage collection and street sweeper which we accepted that it was out of hotels control, but still wakes you up. our room wasn't cleaned one day, but I put the card out on the door unbeknown to myself both sides say don;t disturb which seems strange, any way after some confusion with housekeeping we got clean towels and a couple of vouchers for a free breakfast and a drink at the bar which on the surface we thought was very nice, breakfast was ok but the free drink was undrinkable , it was tap beer and I think it is still the same keg from when the hotel opened it was terrible, however being free, we thought better of complaining and simply left the two beers behind.
review.negativeRemarks: Change door signs so one side is please clean room and other don't disturb. Hotel in general needs decor ect updated.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Great location for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much and found it very comforting to be able to return to a clean and secure hotel room. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.
review.locationRemarks: Fisher-mans Wharf is a great place to see the heart of San Francisco.  We toured Alcatraz, walked the piers and drove the very fun streets of the city

review.reviewText: We had great location.nice rooms. great staff and  were moved to a room change by our request. would stay here again.

review.title: Nice place and good location!
review.reviewText: We arrived after a very long day of traveling and the front desk was so helpful and kind.  We were please how comfy the beds were.  Very safe and convent location.  We had a great stay!

review.title: Nice close to the Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We had a short trip planned and this hotel was within walking distance to everything that we wanted to do minus the tours we took. The accommodations were fine. The food was expensive but there was a great place right across the street which was great.

review.title: Nice hotel one block from the wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed for two nights.  It was a good location with everything we needed within walking distance. The staff was helpful and friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

The location is very convenient. It's very close to fishermans wharf, China town, and lambord street; not very far from the golden bridge either. The room was okay, nothing too impressive. But I did notice that the staff there is very unfriendly. No smiles, no greetings. The bellman was even yelling at our uber driver. I do recommend this hotel if you want to stay close to the locations I mentioned earlier but if you're not on a very tight budget, I think you can do better. I heard that Pier 2620 is good. We booked the hotel in a short notice but if you plan ahead, I think both hotels have similar rates.

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to all attractions
review.reviewText: I was fortunate to receive a room on the top floor facing the courtyard. It was incredibly quiet, completely shielded from traffic noise from the busy surrounding streets. The room was very comfortable and the hotel is walking distance to bus tours, the wharf, Fort Mason Centre, and several excellent restaurants. There are also computers and printers on the 5th floor, which made it easy to check in and print my boarding pass prior to leaving. There did not seem to be room service available for lunch or supper, but otherwise it was a wonderful place to stay.

review.title: Great location to the Warf
review.reviewText: It was the perfect location but our room was on the street level and we could hear everyone walking by and we had to keep the curtains closed at all times because the bus stop was right at our window

review.title: Very overpriced hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel quality is way below your average holiday inn. Dated rooms, had to ask for housekeeping to clean our room, staff is not readily available. It was very hard to reconcile spending so much money for such a low quality hotel. We picked it because of location, and it was very convinient.

review.title: very convenient location, great staff
review.reviewText: First of all great front office staff and got the rooms very early. Needed a bar fridge which was provided without a delay. Great location. Everything is in walking distance. And No homeless people hanging around
review.positiveRemarks: location, staff and comfort. Its a great place to stay in San Francisco. Great value  for money. Its a safe  area too. Within walking distance to pier
review.negativeRemarks: Need to provide a bar fridge to the room.
review.locationRemarks: Lovely eating places, the pier, the cable cars all around the hotel

review.title: Really close to the wharf and very nice visit.
review.reviewText: Room was nice and clean and very quiet . Very convenient location and nice parking. Overall pleasedimensions with our stay and will definitely be back.

It was very nice and in a great location for us.  We were in the building with a view of the of wharf and the bay.

Only problem was that we were far from the dining area.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly located down by fisherman's wharf . my only real complaint was that the ice Machine didn't work on our floor. besides that it was a great stay
review.negativeRemarks: Parking cost for guest

review.title: Prime location/near the tourist attractions.
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and the parking was convenience. Had to spray Lysol to disinfect the musky scent in the room. Let's say the Lysol spray and the musk scent had its war.  It helped reduced the scent by 50% but good thing we were out and about all day.

review.title: Street noise loud during night
review.reviewText: Room was ok but on ground level with an ally way and bins behind it, would have preferred being a level higher to feel safer. So much street noise from outside room from garbage and street cleaning making it very hard to sleep with all the banging, hotel does provide you with ear plugs so must be constant issue. Great position though to walk to Fishermans wharf.

review.title: Very close to beach
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in nice location. I advise to live in.

review.title: High price, few amenities
review.reviewText: $300 a night and paper cups for coffee from a coffee maker that didn't work.  No coffee in the lobby as most hostels and motels have these days.  No cafe open during the day for lunch.  You just expect the best at these prices..

review.title: Nice hotel that was close to everything we needed.
review.reviewText: Great atmosphere in the lobby, courteous and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable, nice linens.

review.title: Great location close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to fishermans wharf. Holiday inn has a large amount of amenities, that allow people to enjoy their experience and comfort.

review.title: Good area
review.reviewText: Was easy to get around and close to lots of things
review.locationRemarks: Wharf, public transportation, restaurants

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Everything was very nice, we had a nice view of the Golden Gate and Alcatraz from our room. Would not hesitate to book there again.

review.title: Great location. Close to everything
review.reviewText: We checked in on a Saturday and left Tuesday. The location is excellent. It is in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Close to restaurants and easy walking distance to wharf activities. The only thing that generally disappoints me is when any hotel charges a lot of money for parking. This hotel is no exception. And that is disappointing.  But the hotel was nice and we enjoyed staying there

review.title: Staff very friendly.....Great location!!!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay and loved being within walking distance to the Wharf.... Thought the parking rate was a little pricey....
Close to beach and Fishermen s Wharf.Good Staff Clean rooms.

review.title: Close to the wharf
review.reviewText: Staff was attentive and food was great. Came in late but check in was a breeze. Good area lots of restaurants and things to see. A short walk and you have a good view of the Golden Gate Bridge
Have not stayed in a Holliday Inn for years...rates alongside the big & better chains
The staff is very efficient, they could have more choices  in the restaurant, one night was very noisy, loud music and voices,  but in all, it was a good place to stay.

review.title: So close to attractions, very convinient.
review.reviewText: Met some people who came in on Princess ship so it was very convinient to meet them.
review.positiveRemarks: clean, very comfortable bed and pillows, close to attractions.
review.locationRemarks: close to Fisherman's Warf, Piers

review.title: Overall disappointing..
review.reviewText:
We stayed here Thursday-Sunday.  When we checked in to the hotel at the address given per the Expedia listing we were sent to a separate building which is actually a Holiday Inn Express.  

We were put in a room right on the corner of a busy street.  They did provide ear plugs which are definitely needed.  When we arrived there was tape holding up the soap shelf in the bathtub.  We thought that the room had possibly been renovated recently and that the tape would be removed when the cleaning crews came the next day... no such luck.  It stayed up the entire trip.  

I called room service and the front desk several times upon our arrival to sit on the other end of a ringing telephone.  All I wanted was to have a corkscrew sent up to our room.  I ended up having to call the front desk from my cellphone at the number in the listing.  I was then told that I was actually staying in the Express side of the hotel so that I would have to call their front desk.  I was transferred back to the same front desk that I had been trying to get a hold of and they finally answered on the transfer.  If I'm staying in a separate hotel then I should have been notified as we would have changed our arrangements.  Also, needless to say, we did not end up ordering room service due to this.

Overall, I was disappointed with this hotel.  It was a good location but there are about 100 different other hotels that we could have stayed at and gotten a better deal.  I will not be staying here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Outside of the tape in the bathtub the room seemed fairly clean.
review.negativeRemarks: See comments from above.

review.title: Great Home Base

Hated popcorn ceiling.

review.title: Location was great but complex old

review.title: Problems
review.reviewText: The tub was dirty.  The room was loud.  There was an all-night party in the room next door, so nobody could sleep.  Our room was also ground floor next to a lobby where homeless people argued and howled.  The heated pool was cold.  $54 for parking is a sin.  I bought a $1.50 soda from the machine which only accepts credit cards, and was charged $5.
review.negativeRemarks: Much

review.title: Good price and good location
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed the stay, walking distance to major in-town attractions and a quick trolley ride to those that are further away.  Room was comfortably sides for an in-city stay.  Rooms were clean and staff was helpful.  Parking was in underground garage, expensive, but it was what seemed to be the going rate in the area.

Lots of great places to eat nearby, and the city has an endless supply of things to do.  I recommend checking out Boudin for some delicious fresh sourdough, just a few blocks away on Fisherman's Warf.

Minor downsides, outdoor pool seems like an afterthought at street level between the surface level parking lot and the hotel.  The fitness area/room is exceptionally small and poorly equipped as compared to most hotels.

review.title: uncomfortable bed and small room

review.locationRemarks: We walked across the Golden Gate bridge from here. It's also close to the end of the Powell cablecar line, and right on the trolley line.

review.title: Close to everything.

photos.caption: that's a bed bug and they didn't want to admit it is.

review.title: Horrible hotel with BED BUGS in their room!
review.reviewText: This was the worst stay ever. We found a bed bug in the room and called the front desk right away. Instead of sending a manager in charge, they sent in a cleaning lady to "take a look" and eventually took the bug with them. I wanted a refund for the stay and they were being very stingy and technical saying we didn't discover the bed bug till 2 days after the stay. They also made us feel out a investigation form for the "3rd party" company to verify if there were any bed bugs in that room when apparently there was living bed bug right in front of their face. Do not come here unless you want bed bug bites all over your body.  Also they charge you per night for using a refrigerator and for using a microwave.
review.positiveRemarks: NOTHING. I wanted to give 0 stars for this hotel review but can't even do that.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything needs to be improved, hotel staff. Improve on the way they advertise their hotel amenities as well. If there is additional charge, print it

review.title: Pleasantly surprised! Great location.
review.reviewText: We arrived early for our reservation, but because the room was available we were allowed to check in early. We certainly appreciated that feature. The room and bathroom were very clean. Room temperature was adjustable and comfortable. The location was great: one block from public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, proximity to Denny's Restaurant.

review.title: Nice hotel within walking distance to fishermans
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean. Staff was super nice. Parking fees were high at $45 but could walk to fishermans wharf and ghiradelli square very easily.  Would stay here again.
Friendly and helpful staff. Convenient to many tourist locations in SF.

review.title: Good hotel in good location
review.reviewText:
We found this hotel to be expensive even at Expedia prices. However we wanted to feel safe and having read some unsettling reviews
regarding hotels in the centre of the city we decided to pay a bit more for the better location. The room was a bit dated and did not have a mini bar or master light switch but the staff we encountered were all friendly and helpful and we made good use of the guest laundry. The location was perfect with immediate access to Fisherman's Wharf and also close to 2 of the cable car lines. Other public transport options were available if we wanted to go into the city. So overall we were satisfied but would have preferred to have paid a bit less!

review.title: Close to all the goings on!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here.  It was within walking distance of Fishermans Wharf, piers, cable cars and mass transit.  Have no complaints about the Hotel, except we were on the 5th floor and the street noise couldn't have been much louder if the window was open.  Which was sort of entertaining.  We enjoyed our stay and would recommend staying here, it was fun.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to transit and Fishermans Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast prices were way too high.  I can't see paying $50 for the 2 of us to eat breakfast.

review.title: Clean, comfy stay right off Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Holiday Inn is my go-to hotel chain. I've been traveling a lot recently and if I see a good deal for Holiday Inn, I immediately book it because I know it will be clean. This one is no different. I went with a big family this time and they all enjoyed the location. It's right where we needed to be for a touristy vacation (Fisherman's wharf, close to Chinatown and the Golden Gate Bridge).

I would say that some of the amenities are quite expensive (breakfast and parking are in the hefty double digits). I didn't get any of those, however, because who would get hotel food when they're in the middle of a seafood haven? Parking was especially good for us that weekend since it was a holiday. I would recommend calling 311 to see if alternate side parking is suspended. Otherwise street parking MAY be hard to find but on a rainy day, there will be plenty. Also be aware of the street parking fares as they vary from block to block. Of course, don't forget to feed the meter because I saw lots of tickets.

review.title: Don't eat there.
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, but don't eat in their restaurant.  Crazy high prices.  There are a lot of other less expensive and wonderful choices around there.
review.negativeRemarks: reasonable prices at the restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Ghiradelli square and wonderful restaurants are close by.  The cable car line is also close.  The wonderful Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39

review.reviewText: Excellent location, walking distance to all kinds of interesting things. Rooms were dated but clean and serviceable. Outdoor pool is heated in the winter. Local nightlife was loud with music we could hear clearly in our 4th floor room. Parking is very expensive but if you are patient you can park on the street overnight.

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Nice location, close to everything, walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Plenty of parking spaces on the street at night. No need to use to hotel garage.
Hotel was clean and served our needs; staff very pleasant and responsive.
Close to the waterfront, but was put in side building upstairs of Denny's restaurant. No room service for lunch

review.title: Love San Francisco
review.reviewText: Omar upgraded us to a business room and the view was wonderful!  Housekeeping did a great job with our room!  We were able to relax in our room.
review.negativeRemarks: They didn't know about busses nearby?
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel terrible service
review.reviewText:
We were 65 and 78 year old woman who checked in to this hotel and not once did the valet help with luggage they gave us a large luggage cart and we had to fend for ourselves. This cart had a bad wheel and would not move by the time we got this cart up to our room we were so frustrated we were ready to check out. Then there was notification in bathroom that we had to reuse our wet towels!!  
I have stayed in less expensive hotels with more immenities. Will never stay there again.

review.title: Good option for Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
This Holiday Inn is a nice hotel, comfortable, staff are terrific (except for only one), the room cleaning staff were lovely.  They even left us a note to thank us for the tip, and having travelled through the US for three weeks now, that is the first time that has happened.
Be aware of booking, if you want queen beds, then this isn't the place for you.  They do have King Beds but I didn't read it properly and ended up with double bed.  
Only negative, is we picked up a hire car, and they charged us $US51 to park it.  When I raised that I thought this was excessive, the car was there for less than 12 hours, the reception desk informed me that was the going rate in the area.  Given we stayed there for five days (x 2 rooms) took breakfast in their dining room, bought stuff in their store etc etc, I would have thought that waiving this fee might have been an act of good will - if you need to park your car, then this option becomes less affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking price is outrageous.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Fishermans Wharf, transport, cable car, Big Bus (great way to see the city).

review.reviewText: Good overall. Parking fee is alittle steep roughly $50/day after fees.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Just OK hotel, expensive parking, beds were comfy, room was pretty basic otherwise
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger bathrooms (more counter space), more updated bathroom finishes, suites with 2 beds (as pictured on the website; we were they didn't exist)
review.locationRemarks: Good location near Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great stay in the city.
review.reviewText: I had an excellent stay here. Thus was my third time at this hotel, and they never disappoint. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The rooms are always clean. And the location couldn't get any better. This hotel is within walking distance of everything at the wharf.

review.title: happy
review.reviewText: Very nice staff. Happy and smiling. Room and hotel were clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds could be more comfortable
review.locationRemarks: Close to fisherman so wharf

review.title: really bad experience

1 the air conditioner does not work properly.
2 the bathroom is extremely cold
3 the mattress is damp.

I have  five-day reservation. but I left on the second day. Really terrible!!!!!!!!!!

Staff very helpful and knowledgeable of the city recommended their favorite spots which were fabulous 
Our overall experience at the Holiday Inn was great!
A little noisy on the weekend as we are close to the street. Andthe vending machine took my money without giving me anything.

review.title: Nice hotel close to fisherman's wharf

I made reservation thru Expedia. The price was reseaonable averrage 145 a day with tax. But parking was extra. 45 dollars with tax a day! 
Please read line when make a reservation!

review.title: Wonderful Staff
review.reviewText: We went to the city to go to UCSF.  The hotel was so accommodating for us. We could also walk to everything and this staff was so helpful in directions, help for family that came to visit our patient.  Nice to have a place to eat right in the hotel.  Will stay here again and have also told many how great this hotel is and highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: All that I order from Expedia, I don't get a room in a very good area.  San Francisco and our window looked out at another wall.  No views ever.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance for everything, the ocean included.

review.title: Good location nearby restaurants
review.reviewText:
Used hotel for 2 nights during a west coast road trip. Great location in fishermans wharf, with many restaurants & the boat area within easy walking distance. Plus cable car station easily reached by foot.
Chargeable self Parking was available, which seemed expensive at around 50 dollars a night but not unusual for this city & the car was in a safe area with ease of access without valet. 
Check in was efficient & friendly. 
The room was fine, except the windows were not well insulated & allowed a lot of noise at night. The room overlooked the cannery & had nightclub noise from open doors there & people on the street, so I'd recommend taking a room that does not overlook that area unless the hotel upgrades it's Windows or enforces noise control at the nightclub. 
Breakfast was included, but they issue vouchers as not everyone has this included & some a la Carte items are chargeable. This was initially a bit confusing, plus We got a check to sign, but the hotel charges zero because of the voucher.

review.title: Close to pier 39
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a good location. Walking distance to pier 39 and good restaurants.
great location and good value for the price - parking onsite

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is great would stay again.  Right by the water although the view is not great.  Close to Ghiradelli square & 2 cable car locations easy walking for just about everything.

review.title: Nice experience to stayin a busy city
review.reviewText: We got to the hotel late due to holiday traffic. The staff is very professional and list other option of parking if we choose not to stay with the hotel but we rather give them the business since they are honest to me. The room is comfortable but the bed is more like full size instead of queen size that make disappointed a bit. Over all, this hotel offer what they can and keep up their standard list of amenities to help make my stay pleasure.

review.title: Great hotel. Awesome location.
review.reviewText: We only stayed for 1 night and would definitely do it again. The location is great, within walking distance of the best tourist attractions in San Francisco and access to public transportation. Room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: They charge too much for parking. If i'm already paying for a room, i think 50 extra dollars for parking is excessive.

review.title: Perfect Location

review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was great, restaurant and lounge lacked a little but with so many locations around the hotel this was not a problem
review.negativeRemarks: If you own a car that you are using to get around the parking fees here are expensive
review.locationRemarks: Much to do all around hotel

review.title: Close to the Warf but....

I stayed 3 nights two of those nights, I was meet in the hallway by a hooker looking for her John, when I called the front desk I was told security would be right up but an hour later she was still there!

review.positiveRemarks: Can`t think of one special thing

review.title: Disappointing stay

There were no perks in the room like we were accustomed to in other less expensive accommodation. It was very disappointing.

review.title: Ok for location

Ok no complimentary coffee in lobby.

Great location, close to trams car rental great food

review.title: Great location by the wharf.
review.reviewText: Lots of sea food restaurants nearby.

review.title: Nicely located hotel for the $
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here. Nicely located near the fishermans wharf area and Ghirardelli square. For the $ we thought this hotel a offered clean room at a reasonable price nice located to several Bay Area attractions.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: Location was perfect as it's close to everything. Hotel needs more staff, we've asked for help with our luggage which took Nearly 2 hours (not even exaggerating) and we had to come back downstairs 3 times. There's plenty more hotels in the area that I would recommend. On the other hand, front desk staff were pretty friendly and the room was clean and so is the overall hotel.

review.title: lJust what we needed friendly polite and very help

review.negativeRemarks: nothing just great

Parking was good but with in and out privileges and a normal price for SF. Really liked location. Walked to restaurant in the evening and in the morning had bkfst in small cozy diner across the street. Then walked along wharf enjoying ocean breezes.

review.title: I always stay here when I go to San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Never a bad experience. Favorite place to stay. I like this place a lot. I hop is down the street a bar right across!

review.title: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Close to wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with good location close to wharf.  Park by hotel home to several homeless.

Hotel is central to Fisherman's Warfvarea and attractions. We checked in very late, midnight. Night clerk was somewhat rude and didn't know what he was doing. Hotel was clean, rooms nice, comfortable. Denny's overpriced.

review.title: Nice Hotel in Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText: Nice and clean.  Staff was very friendly and within walking distance of shopping and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and simple.  Staff was very friendly.  Location.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, Bars, Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: If you're going to be exploring San Francisco and have the Fisherman's Wharf area in mind this place is perfect.. walking distance to the entire wharf experience ... plus most of the bay tours leave from easy 5 -10 min. walking distance. ... from the Wharf area you can also rent bikes for a 10 mile ride along the shore to the golden gate bridge and into Sausalito...then catch the ferry right back to the wharf and walk back to the hotel.   Even the city Bus Tour (hop on ,  hop off ) stops almost directly in front of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and we felt very safe in the area
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't pay attention to the fact that you need to pay an additional $45 / night IF you want to park your car on the property.

review.title: Nice hotel, but very noisy
review.reviewText: We never got a good nights sleep because the windows are not sound proof and you can hear all the traffic. The room doors are very heavy and you can hear all the doors slamming day and night, along with anyone talking in the hallway.

review.title: Good Room, Close to Wharf and eats.
review.reviewText: Room was clean. Average size with king bed, desk and arm chair. Had a mini fridge which was great to store our pop and water we bought. We put in the other holiday inn, not the main building, which was fine however it faced the street so you could here people walking by and traffic but it did quite down at night to sleep. Ac worked which was good as it was quite warm for October. There was some loud noises in the room above us...I think they were renovating some of the rooms so that was a bit annoying but it didn't last long and only during the day. All in all it was a good stay and the front desk was very helpful for info and directions. Only real complaint was the TV had no guide so you didn't know what was on or what was going to be on. It would have been nice if there was a guide on the tv to tell you what was on or at least a printed guide so you could see what you wanted to watch.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great! Blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, lots of good places to eat and right near the bus stop and cable car loop.

review.title: San Francisco Holiday Inn Oct 3-4
review.reviewText: I would recommend to anyone that wants to stay in the Wharf area, place is safe and within walking distance to Pier 39. The employee's were helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of things in the gift shop and breakfast, to high for the common person. I don't smoke, but cigarettes were $14 per pack, that's high!
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 and Trolley was great and close by, great location

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText: Room is okay, bed was comfy. The ac fell of the wall during our stay...

review.title: great location, close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: It would have been nice to have free coffee in the lobby...

review.title: Great location close to fisherman's warf
review.reviewText: They allowed us a late checkout and we were able to leave our car in the garage so we didn't have to find another spot in between two tours we were taking.

review.title: nice hotel right on fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice but they don't make it clear that there are actually two buildings in different blocks. As a result when we arrived for checking we were then taken to the next building down (a block away) and to our rooms their.  Very expensive hotel for the amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: nice clean room, good room service and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: refrigerators in rooms and microwaves. I know these could be requested for a fee, but really what hotel doesn't have these basic amenities.
review.locationRemarks: this hotel is 1 block from fishermans wharf, about 5 minute walk to pier 39.

review.title: Close to the warf but not worth the trouble!
review.reviewText: Check in at one building, parking somewhere else, room was a block away. $50 per night for handicapped parking not even in the building my room was in. Hammering at 8am, maid entered our room at 8:15 am without knocking . People screaming in the street all night outside the hotel. Bed was hard as a rock. Need I say anymore? Don't bother
Very nice room with great location. Walking distance to wharf and all bus and ferry ports.
review.negativeRemarks: Tell people about the different buildings

review.title: Visiting the oldest childest!
review.reviewText: Central to all activities we were interested in, Pier 39, Scomas, all within walking distance! Wonderful.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location.
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants and other points of interest.  Public transportation right there, making it easy to get around and not have to rent car if only seeing the city.  Rooms were very clean and comfortable.  What hotel staff we did interact with where very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Denny's restaurant co-located on property very disappointing.  Using leaf blowers first thing in morning outside room windows.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 couple block walk.  Multitude of great restaurants nearby.  All types sight seeing companies in the area.  Good place to sleep when seeing cit

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Good location but little bit overpriced. Breakfast is overpriced and so is the room fees. Best for a 3day stay at most. Crappy wireless internet.
Walking distance to all the food joints I wanted to try. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and nice.

review.title: Nice hotel but noisy
review.reviewText: We were put on the pier side and there was a lot of traffic and garbage trucks. Then the insulation is thin because you could here your neighbors alarm clock then shower start at 4 am.

review.title: Great hotel location
review.reviewText: Fabulous location near Fisherman's Wharf but very expensive and just an ordinary hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the price
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf is within walking distance.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: The check in person had his nose stuck way up in the air. Breakfast was in no way worth the money. They also charged 45 dollars per day for parking which wasn't told ahead of time. Bartender was great, prices were very expensive, so was referred to a liquor store right across the street. Most of the other employees were nice, rooms were fine. No I won't go back.

review.title: Too expensive for the experience.
review.reviewText:
We thought we rsvp'd a single bed room according to expedia. We did not get this. Fine. 

We thought we could get some breakfast, we were told we had to pay first by the staff. Could not even get a cup of coffee. Have to read the terms of our stay. We thought parking was included, NO! It is another $50 dollars per night. We would have opted for another hotel that was more transparent with their prices. Staff seemed a bit lazy and indifferent.

review.title: Nice hotel, two blocks from fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText:
Very nice, clean, great staff.... Not many amenities such as continental breakfast or even free coffee... Kinda bummer in that respect.
Plus side... nice pool, and very close (walking distance) to cable cars and  all wharf activities. Would definitely stay here again.

Location optimal, the room is spacious and very clean, bathroom is spacious and very clean, the lobby is nice. As a downside, the wi-fi connection was almost non existent. The hotel's assistance regarding this issue was not good.
review.negativeRemarks: The internet needs to be upgraded.

review.title: Perfect for touring Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText: Great location,  Hotel was clean, most staff were pleasant but mechanical in personality. Know you will pay $45 per day for parking but that is competitive with area. We could leave our car till 6PM on day of checkout which was a plus. This facility has 2 buildings...know which building you will be in when you buy...little walk with luggage if in second building. Both are nice.  Dennys restaurant in second building.
review.negativeRemarks: Busy weekend...staff seemed tired.
review.locationRemarks: This is fishermans warf...google it...lots to do.

review.title: Nice hotel but lower floors are noisy outside
review.reviewText: Great central location to the event I was attending. Walking distance to The Alcatraz Invitational Swim.
Great location.  Walking  distance to everything.  Bus line right across the street.  I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.  I would recommend to family and friends .  Thank you.

review.title: Friendly hotel near pier
review.reviewText: Nice room, friendly staff, and convenient to bus lines. Our room faced the pier. There are a lot of shops and restaurants close by.

review.title: Hotel close to fantastic restaurants
review.reviewText:
The receptionist was very compassionate when I told here we woke up at 3:30 a.m. to catch our early flight. She immediately gave us a room when we appeared at the desk at 11 a.m. She gave us  names of restaurants that discounts. The staff were very helpful in every way they can.

We wold like to go back to stay there next trip to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the wharf where everything we need is available such as massage parlor, restaurants, drugstore and Grayline bus for tours!

review.title: Staff is very good.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, very clean.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  Close to all the restaurants and sto
review.positiveRemarks: Everyone was very willing to help us.  Staff greeted us with a smile from the front desk to the cleaning staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish you had a bar to unwind after a long day.  We ended up at the Marriott paying ten dollars per wine glass.  The side doors need key access.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel.  Walking distance to the pier.
review.reviewText: Hotel was great.  Easy access to everything we came for.  Parked the car and didn't have to get back in it until we left so that was perfect.  The only complaint would be the cost of parking.  $43 plus tax was $49.  Made the overall price of the hotel not that great.  With that being said, parking is ridiculous in San Francisco so it is what it is.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper parking
review.locationRemarks: Location centrally located by Pier 39 and Embarcadero Street.

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: This was within 1 block of fisherman's wharf. The only issue we had was the multiple buildings of the hotel. We checked in at the main building and had to walk to a building about a block from the main building.
review.negativeRemarks: Warning about multiple buildings

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: The room was certainly clean but the beds were small, the facility aged, and the wi-fi was terrible/unreliable. Despite paying extral $40/night for a 4th person, I had to call and ask for the fourth set of towels every day (why was this so hard for them?). There is no breakfast included like at the Holiday Inn Express next door yet I paid just as much to stay. Not even free coffee in the lobby. The staff members were pleasant and responsive when I complained (which I appreciated). We won't be back unless we can't get in anywhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, breakfast included, coffee in the lobby and fix the terrible wi-fi service.

review.title: One block from Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Since we have a baby with us , walking distant is important and Holiday Inn has the perfect location , not far from the actions but not too noisy like some other hotels on the main street.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of excellent seafood restaurants but they are pricey.

review.reviewText: It was a nice stay. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

review.title: Ok hotel, close to tourist stuff
review.reviewText:
So I took my kids to San Fran the weekend before school started. The location is great, but there are some issues. 
1.there is no breakfast unless you want to pay $30 per person for a crappy buffet. An they won't let you bring it to your room.
2. Our room was situated right next to the pool, which would have been fine if it wasn't that out curtain was missing! By the time we realized it, we were tired, and decided to just turn the lights down and try to sleep our two nights. Well, having strangers stare at you while you sleep is super awkward and I wouldn't recommend it to anybody. Room 137. 
Parking was almost $100 for two nights!!! Not mentioned until we got there. 
Those are my gripes. But the staff was super friendly and helped us navigate the city. Thank you! 
Would I return? Probably not. There are other hotels super close, and I would rather pay the extra money to them for a comfy inclusive nights stay.

review.title: Close to tourist spots
review.reviewText: We find the housekeeping staff friendly and warm. They made us feel welcome.. The opposite is true with the baggage staff and front office--very formal/stiff and seldom smile... We felt uncomfortable relating to them..

review.title: Very expensive for below standard service
review.reviewText:
This hotel is clearly part of a big corporation that worries about the bottom line instead of their customers.  Rooms are expensive, do not include breakfast, they charge extremely expensive for parking in their parking lot and a cup of coffee is more expensive than in Starbucks.  
Please go back to please your customers.  Give them at least breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: More customer friendly
review.locationRemarks: The beach and Pier 39

review.title: Very nice hotel that's close to the bay.
review.reviewText: With in walking distance of many things to do.  No need for a rental car.

review.title: Very nice, Clean & Comfortable, Great location!
review.reviewText:
Clean and comfortable rooms.
Pier 39 is fifteen minute walk to the east. Ghirardelli Square is ten minute walk to the west.
Restraurants and all kinds of shopping in between.
it was a great stay , we had a real nice room on first floor and the staff was excellent .
review.negativeRemarks: parking is way to $

review.title: Nice Hotel, oversize vehicle parking
review.reviewText: Nice location next to many different places to eat.  I was excited that my oversized vehicle was able to park with no problems.  Check out is 12 noon but can leave your car in lot until 6pm the same day.

review.title: very close to every thing
review.reviewText: went on many tours booked at hotel they were verry helpful
review.negativeRemarks: s ound-proof rooms on anoisy street
review.locationRemarks: fisherman -wharf

review.title: The parking sucks
review.reviewText: I was sent to the Dwarf Hotel which wasn't  as nice as the Main one. I had to Park at Main hotel not in the Dwarf because  there wasn't  never parking. I payed a lot  for parking which I fill I it should be waved because I was not close to my Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking was terrible. I stayed at the Dwarf hotel. I never was a able to park my car there ! I had to walk to the Other building to Park.
review.locationRemarks: location was great did a lot  sight seeing

review.title: Close to k zone
review.reviewText: The best is that is very close to the S Francisco most touristic area. The worst is the price of the parking

review.title: Family get away
review.reviewText: We traveled to San Francisco with our 6 year old for a little get away. We knew we wanted to stay right near to Pier 39 and that we wouldn't be in our room much at all.  This hotel is perfect for that. Easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz tours, cable cars, Ghiradelli Sqare and a short taxi ride to watch the Giants play.  The rooms are clean and small.  Ours had two double beds that were ok comfort wise.  The "restaurant" attached is a Denny's- not really our thing but there is a Starbucks across the street & many other places to eat nearby.  I do wish the room had a refrigerator and was told that was not an option even as in upgrade.  Traveling with a child we like to stock snacks, etc but we managed! For the price we paid and the accessibility to all we wanted to see and do it this hotel was worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerator in the room (or at least offered as an option)
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, Alcatraz tours, aquarium, Ghiradelli Square-all easy walking distance

review.reviewText: Great location!  Friendly staff, very helpful. Close to several attractions.

review.title: close to the wharf
review.reviewText:
Room and staff nice, our room did not get cleaned until we returned after 3pm and called..
No fan in bathroom
No microwave......
review.positiveRemarks: proximity to the wharf and surroundings were great.
review.negativeRemarks:
amenities lacking, as in microwave 
No exhaust fan in bathroom
No cost of the breakfast was crazy.....  $60 for 2 people
review.locationRemarks: close to wharf and transportation

review.title: Rooms far away from the front desk
review.reviewText: The front desk is in the main building and the room they assigned us was in the other building that was about a half block away. Since the parking lot was with the main building we had to walk a half block with all the baggage.

review.title: Awesome Location
review.reviewText: The staff we were in contact with were very pleasant, friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and for the last few days of our stay, we were given a larger fridge which was great!
review.positiveRemarks: It is very close to virtually everything that we needed.

review.reviewText: clean and quiet, short walking distance to Pier 39

review.title: Good location, surprise charges
review.reviewText:
Good and safe location to walk around the Fisherman's Wharf and to take cable car and bus to go anywhere. 
Decent facilities and nice staff. But the WiFi is slow and the fan in the bath is not electric. A good surprise is that they charge you $10/day for a room refrigerator and another $10/day for a microwave! (they provide them on first come first serve basis!) I am a frequent traveller and have never seen anywhere in the world that a hotel charges for a room refrigerator and a microwave, separately. As I stayed for 5 nights, I prepared some food to store in the fridge. I was so frustrated at their fridge charges in addition to the quite high room rate, I gave up my food. These charges were not written at the time of reservation.
review.negativeRemarks: Speed of WiFi, extra charges on fridge and microwave (this is ridiculous!).
review.locationRemarks:
Walking distance to Pier 39. Easy access to cable car, bus, tram to go everywhere. 
Many restaurants (quite expensive though) and shops close by.

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: From the beginning when we walked through the door everyone was so accommodating, helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable of the area. The room was immaculate, bed was the best the bathroom and towels were amazing! Located near Fisherman's Wharf, made it a very easy walk to the wharf, Ghiradelli square, and great food. Loved it !
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was wonderful. Would go back several times.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: The wharf and Ghiradelli Squre, near the cable car turn around, which made it very easy to get on the cable car. Great food and souvenir shops near by

review.title: Convenient location. Easy access to everything.
review.reviewText: We only had a short time in San Francisco. We needed a hotel that we could walk everywhere in fishermans wharf.  This was perfect. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Attention to detail
review.reviewText: First they gave us a room someone else was already in. The next room was suitable but in the morning I went to take a shower and there was an open soap but no one in my family opened it so I was creeped out that the shower (to me ) was not clean. Other than that nice location everything else was fine
Great location, easy parking. Very clean & up to date. Concierge was helpful. Felt secure as well.

review.title: Cold Pool
review.reviewText: The pool was not heated very well and was unable.

review.title: Very clean. Great location
review.reviewText: Great location & proximity to everything. Friendly staff. Parking easy. 2 double bed accommodations a bit tight for a family of 4. Room too small to add a roll away.

review.title: Nice hotel in a touristy location
review.reviewText:
Convenient and Great hotel as far as location is concern.
Hotel is a bit tired looking on the inside. Location is really convenient.
Highly recommended

review.title: Noisy area, busy corner
review.reviewText: close to Fishermans Wharf but really noisy corner. Was woken up before 6:00am with street noise.

review.title: Nice, close to everything
review.reviewText: Perfect location, close to almost all of sanfrancisco. I would stay there again

review.title: it was awesome
review.reviewText: Parking was pricey but right next to the wharf/ night life san fran. we adored it. the food was a little pricey at the buffet but we were by so many places to eat it didn't matter
review.negativeRemarks: less pricey buffet
review.locationRemarks: wharf,

review.title: Close to Pier,convenient.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but parking was high, and extra bucks. Even with a handicap placard.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location. Would stay there again. Clean. Polite staff.

review.title: Nice hotel and great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was nicer than I expected after reading other reviews. The location was very good and I felt reasonably safe in and around the hotel. The only negative was the noise. If you get a street side room the noise is bad, especially early in the morning and late at night. The hotel provided ear plugs that I found in a drawer.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location, the availability of a restaurant for breakfast and the overall cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise buffering for street side rooms, provide more information about the hotel, offer a continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Near fisherman's wharf, pier 39 and transportation to other locations of interest.

review.title: Nice hotel, local to everything.  Staff is great,
review.reviewText: I had a mess up with Expedia on my reservation and your staff was compassionate about meeting my needs.
review.positiveRemarks: staff, cleanliness, security was excellent, felt safe
review.locationRemarks: convenience to all locations- Golden Gate bridge, Alcatraz, Trolleys

review.reviewText: Overall the room was good other than we were on the first floor.  The shower walls needed to be cleaned though. Looked like someone who was dirty took a shower and the walls had not been cleaned after they left.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the shower walls
review.locationRemarks: Beach Street Grill was good but a little pricey; short walk

review.title: It was nice, but...
review.reviewText: It was nice, but lacked parking for the volume of guests.

review.title: Clean & close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: A little disappointed. Booked Fisherman's Wharf Holiday Inn but put in Holiday Inn Express when we registered. (they called it the Wharf building, but signs on the back of the building still say Holiday Inn Express) Had to walk nearly two blocks to the pool and fitness center. The Express was less expensive when reservations were made, but there was no price break when we were downgraded. The room it's self was comfortable and satisfactory but there was no 24 hour staffing. Don't know if this was a Holiday Inn issue or an Expedia issue.  We were traveling with two older grandchildren and had two rooms. I don't feel like we received the value we were expecting for the money spent.
review.positiveRemarks: Two adjoining rooms were clean and comfortable. Close to the Wharf area.
review.negativeRemarks: Ensure people know there is a possibility downgraded to a lesser facility upon arrival.
review.locationRemarks: Very easy walking distance to Pier 39, Wharf area and all transportation.

review.title: make sure you stay in original hotel not add on
review.reviewText: Our room was 350$ for one nite overlooked a parking lot and had incredible street noise from pedestrians and the trolly car which buzzed by all nite.  Dirty view of street very disappointed in room decor. Outdated for cost. Close to wharf but a distance to china town etc. for the $$ i would stay elsewhere.  Parking was additional 48$ per nite. Really after room cost was out the roof for a motel setting.  Dont stay here. Staff was good though pleasant and helpful. But room overpriced.

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: We had a great time. We road the trolley cars, walked to the wharf for dinner, walked to pier 39 and geridelli square, and relaxed some in the comfy room.

review.title: Would NOT  recommend for the price
review.reviewText: Room smelled of mildew,  they gave me an opened mouthwash left from previous guest.    Parking was an extra $49.00 (yikes, guess it's the price you pay for San Francisco.). Was very disappointed! The only positive was how friendly the staff was.

review.title: Nice hotel, nicely located
review.reviewText: Nice hotel located in a good location, easy access to different destination, by foot, bus, tram, and bicycle. Small outdoor pool makes children happy.

review.title: The Perfect location
review.reviewText: As the saying goes, "location, location, location." That sums up our experience staying at Holiday Inn, Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel is located in the perfect place for those who want a total experience of the Wharf, North Beach, and all the tourist spots surrounding those areas. We were able (and willing) to walk everywhere because the hotel was so perfectly located.
review.negativeRemarks: The Wi-Fi connection is marginal at best.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to China Town, which we did. Our girls, both teens, got the real SF experience because we walked and didn't just tour (expensive buses).

review.title: bad experience, poor internet service
review.reviewText: Beds very uncomfortable. Internet service was deplorable, even at their "business centre". Would not stay here again.

review.title: Great location to the wharf and transportation.
review.reviewText: Great city and a lot of fun. Close to the wharf and transportation systems.
Good location for tourists. Room so so. Room service at night was a fair price.

review.title: Dirty floor
review.reviewText: The bathroom and the room were dirty, the bathroom floor and the bathtub had hair all over them.  There was a pair of underwear by the bed. This is my second time staying  there we think the older building is much much better then the newer part.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: very enjoyable and convenient to many sites, food and shopping

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We arrived several hours before check-in but got a room immediately. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was nice and hotel was very clean. If you want to spend a lot of time on Fisherman's Wharf this is a great location.

review.title: San Francisco Holiday Inn on the pier.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was easy to find. The facilities are dated but reasonably clean. The hotel staff was knowledgeable and nice. We did not mind paying more for an "average" hotel to be closer to the action, however, we resented the hotel charging us over $50.00 a day for parking. It was a shock because other less expensive hotels did not charge us for parking. It seemed to defeat the purpose of paying more for a hotel, closer to the waterfront, to cut down on parking our rental car. During our stay at the Holiday Inn we did not have a view of the water. We spent little time in our room and used public transportation instead of our rental call to get around. It is our family consensus that paying the extra was not worth what we thought may be gained. 

The Graham Family .
review.positiveRemarks: The thought it would be a better value.
