review.negativeRemarks: Do not charge hotel guests to park their vehicles.
review.locationRemarks: It is a mute point. We had the same experience at another comparable hotel on other occasions for a better value.

review.reviewText: Motel is convenient but rather run down.  Now worth the price with all the other motels in the area.

review.title: Close to the Wharf.
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely located near many attractions. Lobby is clean, love being able to get an apple on my way out for the day. Room was small & old looking, it still had the popcorn ceiling & it was obvious is had dirt build up.  Friendly staff.

review.title: Hotel on wharf good location.
review.reviewText: Got there late. After dinner took off our shoes to find rug soaked. Large area near air conditioner. Almost 10. Ready for sleep. They sent towels.
review.negativeRemarks:
While checking out we tried to explain problem. Ignored 
The room looked out at garbage dump and graffiti wall. 
Very noisy all hours

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel 4 blocks from the waterfront. On the tour lines of the hop on hop off tour in town which is convient. Clean place, good parking, pool was nice.
review.positiveRemarks:
Clean, modern. 
Nice beds
Easy parking
review.negativeRemarks:
The Internet connection was terrible
$41. For parking may be customary, but way too much!
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39, trolling ect. Excellent location.

review.title: Excellent location. Clean, Comfortable & Safe.
review.reviewText: Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable.  The staff was very helpful in mapping out the city. Restaurant is open 24 hours.  Very safe.  Excellent location.
This hotel is old, outdated and too expensive for what you get.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations.  I was very pleased with everything through out this hotel.  I would highly recommend this facility.  If I come back to San Fransisco I would for sure stay at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything.  It was clean, staff was nice and the location was incredible.
review.negativeRemarks: The price is a little high but I guess that is how it is in California.
review.locationRemarks: One to two blocks from the wharf.  Restaurants and shopping right around the corner.  Trolley a few blocks away as well as the bay.  Great location.

review.title: Close to wharf right around the corner.
review.reviewText: We didn't really stay in the hotel long but it was nice coming back from a long day with the family. Cable and internet was good. Beds were comfortable no complaints. Excersice room was small but got the job done they could make it a tad bigger. The hotel was right around the corner from the wharf so it was easy access to everything. Parking was great no hassle but a bit expensive but well worth it for the family I would recommend this hotel to a friend or family member. The food court was not open when we stayed but the coffee shop was open. They did have room service until 10pm which we didn't use cause we just came from the wharf but they do have plenty of vending machines to choose some late night snacks which take cash or credit cards. nice and quiet no madness going on. The lobby was nice and the gift shop was open all night. I liked that they had security at the front door as you came through in the night.

review.title: Nice accomidations
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked in until the moment we left everyone was extremely helpful and friendly.

Air conditioner is on a motion sensor.  The unit turns off in the evening after you go to sleep.  Even though it was cool outside the room was hot around 2 am.  If you wave your hand in front of the unit it turns on.  You needed to get out of bed to do that.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the air control.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText:
Only one complaint is that there is not the curtain which can cover all of window, though my stay was 1st floor.
Staff was very polite and breakfast was awesome.
review.positiveRemarks: buffet breakfast and location close to sightseeing spots
review.negativeRemarks: curtain
review.locationRemarks: location is very good close to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard street.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
The Good:
Great location, clean room, and helpful staff. 

The Bad:
No fridge and $50/day parking

The Ugly:
TERRIBLE Internet

review.title: Nice convenient hotel with very expensive parking.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was nice and convenient to Fisherman's Wharf.  However parking was not convenient being in another building across the street and cost an extra $45/day to park.  No free breakfast included but there was an on-site Denny's in the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Reduced parking rates and closer to hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of activities around Fisherman's Wharf.  Also very convenient to jump on the trolley car to Union Square.  Just a short walk to Ghiradelli Square

review.title: good, but expensive
review.reviewText: at the center of SF downtown. ccharge additional 50$ for parking

review.title: Great fishermans wharf location
review.reviewText: Great location to walk to all attractions.  Ice machine on our floor out of order.  Room was clean.. Would stay here again.

review.title: Nice clean hotel close to fisherman wharf
review.reviewText: Great location. Nice hotel. Disappointed that they could not provide wifi and staff couldn't figure out the problem. The link they provided was not correct.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet and speed up checkin process

review.title: Nice clean hotel near Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Super friendly staff. Stayed at a new building across the street. Bathroom is new and clean. Quiet. Could see the Arcatratz island.

review.title: good location,  but pricey
review.reviewText: Pretty pricey for basic room, no mini-fridge. Pricey car parking, but was nice that it was underground (felt safe). My son enjoyed the pool, but still pretty chilly "heated" water.  Perhaps the three most annoying things upon arrival were: front desk person wrote room number on key envelope so sloppily, I went to the wrong room; not being told how the two very different-looking card keys worked; not being told how the elevator worked (you have to scan your key card to go up!) For the money I think I would look elsewhere next time.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy walking location to Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants, aquatic park.  Nice to have pillow options. Underground parking good, although very pricey.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk should have clarified room #, how keys work, how elevator works.
review.locationRemarks: It's SF: so much to see nearby. Aquatic Park, Wharf, National Parks SF Museum.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: No extras like, breakfast, frig in room, ect. Expensive parking.

review.title: Close to tour buses and fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: There were a few glitches with housekeeping not renewing supplies. The restaurant does a great sirloin steak at a really great price especially since restaurant prices in San Francisco are absolutely outrageous. This is not a luxury hotel by any means but for the location in San Francisco the Expedia package was very good value.

review.title: Great location and staff.
review.reviewText: Stayed 4 nights.  Will use the same hotel on the next trip.
review.locationRemarks: Location near Wharf, pier 39, Alcatraz, and AT&T ball park.

review.title: Nice and close to everything
review.reviewText: Loved how close it was to fisherman's warf, China town, cable cars, shopping and everything you'd want to experience in fisherman warf. We decided to skip the meal in the restaurant portion of the hotel and saved about 20 bucks. Eat elsewhere for cheaper. Parking is expensive but you can park and go as needed using room key and it goes until 6 pm the next day. Worth the 49 bucks I guess. Rooms were neat and clean, with room noise not bad at all. I recommend this hotel if you'd like to be close to the water and surrounding activities.

review.title: Handicapped accessible bathroom has grab bars
review.reviewText: I mentioned to Expedia staff when booking that my husband had health issues.  He is not in a wheelchair, but had recent surgery.  The room had an oversized bath with grab bars on toilet & shower.  Linens were crisply clean.  We were in their building across street from the check-in area where Denny's restaurant is downstairs.  The only warning is that self-parking is nearly $50/day.  Great tourist location easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf & cable car turn-around to Nob Hill.
review.positiveRemarks: Location of hotel for tourists;, size of bathroom if handicapped.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking was high. It was not noted in overall price of hotel, so add $50.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach, Buena Vista famous for their Irish Coffee, sightseeing hub for tourists.

review.title: You get what you pay for!
review.reviewText: The price was very reasonable when booked through Expedia. Was surprised to find that even-tho we booked a July 5 -7 visit in late April we we shuttled off the the overflow building one block to the East. The big surprise was the extra cost to park our car in the Holiday Inn underground parking garage. Guess it pays to read the fine print beyond the just reading that parking is available. The room didn't have a fridge.. they wanted to charge extra for that convenience. We ordered one and it was brought up to the room right away by maintenance. It was a Tiny Thing that they set on the floor and plugged it in and left. At check out they said they weren't going to charge us for the fridge... woo-who. The toilet seat was way loose. I fixed it myself instead of waiting for maintenance. I can't say if the main building rooms were better or not.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a great choice for 4 people 3 nights for 1/2 the others rates. Right on the the Wharf!!! Walking distance to everything. Would do it again!
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, Lombard Street, Exporitorium, Aquarium, Hyde-Powell & Powell-Mason trolly, F street car line, China Town, Fisherman's Wharf, Aquatic park

review.title: 2 stars
review.reviewText:
Very basic, but ideally located. Does not provide breakfast, toilets get clogged easily, the bed is very uncomfortable and we returned home with extreme body pain and did not feel well rested at all.
Room rates are high and not worth the price, room does not have a microwave or a refrigerator.
We had a good experience at the Holiday Inn. We were able to check in early and late check out.Breakfast was very expensive.Beds were comfortable.Overall pretty good.

review.title: cant sleep
review.reviewText: My room was on fourth floor yet I could hear trucks dumping trash all night. Not worth 270$.horrible.  More expensive to get a coke in hotel gift shop than San Fran airport. No free coffee station like hiltons. Rip off!!!
Location was excellent. Staff was happy to help you find where you were going.  Hotel was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Hotel close to many destinations
review.reviewText: Hotel clean with friendly staff. Walking distances to many attractions. I would definitely stay there again. The only draw back parking fees at hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid off hotel parking
review.locationRemarks: Walk easily to many attractions

review.title: Very nice and clean. Walking distance to everythin
review.reviewText: Great amenities and within walking distance to all the local attractions.

review.title: Nice hotel but a bit far from fisherman's warf.
review.reviewText: Our hotel check-in went smoothly however what was disappointing was they charge for parking which was surprising to me. Hotel guests should not be charged additional parking especially for $ 47.00 price per night. They attract you with a good hotel price per night which I booked through expedia for $ 162.00 but they add parking fee of $ 47.00. My husband woke up with a bad stiff neck because the pillow was uncomfortable. Our family next door had a problem with their exhaust fan in their bathroom. Our family next door was offered free breakfast by the engineer who went to their room to check the exhaust fan. We explained to the manager our experience and was kind enough to give us free breakfast because of the discomfort that we felt.
review.negativeRemarks: More comfortable pillows. Free parking fee for guests.
review.locationRemarks: Location was okay and close to stores but a bit far from fisherman's warf.

review.title: Old, need's remodeling
review.reviewText: Street noise was pretty bad, you can not relax in your room. Food at the hotel was nothing special, not a lot to choose from.  You can tell that they running it cheap.

review.title: Very convenience. Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. We will be come back in next trip.

review.title: Overpriced Property with Great Location
review.reviewText:
My family and I stayed at this property due to its location and really nothing more, as the hotel has not much to offer in the way of things in the room. The staff was very off putting as they advised that my IHG rewards card would not be accepted because Holiday Inn does not allow it due to a third party vendor (Expedia) being used to buy the room.  I had just stayed at a Holiday Inn at another location in CA and found this statement to be troubling, as the other property in Klamath, CA took my rewards card with no question. Either the check in clerk was lying or they do not know the policy at one of their hotels - not sure which.  

Rooms are fine and clean.  San Francisco is expensive so be prepared.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be more friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 are two blocks away.  Great location for sure.

review.reviewText: Internet does not work. Parking was impossible.  Rooms were nice.

review.title: Escape from San Francisco
review.reviewText: If you're looking for fun in the sun, this is not for you.  68 degree, overcast weather during the first week of July.  The restaurants are extremely overpriced and overrated.  The best meal had was at Denny's next to our hotel.  The hotel was great except for the breakfast buffet being $25 per person!  We are happy to have this trip off our bucket list, and even happier to be home!

review.title: Decent hotel, average stay
review.reviewText: It's what you would expect from a Holiday Inn or Holiday Inn Express...just a little more expensive since it's located in a touristy part of San Francisco. It's an easy walk to the water and Fisherman's Wharf restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location, staff very friendly but the bad part was we had to check in to the main holiday inn building and after that walk cross the street to the other building.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: It is very convenient to everything, but the facilities are in the main building. It is a bit of inconvenience if you stay in the another building.

review.title: Nice hotel close to wharf and transportation.
review.reviewText: Check in was quick and easy.  Paid parking, expensive, but nice and convenient.  All of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful.  Room was quiet, comfortable, and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the hotel's location, price for the area, the staff, and the room.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was in walking distance to the wharf, shopping, food, and the cable car turn-around.  You could get to just about anything you want to do.

review.title: Great hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: We had a great stay . Nothing spectacular but we really didn't need that. A simple hotel with a great breakfast, nice staff clean rooms and great locations. Great price as well. Would recommend to anyone!

review.title: Nice location, close to everything!
review.reviewText: Everything was exceptional except the reception.  We received a king and asked for a double.  Hotel receptionist explained he was sold out of doubles, which is understandable.  However, gave an attitude, saying because I booked on-line through expedia and got a "lower" rate, room preference not guaranteed.  It was rude.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel check-in personnel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  TONS of things to do!

review.title: Superb location, no driving needed!
review.reviewText: Location was perfect! A walk to Fisherman's Wharf and everything else. Room had a fridge and that was a plus. They moved us to Holiday Inn Express because the first room , bathroom was clogged and had hair all over. But they made up for that! Nice move.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel and room was just ok.  The bathroom could have been cleaner.
review.negativeRemarks: Spend more time cleaning the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: It is right in the heart of the tourist area of San Francisco.  Lots of activities.

review.title: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet hotel close to Starbucks, restaurants, and shops in Fisherman's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: Located in Fisherman's Wharf near shops, restaurants, and Starbucks.

review.title: Within two blocks of Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: We had a great time. The hotel was prime location to Fisherman's Wharf and it was actually pretty nice. I would stay near Fisherman's Wharf again if I go back. There are tons of places to stay that are still close and with transportation it's easy to get around and quick. You can go all over San Francisco in a couple hours and see most of the drive by attractions. We are glad we chose to stay by the water as that is where we spent most of our time and that is where a lot of the attractions on the GO cards were, or left from.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel does not offer a free continental breakfast and their restaurant is only open select times of the day. Food is not cheap in San Fran.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf has tons to do. Ferries, people watching, food, shops, souvenirs, aquarium, hop on hop off bus, street performers, piano stairs....

review.title: Great hotel, no need for rental car
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice, clean and convenient to everything you could need downtown. We walked everywhere including the Alcatraz dock at Pier 33. The Big Bus - Hop on/Hop off sightseeing bus also had a stop in front of the hotel so if you do the tour loop it will drop you back off in front of your hotel. Save money on rental cars and parking fees and bring tennis shoes.

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: Close to Alcatraz ride, close to the wharf and restaurants, close to the electric trolley, close to the cable car, close to In 'N Out Burgers, close to Chinatown, close to Ghirardelli, rather close to Chinatown,
review.positiveRemarks: We were in the tower that had Denny's was downstairs.  Convenient to eat there or take out food to the room for the kids.
review.negativeRemarks: Only bad thing about the hotel is it's parking rate--$43 per day per car was rather harsh and parking was tight.  We were in the newer tower but ...
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Convenient to most sight seeing
review.reviewText: Great hotel for 1-2 night stay. Rooms are clean and updated. Convenient to most attractions. 2 block walk to wharf and cable cars. Staff was friendly and helpful.

We noticed that parking was expensive $43 a night plus $6 tax, expedia listed price was $42 dollars and another website sanfranciso.com price was $32...... parking was full on first night. The bathroom needed a little extra cleaning as there was some orange mold that wiped off around the soap dishes and in the corner. This was reported to staff at check out. The room was nice. It was also effected by outside noise..... people  on the street below  and the loading of trucks .....
review.positiveRemarks: the room was large , tv was clear and good selection.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaning of bathroom and working on reducing noise would greatly increase appeal.
review.locationRemarks: Locational is great, close to pier 33 and 39, easy walk to cable car at hyde and beach, closing to other transport.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Clean, neat room.  Pleasant staff, accommodating.  Very convenient to all Fisherman's Wharf attractions, great restaurants, Ghirardelli Square, cable cars, bike rentals, ferry rides, etc. Worked out perfectly for our weekend getaway!

review.title: Noisy.
review.reviewText: Stayed here on the last day of a 10 day Bay Area vacation. Was given a room on the second floor. We heard crowds from street all night felt like they were actually in our room. Picking up of trash and deliveries started around 4 and never stopped. Needless to say an expensive non sleeping night.

review.title: very clean, new, spacious
review.reviewText: I STAYED ONE NIGHT THEN I WENT TO A CHEAPER HOTEL AND I COULDNT STAND IT. I WAS BACK AT THE FISHERMANS WHARF FOR 2 NIGHTS. I WONT DO THAT AGAIN. THE OTHER PLACE WAS A DUMP.
review.positiveRemarks: LATE CHECKOUT SINCE I SIGNED UP FOR HOTEL EMAILS, NO WAITING IN LINE BECAUSE I AM A PREFERRED CUSTOMER NOW
review.negativeRemarks: MY FIRST ROOM HAD A FRIDGE BUT I HAD TO WAIT HOURS TO GET A FRIDGE IN MY 2ND ROOM
review.locationRemarks: EASY WALK TO FRESH CHOWDER, IN AND OUT BURGERS, SOUVENIR SHOPPING

review.title: Very nice stay at the Holiday Inn!
review.reviewText: We wanted to stay in this area and get a great price. We didn't need luxury, since we didn't plan on being in the hotel much.  This hotel met our needs and we were very pleased with it.  The beds were comfortable and the room was pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The best thing for us was the location of this hotel. We wanted to be near the Fisherman's Wharf and fairly close to the Palace of Fine Arts.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is in 2 buildings across the street from each other, so we checked in at the main lobby, then had to exit and go across to our room.
review.locationRemarks: cable car, bike rental a block away, Starbucks down the street, wharf and shopping/dining down the street

review.reviewText: Location, location is GREAT! Most accommodating staff, comfortable beds with extra pillows, very clean rooms, housekeeping I felt took pride in their role. We would stay here again.

review.title: Nice and near the piers and activities
review.reviewText: The staff were really friendly and helpful.  They tried to take extra care to everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Handy to buses and tour offices
review.negativeRemarks: be able to change the thermostat from Celsius to English readings
review.locationRemarks: Powell Hyde cable car turnaround. good small restaurants for breakfast or lunch.  two blocks off the main road along the piers.

review.title: Generally good value for loacation
review.reviewText: Much as expected for Holiday Inn, very good location for Fishermans Wharf area. Street facing rooms can be noisy due to older single glazed metal frame windows.
review.negativeRemarks: Fit new double glazed windows
review.locationRemarks: Great for Fishermans Wharf area and sightseeing buses

review.title: Close to waterfront
review.reviewText: I was disappointed that we were put in a room in another building a block away from the main hotel, parking and amenities.  The hotel was quiet, and within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Guests should be warned that they may be in a building with no parking, nice restaurant, pool or spa. Rooms lacking refrigerator or spa.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel close to Pier 39, F line, trolley and bus tours.  Plenty of restaurants and touristy shopping

review.reviewText: Great location to interesting places fisherman a wharf pier 39 ghiradelli sq

review.title: Great all the way around
review.reviewText: short walk to fisherman's wharf, and Pier39. We had a great Bayview including fisherman's wharf, Alcatraz, the bay bridge  and all the bay activity.

review.title: Great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText:
Great value for money. Everything was great - if they want to attract & keep business travellers need to boost up band with of Internet - great it was free - more hotels should do this, but at times speed was so slow I could not work. 
Wi
Oils come back again if in SF.

review.title: Nice location but would look elsewhere next time
review.reviewText: Good location but we were surprised by the $43 per night self parking. Room was small but adequate. Small dated bathroom but it was clean. The worst part was how noisy it was outside starting at 6am. I will probably find another hotel next time. There were a lot around the area.

review.title: Excellent location!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located and accessible. Friendly staff and nice facilities.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel right in the middle of fishermans wharf.  In walking distance to the wharf, the sea lions and Lombard street.  About a 10 minute walk to Ghiradelli square.  Rent bikes from blazing saddles, they are great!!

review.title: Loved our stay
review.reviewText:
Close to everything we were in SF for, Fishermans Wharf,dinner at Tratoria Contadina (very good),
Good price
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: The little restaurant Tratoria Contadina is within walking distance and delicious! Also close to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel has an excellent location, close to Fisherman's Wharf, to car rentals like Hertz and Avis. There's a cable car stop right at the crossroad next to the the hotel. At night, it could be a bit noisy. The hotel provides earplugs but we didn't need to use them. It's less expensive than the hotels near Union Square, and has all the convenience. It's a bit old. Everything else was okay. I would recommend it for a short stay.
review.negativeRemarks: needs renovaition, not acustic enough
review.locationRemarks: close to cable car stop, Fisherman's Wharf, and car rentals

review.title: Great location at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: After a harrowing trip in the shuttle van from the airport we arrived early to the Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf. They knew we would be early and Alain checked our room and it was ready. Great news! Alain also gave us some maps of Fisherman's Wharf and the whole San Francisco area. He pointed out places to visit, to eat and, maybe most importantly, places to avoid. We trundled our bags to our room, and lo and behold, we had a fabulous view of the bay and Alcatraz. Exactly the room we had requested, plus the view. We were off exploring and every time we returned to the hotel, staff were attentive (always a smile and an hello) and helpful if you had a question. The housekeeping staff were always friendly and the room immaculate when we returned. Pool was great - we had it to ourselves and no issues with connectivity to the internet. We expect to return to San Francisco and will come back to the Holiday Inn. Thanks to everyone who made our trip memorable.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the view and most importantly, the staff!
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Only a couple minutes walk to great food and entertainment. Walk to Lombard Street, take the cable car, do it all.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: It's the perfect location to visit San Francisco. It's close to nice restaurants, pier 33 to go to alcatraz, tour bus offices, etc.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: Wifi a little slow, maybe too many people use it. But overall is good

review.title: Nice hotel close to the beach
review.reviewText: we stayed 4 nights at Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf. Our room was in the main building on the 5th floor.  It has a very nice view of the ocean and it is very quiet. The room is big and clean.   I will stay here again if I go to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: complimentary bottle water would be nice

review.title: Outstanding place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff were very accomodating since we had booked at another hotel.  But when the boiler was not repaired, we decided to go elswhere.  The hotel is close to everything down town - embarcadero and the warf area.  The room was wonderful - quiet and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: They charge $43/night to park.  It seems unreasonable to charge people for parking that are staying in the hotel - esp $43/night+tax!!!!
review.locationRemarks: close to the warf and everything down town.  A lot of wonderful things are up hill though! Keep it in mind.

review.title: close to the warf
review.reviewText: this hotel was close to fishermans warf and to the trolley system. it was comfortable (except for the bed) and was clean and easy to access. i felt safe and secure and enjoyed my vacation.
review.positiveRemarks: was close to fishermans warf but not too close
review.negativeRemarks: the bed could be improved, it was hard and uncomfortable
review.locationRemarks: fishermans warf (lots of eating and sights) trolley station (to get to downtown)

review.title: Hotel is okay--avoid the restaurant.
review.reviewText: Two eggs, two sausage, and potatoes for $27--and the eggs were over-cooked.

review.title: average accommodations -
review.reviewText:
poor wifi kept going in and out

at $350 cdn $ per night in line with comparable costs in the area
review.positiveRemarks: right at fishermans wharf close to pier 39 and pier 33 (Alcatraz) - everything including cable cars within 5 to 10 minute walk
review.negativeRemarks: wi fi needs improvement - kept going in and out
review.locationRemarks: fishermans wharf 5 minute walk - cable cars 10 minutes - right at fishersman wharf - lots fo restaurants and shops

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Great location. Walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz, cable cars, and bus stops to get you everywhere. Only negative thing... The water doesn't drain in the shower which I didn't like. Other than that the room/hotel was great and we were able to walk or catch a bus/cable car to everything! Would stay again.

review.title: No complaints!
review.reviewText: Would stay here again.  Great location to Pier 39 and the waterfront.  Stayed in the second building.  Was quiet and comfortable.  The second group in our party enjoyed their room.

review.title: Good central location,
review.reviewText: Five minutes walk from all the attractions, did not enjoy the fact that we were in another building away from the restaurant and main hotel facilities.

review.title: WiFi
review.reviewText: Wifi could be very slow, especially in the evenings, TV limited channels, had a slightly worn feeling to it, room was adequate, but the staff was usually excellent and well trained, epically the front desk and maids.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location is its saving grace/
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi and channel selection.

review.title: great location - close to everything
review.reviewText: I would always pick this holiday inn properties at the wharf.  Always a pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: explaining how the elevator and room works with the new key system.
review.locationRemarks: location is excellent

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: The only reason I would not recommend this hotel is the parking.  With the hotel being on two blocks and the parking only in one block, having our room in the block without parking was inconvenient for luggage transport and in/out use, especially with an infant involved.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and room features were good.  It was nice to look out to the marina.
review.negativeRemarks: A bridge between the two blocks would eliminate going out in the cold wind and transporting the luggage on the street.
review.locationRemarks: We went to the Giants game, but didn't have time to visit the shops and attractions.

review.reviewText: It was a good stay, close to the wharf and cable cars. Perfect location and quiet room.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: This is the 2nd time I've stayed here. The hotel is in a great location and close to everything. The room was clean, beds and pillows were comfy and sheets didn't have that stiff feel or motel smell. T.V. has lots of channels including NICK so my daughter could watch TV has we got ready. My only complaints would be having to pay $40-something for parking and that  house-keeping shows up way too early to clean.

review.title: Great Location-friendly Team
review.reviewText: We arrived Late to the City exhausted the front desk agent was very friendly I felt like I was an old friend to her! Rooms were very nice! Little bit of a bath tub ring! Location is ideal! I almost don't want to give to good of a review so  it won't be impossible to get reservations at this Hotel again!

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Had an awesome experience!! Staff was very helpful and always smiling!

review.title: For the save
review.reviewText: We had a terrible hotel booked, so we looked on Expedia at 6pm and found a VERY expensive room for 50% off! We booked it immediately, and checked in within 15 minutes. Thank you for saving our trip!
Great location, friendly staff, nice - clean rooms

Had to pay a deposit on room even after the room was paid in full had to pay $45 plus tax to park in their lot per day.  Was no hot tub and swimming pool was closed the whole time and if you want breakfast that's and extra $30 per person I won't ever stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel, handy for Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39
review.reviewText:
I  chose this hotel by chance after looking at other more expensive ones in the city centre area. Having seen the city area on a bus tour later, I realised that I had made a good choice .
I was intitialy a bit miffed on arrival to be told that I was going to be in the annexe ( Wharf Building) around the corner, but this turned out to be fine, with the added bonus of being handy for the Dennys eatery downstairs.
I did not eat in the hotel as there are many bars and restruants within walking distance.
i would definately recomend this hotel and would be very happy to stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, comfortable bed decent pillows, good location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, very close to Fishermans Wharf and walking distance from Pier 39 and also pier 33 for the Alcatraz ferry boats.

review.reviewText: It was a great location, but the room was on street level and VERY noisy outside our window. Bathroom was not the cleanest and the room dcor was ok, carpet looked very worn. For the price, breakfast or free parking really should have been included.

review.title: Convinient to enjoy San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel because of the location. So far it was good. Only thing is that it is very noisy because all rooms are facing street. 
Their beds are not so good I and my sister had backach in the morning.  But for the price, it was OK hote. Fairly clean. Yoon

review.title: Weekend break
review.reviewText: We arrived late Friday night with children. Approached check in and although there was an available clerk she wasn't eager to assist. She was not so welcoming. Got our room turns out it's in the the addition across the street, great except there s only about 10 parking spots total. With luggage and children this was so inconvienant.  My husband and I had to unload, carry luggage and children then he had to drive back to the other hotel to park and walk back. When we went to leave husband went to pick up van forgot keys left some luggage with valet he was grumpy old man. This might not be so inconvienant if traveling without children.  Still not the warmest staff.
Internet connection was slow (300-400 KBytes/sec) and WiFi password had expiration in 3 days (need to renew).
review.negativeRemarks: internet connection speed and no need to renew WiFi password during the stay
review.locationRemarks: excellent location near wharfs and busses center (for tours)

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: stayed for 2 nights. location was excellent. went to AT&T Park for 2 Ballgames. transportation was close and easy
review.negativeRemarks: cheaper rates and cheaper parking

review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco but it wont be our last.....

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
Close to everything.
Good.
24 hour Denny's.
Keyed elevator access.

review.title: Great location, mediocre hotel
review.reviewText:
Room was quiet, far away from everything, but had to walk down the street to a separate building. Minimal amenities here. Beds pretty small for my teenage boys. Very clean.
Only thing great was the location. Perfect walking distance to everything however, made it worth it.

review.title: Walking distance to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent quiet hotel, you can walk to just about anywhere that you need or want to go, there are numerous excellent local restaurants within 5 blocks, fisherman's wharf was a 5 minute walk, overall this hotel has an excellent location nobody should need to go to a chain restaurant such as Denny's or In and Out burger.
review.negativeRemarks: a few minor glitches could be removed
review.locationRemarks: Tours of the bay area, Alcatraz island

review.title: Overall, ok!
review.reviewText: Overall, nice hotel.  Clean. Coffee machine and mini fridge. But it was noisy at night and parking for your vehicle was very expensive at $43 per night :( But you can park on the street for free.  Watch the street sweeping signs.
review.positiveRemarks: Coffee machine in the room, mini refrigerator, and nice clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Close by down town, Fishermens wharf and the bridge.  Lots to do.

review.title: Great location, lots of parking space.
review.reviewText: Very good location and clean room.  Wish it could include breakfast that would save us some time.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk needs to explain the parking space a little better instead of figuring out myself and finding 3 lots.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location.  All in all a clean and friendly hotel.  They do have two buildings, though.  We weren't aware of that and were placed in the second building.  This ultimately was fine, but the main building is where the breakfast buffet, gift shop, bar, etc is.  They did give a room choice by showing us on a map which 3 rooms remaining were available.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator (one of the two) wasn't working correctly.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the Wharf, a couple blocks from Ghirardelli Square, and a couple of blocks from Pier 39.  Lots of restaurants and shops nearby.

review.title: Good Hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel has a good staff, clean and comfortable rooms and an excellent location right in the middle of all the activity on Fisherman's Wharf. We enjoyed staying here and the price is very affordable.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable rooms, excellent location
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the sliding glass doors in the lower level rooms with something that appears more solid and secure.
review.locationRemarks: All the activities along Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Close to Piers and Cruise Ships
review.reviewText: This was our second stay at this hotel.  Both visits were more than comfortable and pleasant.  Easy walk to ships.  Will stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking could be less expensive.

review.title: I'm satisfied!
review.reviewText: Great location near Fisherman's Warf on a calm street. The room was clean, and the bed was in excellent condition.
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator in the room.

review.title: Good Hotel and convenient to sightseeing
review.reviewText: The Hotel was clean, the staff was very helpful but the noise in the room was loud with noise coming from the back alley, one night someone was yelling  for about 20 minutes directing the yelling to hotel guests trying to scare the guests. The internet was basically unusable and the hotel advertisement indicated there was high speed internet, the vending machine in the first floor was broken for about three days. Avoid having a room by the alley, specially first floor.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hotel was clean and the staff was friendly
review.negativeRemarks: When I booked hotel Expedia misrepresented that this hotel had free breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was centrally located for many of the important attractions and activities, Alcatraz, Sausalito, cable car, streetcars, Golden Gate Bridge, ...

review.title: One of the better options in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very clean and reasonably priced for the area. One block in from Fisherman's Wharf at the western end, close to Lombard Street and the cable car (Powell-Hyde line). Good restaurants nearby. Hotel parking entrance is a little tricky at at the corner of a triangular intersection. No valet parking but the self service lot was easy, just tap your room key card on the reader at the gate to get in and out (do not stick your room key into the slot). Wifi was included but hardly worked, which is our only complaint.

review.title: Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Great location on the Wharf; but we were in the building across the street and had to haul all our luggage about half a block outside and then down some stairs to get to the other lobby.  There was no offer to take luggage over for us by the hotel and no way to get there from the main hotel -- inside.

Was difficult to reach the front desk when trying to call from the room and when trying to get out of the parkade.  Paid WAY too much per night to park -- which is excessive when we were already paying alot for the room.

The rooms are in need of updating in the second building (not sure of main)

The Denny's restaurant attached the the second hotel was dreadful.  Extremely dirty - food was terrible and service was slow.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great -- can see Alcatraz from hotel room
review.negativeRemarks: Denny's needs overhaul - hotel should offer to take luggage to other location for us - pay less for parking - update rooms

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to street cars and the pier.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel...close to transportation and walking distance to pier
Great location! Nice room. We were there for 4 nights and did not have any problems. It was quiet and clean. Only downside is parking fee, but I guess that is most places in San Fran.

review.title: Close to Wharf, walking distance.
review.reviewText:
Room was clean, hotel was clean taken care of. Parking a little more  expensive than the garages in the immediate area.  We found the room #261 was facing the Cannery bar/resturant and they played really loud music each night.
House keeping was really quick to respond to our calls: when we needed more towels, toliet paper.  Remote broke, they came right up and brought a new one.  Breakfast buffet was expensive,  but bakery items in coffee area delicious and reasonable. The best feature was the pool table: the kids Loved it.

There are cleaner places to stay in the area.
We were sent across the street to the Holiday Inn Express building. 
The room was not clean at all, the vents on the AC unit were caked with filth, the walls in the bathroom and light switches have probably never been wiped down.

review.title: Thin walls, hard beds, cheap and close to wharf
review.reviewText: I enjoyed our stay for the most part with Holliday Inn. The biggest complaints I have are the walls are thin and we seemed to have a huge gap under our door compared to everyone else, so we heard EVERYTHING in the hallway, we finally got smart and put towels down to muffle the sounds. The bed was pretty hard, but I slept well surprisingly. The staff was really nice and accommodating, no problems there, but for the price, you cannot beat the location, just one block from FIsherman's Wharf, was ideal. I loved where we were at because we spent the majority of our time on the wharf. We did a 3 day hop on hop off tour through San Francisco Site seeing that was just 2 blocks away that I would recommend, the guides were fun, and the transportation alone there would be expensive. I would recommend this hotel to those wanting to stay on the wharf. Don't forget to see the sea lions on Pier 39!!
review.negativeRemarks: Bed, sound proofing walls, fixing gap under door
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 has a ton of things to do, Alcatraz Landing is close by, just about a 15 min walk, you can walk to China Town or Little Italy in 15 min too

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Affordable hotel close to the action. We liked the fact that it was one block off the maint street which kept foot traffic down to a minimum.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Staying in Fisherman's Wharf allowed us to walk to most of the San Fran tourists attractions. Coit Tower was just above us, Alcatraz ferries were a 10 minute walk, and all different kinds of restaurants were within a few blocks.  It was fun for my teenagers to be able to walk out the door and go shopping or grab an ice cream sundae at Ghiradelli.  The streetcar pick up was less than a block away so we had easy access to Union Square, China Town, Haight-Ashbury, and the Castro district.  The Denny's at the bottom of the hotel was very convenient for a quick breakfast before heading out for the day.  Although, the Beach Street Grill is right across the street and has a fabulous breakfast!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was convenient to walk to Pier 39 and other attractions.  The room was clean and quite.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location for sightseeing.  They had a restaurant on site and a counter with muffins and fruit to grab a quick breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is very expensive, but that is traditional in San Francisco.  Free breakfast would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Ghirardelli Square, cable car turnaround and Pier 39.

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText:
I booked a couple rooms online about 2 hours before arriving the same day. Staff was able to accommodate my request to have adjoining rooms when I got there.
Daily parking was more than what other parking areas were charging around Fisherman's Wharf. 
Housekeeping walked in on us way before the checkout time.
review.negativeRemarks: Not charge for microwave or fridge. Not charge, or at least not too much, for parking.
review.locationRemarks: About 3 blocks from the Fisherman's Wharf. Easy walk to enjoy the day at the piers.

review.title: Fire alarm night
review.reviewText: After being awaken by a fire alarm and standing outside for 20-30 minutes the fire department came, walked through the building and found no fire. No explanation was ever offered by management, no acknowledgement ever offered by staff. Though I don't expect compensation for a safety procedure, I felt like we were left to our own to understand where to go, how to return to rooms, with stair access locked etc. Not an impressive show of service.
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, Exploratorium

review.title: Nice near the water near the stores
review.reviewText: Okay, had a short stay just overnight but the vendo machine was not working we had no source for bottled water.

review.title: Decent hotel very close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Room was clean; A/C unit very loud when it came on; beds were ok, hate that they were doubles and not queen-sized. Fire alarm went off at 12:30 am and not a hotel staff member to be found to direct when it was safe to go back in.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: The distance to all the fun places to visit is so close you will love it!

review.title: Great location but mixed experience
review.reviewText: Myself husband and four children stayed here at the start of our trip travelling around California. The location is excellent, the reception staff extremely helpful. The rooms were basic but adequate. They were extremely noisy though- probably due to their central location. The 2 problems we had were one extremely rude porter who was frankly intimidating and frightened my children- throwing our bags around, clearly not happy in his work. The other issue involved a light fitting which shot out of the light and smashed narrowly missing my daughter. The hotel staff were apologetic, offered a miserly apology  of free breakfast.... For only 2 of us, not a great compensation when there were 6 of us and breakfast was extortionately priced at 25 dollars each-left a bad taste in my mouth and will affect my choices when booking hotels again!
review.positiveRemarks: The reception staff were great, location good
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing to windows, individual porter needs lessons on human courtesy!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location- we enjoyed cycle ride to Golden Gate Bridge, trip to Alcatraz.

review.title: Close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Parking expensive! Would like to know up front and not be caught off guard about the expense.  Loved being able to walk down to the Wharf and Boudin's.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very accommodating, clean, staff was excellent, included breakfast was plentiful, fresh, and tasty, and the location of the hotel was perfect. Ten minute walk to pier 39, minutes to fisherman's warf, would definitely stay at this holiday inn again.
My husband and I have stayed here years ago. It still is a very nice place, the people are nice and helpful. We parked the car and walked all over Fisherman's wharf and pier 39.  We had a great time.

review.title: Near to fishermans warf
review.reviewText: the hotel is in a great place, san Francisco is a wonderful city
review.positiveRemarks: Is very near to fishermans warf

review.title: Rooms are like a Motel 6 and im not kidding!!!
review.reviewText: The staff was for the most part nice but they are not going out of there way for you. My problem was the room quality. These rooms should not exceed $120 max a Night and i'm saying this ONLY because of where the hotel is located. If this hotel was located in an area where it wasn't for tourists then I would say the rooms should not be more than $70 usd per night!!! I travel a lot and to many places in USA and Internationally and iv'e stayed at the best hotels around the world and many of them were much less money than this Dump. Please note that I am not exaggerating and nor did I have a bad experience with the staff. I repeat this place is MOTEL 6 Quality so don't be surprised if you decide to stay here. I hope this review helps you make a smart decision!!

review.title: Great walking access to lots of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf. Parking our car there was expensive (`$50/day) but we didn't have to use it for three days. We walked to the start point of all the major attractions from the hotel. Hotel was clean and comfortable. There are two locations for the hotel within a block or two of each other. We stayed in the new part while our vehicle was parked underground in the older part. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance. Particularly recommend "Pescatore" about two blocks away. There is a 24 hr Dennys inside the new section of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: convenience to things we wanted to do.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, 33 (Alcatraz tours), cable car start terminals, tram cars etc are all within a few blocks walking distance

review.title: Great location to walk to Ghiradelli, pier 39 etc
review.reviewText: Fully enjoyed our stay. Nothing fancy but clean, nice and excellent location.

review.title: Good location, but noisy
review.reviewText:
Room was ok, but noise from adjoining room. Internet was very slow.
Make sure you ask for a non-adjoining room, and not overlooking the street especially rooms on the ground floor.
Great location.

review.title: Comfortable stay with perfect location!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean. Hotel is within walking distance of a number of great attractions. Muni transport is close by in all directions. Wifi is complimentary, but its so slow that I didnt use it much - that would be the main annoyance. Toilets flush slowly. And with the perfect location also comes a bit of noise, but not enough to disturb sleep. No complimentary breakfast or airport shuttle service. Overall it was a good experience.
Good location, clean, fast check in and check out.

review.title: Great location. Very nice room and facility.
review.reviewText: Rooms are large, clean and well appointed. Needs an extra mirror in room, however because bathroom is smaller for two people to share. Great location. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Nice breakfast but a little pricey. Super concierge service. I would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to all attractions and great restaurants.

review.title: NOISY HOTEL
review.reviewText: The location is great... within walking distance of all the attractions! This hotel is probably the noisiest we have ever experienced! They "upgraded" us to a room that looked directly at a wall in the alley. The slamming of doors and cleaning staff in the hallways began at 6AM. The dumpsters were directly beneath us in the alley. Trash rummaging and then trash trucks added to the noise all night and early in the morning. There is no microwave and our fridge did not work. It was great to be able to walk everywhere, but that would be the only reason to stay here!
The Hotel location is great! The room is very confortable!

review.title: Great location in Fisherman's wharf,
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, nice beds, would stay here again when in San Fran
review.negativeRemarks: carpets need cleaning or replacing, some marks on walls
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, many restaurants, Boudins bakery, trolleys, close to China town, Unino Square

review.title: Room to small
review.reviewText: This time it wasn't good, staff seams like don't care about us, care only for other guesses that stay longer than us, than room was way to small beds verily fit and coffee maker was dirty, just not happy about it. Location was great.

review.title: Close to all the action at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Close to all the public transport. Lots of good restaurants and bars nearby.  Very comfortable Holiday Inn.  The restaurant is good but has no atmosphere.  Did not try breakfast.  Only problem is the wifi is very very slow.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants, trams, cable cars, buses, ferrys, bikes and segways all very close.

review.title: good location and quiet
review.reviewText:
stayed 9  nights . Fisherman's Wharf good location to see the city by foot and bus. 
Not many places nearby with good food.
review.positiveRemarks:
Room was clean and reasonable size (9 nights) - only hotel on the Wharf with a pool. Buffet breakfast was good.
No complaints from us about noise.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel writes that there is a free newspaper. Unfortunately it is the San Fran Chronicle which is awful so you have to buy a real newspaper.
review.locationRemarks: We chose the Wharf over Union Sq. Good decision. The Wharf is near Fort Mason which is very peaceful early morning. Piers not for us.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText:
Very noisy.  Small room.  Vending machines did not accept cash.

Great location
review.negativeRemarks: Noise

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: It was very nice. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was excellent. Will definitely be returning.

review.title: Great location but very poor Wifi
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great spot for walking the Fisherman's wharf district.  Also, just a 15 minute walk to Alcatraz ferry and five minutes to the cable cars. Hotel a bit pricey for what you get, but you are paying for the location.  The internet and Wifi in the Hotel were extremely poor, ipad would not load at times.  Unacceptable in this day and age when you are  TOURIST accessing everything on line.  It needs to be fixed/upgraded ASAP.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connectivity very, very poor.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We just stayed one night, but the hotel was perfect for that.  It was within walking distance of most of the things we wanted to see in our short stay.  There was a lot of noise coming from the pool about 9:45 PM and we were ready for bed.  I called down to ask about it and was told there had been other complaints so they would check on it.  Within 15 minutes all was quiet.  I also left a small item in the room, and thankfully when I called back two days later it was found safely stored in the "lost and found" so I was able to retrieve it.  All in all, it was a very nice stay.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, the staff was helpful and the rooms were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: They do charge $40-50 a night for parking in the garage which seems rather steep and no free coffee in the lobby - a cup cost me $3.50.

review.title: great location by fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: staff was extremely helpful with business services
review.negativeRemarks: better coffee
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf, everything within walking distance.  felt safe

review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights.  Enjoyed our accommodations and visit.  Close to the wharf and piers.  Overall, a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good.  Room was spacious with couch.  Staff (for the most part) were helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The woman who handled "tour questions" was less than friendly.  Had been on the phone with a friend and seemed almost inconvenienced.

review.title: Hotel was a mixed bag
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well located to access on foot the Ward, Ghiardelli Square and the Cannery.  The fact that rooms arein two separate buildings and access to parking is very limited makes parking difficult.  The Concierge was asked to make dinner reservations and failed to do so citing her busy work load and taking lunch as excuses.  

Parking is not only limited but spaces are better suited for compact and subcompact cars rather than full size and subconpact's.  On occasion cars were so close together that it was impossible to exit from both sides of the vehicle.
review.positiveRemarks: Relative location to the Warf and other attractions
review.negativeRemarks: replace the Concierge staff.  Rework parking stall desigantions/reduce parking fee substantually to reflect the value of the service provided!
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf, Ghirdelli Square, The Cannery, shops and restaurants.

review.reviewText: Great location. Close to bay, restaurants, and activities. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Loved it

review.title: Great hotel, close to Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Room was good so comfy and big but bathroom had no vanity, just a sink and small table.  You had no where to curl your hair or put on makeup..  Just a bowl and a small wooden table next to it.  The room is large and why they do not have a complete vanity is a ???????
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is within walking distance and the City Tour Buses were at the corner a couple of blocks down.

review.title: Close to NB, Embarcadero, Marina, & Fisherman's W
review.reviewText: Great location, spacious rooms and reasonable rate for a hotel in SF.  I've stayed at a dozen other local hotels in the area for work and think this hotel offers the greatest amount of benefits.  I will look to stay here first on my future trips.  Staff was very nice and accommodating.

review.title: Perfect location to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Typically the pictures on the hotel sites don't show an accurate visual of the facility, I was very pleasantly  surprised to see the facility was more than I expected.  It was close to everything we wanted to visit.  We walked every with ease.  I will go back to this location again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location to all of the places I wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Great dining!  Trolley car hub.   Tour bus hub!  Can't think of anything they did not have!

review.title: Nice Hotel for a Good Price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a nice location with a great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: My only beef is that the rooms need refrigerators! There are too many good food choices to not be able to save the leftovers!

review.title: Front desk was not welcoming
review.reviewText: The person at the front desk did not offer alot of important info. We learned more from other guests we dis not know.

review.title: Very positive
review.reviewText: We had a great stay.  Parking price a little high but the location was great and the personnel could not have been better.

review.title: Too noisy
review.reviewText: Our room backed into the back street, buses passing by all night and loading trucks starting at 4:30am. No sound proof at all in rooms and the heater ridiculously loud too.

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is just a hop, skip and jump away from everything on Fisherman's wharf!  It was an easy , short walk. Clean hotel, friendly staff,  and the room was very large, with a good size bathroom and sitting area.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of this hotel couldn't be any better!  An easy walk to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: The boarding pass machine was out of order, and the lady who assisted for tours was not too helpful, but other than that , nothing could be any better
review.locationRemarks: The wharf is a couple of blocks away. Historic Jack's Pub in the Cannery is just down the street, and  bus for a tour to Muir Woods was 1 block away

review.reviewText: Was a great stay! Close to the wharf and good walking distance to everywhere else.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText:
Location was great!
Staff was friendly
The traffic and rooms next to us were very loud - not great sound proofing.
The room smelled a little musty and the bathroom had no fan.
Otherwise it was okay.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to wharf and lots of major attractions.

review.title: A good hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: If you aren't looking for anything super fancy but just want a clean, quiet room to crash in every night, you will find this to be a good hotel!  It's in a perfect location for walking around Fisherman's Wharf and just steps away from cable cars and bus tours that take you everywhere else in the city.  Down the street is an awesome breakfast/lunch spot called Beach Street Grill.
Overall a very good hotel experience. Great Fisherman's Wharf location!

the room and staff where great except for noise from garbage nd alley which was the hotels  below our window and hotel  exit door to alley made dreadful nosie waking us up every morning at 5am when addressed we were left .  WAIT ear plugs omg in this day and age !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: Great area! Right next to Fisherman's wharf. Easy walking and bus access. Clean and friendly service

review.title: nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Everything was fine. Rooms were clean. Our room had a great view of Alcatraz.
review.positiveRemarks: location was the best thing about this hotel
review.locationRemarks: located near fisherman's wharf with lots of good restaurants and touristy shops nearby

review.title: Nice hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is fine, rooms are incredibly clean, and it is very close to Fisherman's Wharf. I also liked the fact there is a Denny's nearby for breakfast.

review.title: Great hotel at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel. Within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf & many other points of interest.

review.title: Clean room nice view. The staff was very helpful
review.reviewText: Nice location good value helpful staff.    We will be back
review.locationRemarks: Close to transportation and the wharf

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent five days in San Francisco and wanted a place to be able to easily hit most of the  attractions. The hotel was located in a great spot, within walking distance of the wharf, Giradelli Square, and to connections on the cable cars. The hotel itself is comfortable and clean and although we didn't use the pool, our room had a view of it and lots of people seemed to enjoy it even with highs in the 60's. The staff were not friendly, but this seems to be the norm in big cities. No smiles and everyone seemed to really hate they had to be there. The hotel was reasonably priced, especially for the location, but extras were very expensive. Parking was $50 a day and breakfast for me and my wife was close to $60! That was just for a couple eggs and toast, nothing fancy. Fortunately, there are several fast food places within a couple blocks. Overall, I recommend the hotel but take a shuttle from the airport and don't spend another penny at the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to be friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, food, museums, and cheesy touristy stuff within easy walk.

review.title: Close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Booked for an event to be with friends and family, but was put in another building across the street. Restuarant food minimal. Parking fee was a ripoff of $48 a night

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText: I stayed here last week for 4 days and I was very satisfied with this hotel. The location is close to everything (Citysightseeing tours, Ghirardelli, Fisherman's Wharf,Pier 39,Trade

review.title: Great location, price, and accommodations
review.reviewText: I don't have the time but would like to submit this questionnaire with my other remarks.  However you will not allow me to do so until I fill this section with some meaningless log about my adventures out west.  So I am attempting to find a way to fulfill this needless requirements as quickly as I can

review.title: Basic room but great location.
review.reviewText:
Was a bit confused by the fact that Holiday Inn Express and Holiday Inn are located right next to each other. Fortunately there is a door man at Holiday Inn Express with a list of names of people checking in so he was able to tell me I was at the wrong one, without me having to get out of my car.
The room is very basic, what you are really paying for is the great location.  Two short blocks from Ghirardelli Square and one block from Fisherman's Wharf. You can walk to the beach at Aquatic Cove in the morning. 
One minor drawback for us is that since we are a family, they put us in a room on the ground floor in an area with a bunch of other children and some of them are a bit noisy (can here the kids in the room next door).  Not a big enough issue to request a room change, but something we noted.
The parking is not cheap (but none of the parking garages in the area are), but the underground lot is convenient and there is a laundry room at garage level that we made use of. It would be nice if they had a change machine so we wouldn't have to wait in line in the lobby for change.
The pillows are so comfy, we wanted to buy them. Although we didn't use them, the pool and workout rooms are nice.
The Denny's attached to the hotel is a great fallback option when Hollywood Caf gets too crowded.
review.positiveRemarks: As stated, the location is awesome.  Park your car underground and just walk to everything. The gift shop and lobby are nice. Laundry room is handy.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit thicker walls, maybe.  And lower the parking price 15%.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is right there as is Ghirardelli Square and Aquatic Cove.  Even Pier 39 is walking distance. Denny's is convenient.

review.title: Great location! Close to Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location! Walked everywhere and not far. Parked car in garage was a surprise extra $49! But there is no where to park nearby so....just typical in San Francisco. Great stay!

review.title: Nothing to Write Home About
review.reviewText: Low end of a three star....maybe a 2.5. Needs remodel. It was clean.

review.title: Not a bad place to stay
review.reviewText: Not a bad place to stay being that it's a block away from the wharf. However, the wireless internet was horrible. The have a sign saying not to download large files or stream because everyone else uses it and it will slow down the internet for everyone. I get that. However! I couldn't even check my email without it taking 20 mins and I have a fast and powerful laptop but its only as fast as your internet and that was a major inconvenience.  But that was really my only beef with the place.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, on the3rd floor atleast, there were walls that were ripped open or the wallpaper was coming off and it was duct taped so that looked a bit tacky
review.locationRemarks: You are at Fisherman's Wharf! So much to do there.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Spent the weekend in the city. Loved the location of this hotel. Walking distance to Mason center and marina.

review.title: Nice hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Had nice time with my mother near Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Good location but a bit out of the center.
review.reviewText: Very good hotel with able and nice personnel. Advisable for business. But for fun, try to find one near to Santa Monica.

review.title: Go To Place
review.reviewText: Love the location. However the Free High Speed Internet included is a bit slow.
review.positiveRemarks: The proximity around the bay area. Truly accessible to restaurants, bars, tourist spots.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet Connection
review.locationRemarks: There's a lot of activities. You won't get bored even when alone.

review.title: Great stay at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel. Very helpful staff. Location: just great. A couple blocks from the piers, a couple blocks from the cable car station. Would stay there again.

review.title: The parking is so expensive. Location is good.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location and accessable to any tourist destination in SF, room is clean but the parking is too expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking price should be lower.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very good.

review.title: Everything was smooth and easy!
review.reviewText: There was a nice empty refrigerator to put our leftovers in. The coffee was good in the room. The view outside our window was a giant ugly wall. That was the only bad thing and it would have been horrible were we not only there for the night. GET A BETTER VIEW!
review.positiveRemarks: Good price for perfect location. Saved money on not having to get cab rides to and from.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper parking!
review.locationRemarks: We could just walk out and were within steps of everything.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable rooms and friendly staff.  I will definitely stay here again!

review.title: My short stay.
review.reviewText: A wonderful stay at this Hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful from the moment I arrived. The concierge helped straight away and booked a 24 hour combo ticket," open top" bus tour and boat trip and visit to Alcatraz. It is a children friendly hotel too, caters  for schools I think. Everything I needed to do was only about 4 blocks walk.

review.title: GREAT PLACE
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Was inexpensive yet clean, right next to our tour group and the wharf! I will stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, staff was nice, central to many locations!

review.title: Just alright..
review.reviewText: The hotel just like most hotels in SFO is a little tired, comfortable nonetheless except for the noisy heater. Close to Fishermans Wharf which is becoming more of a homeless destination, havent been in SFO for over 10 years and it seems the homeless situation has gone from bad to worse.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We arrived early, hotel staff allowed us to check in anyway. Tourist information desk was very helpful and we were directed easily to where we wanted to go. Hotel was clean and all staff we encountered were pleasant and friendly. We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and hotel was clean, with very helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing could have been done to make our stay any better than it was.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf was a block away. Everything we wanted to see and do was easily reached walking, which was a great feature for us.

review.title: Exactly as advertised
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine - it provided a safe, clean room. However, in no way did the hotel exceed expectations, nor did it seem to make much effort to do so.

review.title: Great hotel and location.
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! I stayed here and the Sheraton. Although the Sheraton was a little closer to things, the parking and WiFi charges were outrageous. You do have to pay for parking at Holiday Inn, but it was VERY reasonable. The WiFi was FREE!! Love it!! I will not stay at the Sheraton again, I will definitely return to Holiday Inn. It was such a great value for the $$$.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, etc.

review.title: All great except plumbing
review.reviewText: Plumbing in bath and shower needs to be fixed.  Drainage poor.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, and other tourist areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Plumbing described above.
review.locationRemarks: Block from Fishermen's Wharf great.

review.title: Great stay near the Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location walking distance from the Wharf. Excellent place for family stay, lot to do around here.

review.title: A good Hotel walking distance to all amenties
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights were permitted to have late check out. Good restaurant and central to all sightseeing.
review.negativeRemarks: lighting in the room
review.locationRemarks:
fishermans wharf where the tourist likes to walk to, sightseeing all long that area
Easy access to international airport also

review.title: Very dissapointing!!!
review.reviewText:
The hotel needs a renovation. It's old, dirty and smelly. The bathtub was dirty. The room's decor was depressive. The cleaning of the room very deficient. There was too much noise from the street that passed through the room's windows. Be careful with the food of the breakfast buffet, the fruit and yogurs were not very fresh. 
Great service from most of the employees but there was a woman at the bar that was very rude when I asked her a drink.
In conclussion I don't recommend this hotel ever.
Very nice hotel. Perfect for the purpose of my trip!

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: at the time I book the hotel, they should tell me the parking fee. It's much expensive that the other places. Around 50 per night for parking. That's unacceptable.
review.negativeRemarks: parking should be free

review.title: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We liked the location, we're able to park the car and walk everywhere we wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: Better parking situation, charge way too much to park
review.locationRemarks: We wanted to see Fisherman's wharf and it was within 3 blocks.

review.title: Wrong building
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel based on the Expedia pictures and prior reviews. When we got there they sent us to a different building located 2 blocks away with non of the amenities and 8 parking spots needless to say always full. End result, no amenities and no parking for a 3.5 to 4 star hotel price.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Had a great stay.  The hotel is within walking distance of everything we want to do and see.  Parking is $43.00 per night.  This is about average for the area.  Although the Dennys in the hotel is convenient, it is overpriced.

review.title: Comfortable Rooms, Awful Parking
review.reviewText: I'll start off with a positive - the beds in our room were VERY comfortable. Best night sleep I had in a long time. The parking situation was a joke. The parking fees were unbelievable. $49 for one night?! And for that price, we were told to park in the parking garage below the main hotel (no valet service) and to walk a block and a half to the building that our room was located in. I would have gladly paid that amount for a valet or MAYBE even for a parking spot near our room (it is San Francisco, after all), but for a spot that was over a block from my room?! Absolutely ridiculous. The hotel staff were just okay... the guy who checked us in didn't know prices and gave me three different numbers for the cost of parking, none of which were correct. He wasn't very friendly but wasn't rude. Just...meh. I did like the room but I will not be staying here again. There are much nicer options in San Francisco in the same price range
review.negativeRemarks: Parking situation

review.title: location location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a very good location! I should've been prepared for the expensive daily parking fee. In fact, we basically left our car parked there during our three day stay and traveled around by trolley and walked around to the Wharf and nearby beach. Those of you that love Disney will love everything from the walking distance to Buena Vista street. Other than that I was very satisfied with the room & staff. Would definitely stay again.

Great location friendly staff. Very close to the golden gate bridge, Lombard St, fishermans warf, Coit tower, and many more hot spots. Would definitely consider staying here again next time I'm in SF.

review.title: Good location, beware of hotel parking fees.
review.reviewText: Great location. Annoyed that we had to walk outside to get from the parking garage to the second hotel building where our room was located and that parking for two days was almost $100!! Other than that, it's a decent hotel for the money.

review.title: nice hotel close to all the action
review.reviewText: we stayed on the first floor it was very loud and unprivate. parking is expensive

review.title: Good to go
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf by walk. Staff is nice and room is clean but a little bit noisy. Parking is very expensive, charged by 42 bucks/day. We parked in the garage nearby with the rate 32/day. But finally we found you could park in the street overnight before 9 a.m. for free.

review.title: Old and dirty
review.reviewText: The hotel is old, needs renovation urgently. The rooms are smelly and dirty. The bathtub had the dirty marks   from the people that bathed before.
