The staff efforts to give their best except for a   bar tender woman that had very bad attitude. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone it's expensive and not worth.
The Hotel facilities is excellent, price of the room is decent to stay...
review.negativeRemarks: The cost for parking in the hotel facilities it is very expensive ( Ripoff). It's cost more than the public parking lot....
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Hotel is within walking distance to many sights!
review.reviewText: We're from NY and stayed through Xmas week. Had a fantastic stay with sunshine and enjoyed the area including Muir Woods, Sausalito, Alcatraz and California University of Sciences. Took the on-off bus a few times and found we made the right decision in staying at the Holiday Inn. It was worth the trip!

review.title: Nice hotel .
review.reviewText: Nice hotel 1 block off Fisherman's Wharf. Even though there was a lot of street noise the rooms were very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be great if they would add a small refrigerator for drinks and snaks.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Chose this hotel solely based on its location.  As expected there were no surprises. Just a clean room near the Wharf. We stayed in their "new" tower which is across the street from the Main Bldg. This alternate site still has a front desk and also has a Dennys in the lobby. Overall hotel is a good value.

review.title: Took the in-laws to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel seems to have 3 different buildings. We must have been stuck in the lower end. Stopped by the other 2 just to take a look and they looked ok. Building with Denny's is where you do not want to be.
review.negativeRemarks: needs to be remodeled
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. Close to all SF has to explore.

review.title: Beware parking not included $48 per day!
review.reviewText: The only thing you are paying here is the location, which is very convenient - close to several attractions. The hotel is old and the service is mediocre. Moreover, I was dissapointed to learn while checking in that the parking was not included, and it is not cheap at $48 per day.  This was not specified in the description. I felt deceived. So do not book it if you are planning on spending 180 - 200 per night - you would be spending more like 230 - 250 here.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Best thing is the location! Couldn't be better if you want to be close to Fisherman's Wharf (and why wouldn't you be).  Room is okay, nothing special. Restaurant overpriced,with so many great eateries so close by. Would have been nice to know about the "Business Centre" (computers etc) on second floor before last day when I found it by accident.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location. Valet happy to pre-order cab for $10 deposit which was deducted from fare.
review.negativeRemarks: Have some rooms with queen beds instead of just doubles, and put small fridges in the rooms. Most hotels have that!
review.locationRemarks: Fine location close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Boudin bakery, ferry to Alcatraz, Big Bus hop-on-hop-off stops.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Right near Fisherman'a Wharf, reasonable parking, nice staff

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: No frills hotel w/in walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and the piers. This was our second stay. The first time, our room was on the east side. This time, our room was on the west side. It was noisier due to the alley foot traffic and random car alarms going off in the morning. Parking is $40 a night, which for SF is "reasonable".
Everything was great, but 2 things.  The extra cost of 45 dollars a day for parking and the beds looked smaller than a queen. They looked more like 2 full beds.

review.title: Payed more than the original price
review.reviewText: I payed 2 nights and was charged 3 nights. I never had a receipt or invoice and notice that when i check my bank charges when i returned
Great location. Short walking distance for children to Pier 39 & Ghirardelli.

review.title: close to the wharf
review.reviewText: I drive a four door long bed truck. it is extremely hard to park in sf. I like that I can park my truck and walk to stores, and restaurants. our f/v is nearby and it makes it handy for my husband and son. I always had to park at the main building, as the other building located on the next block, couldn't fit my truck. speaking of, having to walk to the other building in the rain with luggage was inconvenient. although the staff was nicer and more helpful there then the staff at the main building.
review.positiveRemarks: it is close to the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: parking spaces are small. if they hadn't let me park in the sign-in spot a couple times, it would have been extremely difficult to park.
review.locationRemarks: the cable cars are close by, as is Ghirardelli's square. many types of restaurants to choose from.

review.title: Convenient Location But Can be Loud
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel is average considering the price. Early check in as well as a quieter room were accommodated. However, our floor had a musty/smoke like smell at times. Our room facilities were okay other than the loud heater/air conditioner that some people may find annoying. The staff were super friendly so that makes a difference.

review.title: Poor service
review.reviewText:
This wasn't our hotel of choice but we had to relocate hotels as our original choice have suffered a power cut due to recent storms. The hotel is separated over two buildings. We checked in and then had to walk a block to get to our room. The other building is not supervised by staff 24 hours. One night returning dinner we found dirty clothes, socks, overcoat on the sofas by the elevators on our floor. It looked like a vagrant had managed to access the upper floors despite requiring a keycard access.
Upon checking out we left our luggage in the storage. On our return to pick up the luggage and leave for the airport there was no staff (1pm). We called the internal phone for reception to get service. In the end, after calling 3 times and waiting 20 mins I had to personally run a block to the main reception in order to get service.

review.title: 5-day stay at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Our stay had a bumpy start due to the heavy rain storm and subsequent power outage. However the staff was very helpful. It's less than 2 mins walking from Fisherman's Wharf and there's Walgreen store close by. I definitely would recommend this hotel!

review.title: Comfy and walking distance from so much!
review.reviewText: We've stayed here before and decided to go back since it's so close to the water and we could walk to everything!

review.title: Nice locasion nier to beach, shopping souveneer,
review.reviewText: Very memories i have by the hotel, and i say to my family also my friends
review.negativeRemarks: Tap water may be available (can direct drinking)
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.reviewText: I thought I was in the main building so that I could access better food and the gym. But, I gather because I came listed through Expedia at a cheaper rate, I was diverted to the satellite a block away. During the storm we didn't have electricity for 10 hours. The generator was only able to cope with the emergency lights in the corridors. I would suggest having on emergency light in every room. One!!! The staff was very pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good

review.title: easy walk to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is fine in regards to your basic amenities, close walk to the Exploratorium, fishermans Wharf and ft mason. Would recommend if you want to stay in this part of city.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Thought would be to Holiday Inn standard... Maybe should have tried the Holiday Inn Express 2 blocks over... This is old hotel and needs updating... They do keep them fairly clean for how old the decor is, however "popcorn" ceilings remind me of the 1980's...
review.negativeRemarks: Needs remodel
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect... On the wharf... Plenty of restaurants and lots to see... All within walking and metro busses everywhere

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Happy with the hotel location right off the wharf and walking distance to Pier 39. Very close to Golden Gate bridge and the winding road. Not happy with the $40 + tax a night parking charge which is quite high or the extra charge for having 4 people in the room vs 2. Still don't understand why we would be charged more money for 4 people in the room vs 2. If you're planning to have 4 in your room, book with only 2. Doesn't cost the hotel extra to rent out the room, shouldn't cost the person booking extra either. Simple cash grab.

review.title: Nice hotel, right on the Wharf.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed being right on the Wharf for easy shopping, dining and just site seeing.  We did not stay in the main hotel but at a site nearby, which I initially thought I wouldn't like but it was actually better and closer to the sites.  If we come back to San Francisco we'll definitely stay here again.

review.title: Luxury? No. But top notch in all other regards.
review.reviewText: We stayed in the newly remodeled building. Room was super clean.  Staff was friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and courteous. Thanks Joy!  And the location was amazing. Walking distance to so many attractions plus Starbucks and a Walgreens. My daughter was doing cartwheels down those clean hallways.  :-)

review.title: Good value for the money, perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and confortable, no luxury but it had everything we needed. The location is perfect, only a short walk to the fisherman's wharf and far enough to the crowds.

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Nice place, clean and close to the Wharf.  Staff was very friendly and allowed us to check in 2 1/2 hours early.  Breakfast was not special and very expensive.  Room was nice with a view of Coit Tower.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing with us. Pillows and bed  were great.
review.negativeRemarks: The room carpet was not clean.
review.locationRemarks: Great breakfast at Hollywood Cafe just around the corner. Near to everything Lombard Street, Piers, Boudinis etc

review.title: Nice close to restaurants
review.reviewText: I booked the room months in advance and did not have a room in the main building we had to stay across the street.. Overall good experience.

review.title: Manny
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very bad.  Porter was not courteous.

review.title: Nice close to everything on the wharf
review.reviewText: We had a very nice time , enjoyed all the tours . Loved the cable car ride .

review.title: Good hotel 1 block from the wharf (2 min. walk)
review.reviewText: Hotel is central to many tourist activities & sites. Security & room access is good. Easy to check in and out of. A call one day in advance to alert of my late arrival (11 pm) alerted the waiting staff. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks:
Room service and maintenance was prompt & professional when our toilet back up.
Computer access to the airlines to print boarding passes was helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: If the hotel had a preferred shuttle or taxi pick service from SFO airport at a great rate would be a bonus.
review.locationRemarks: Near pier activities, museums, tour buses, eateries, sites, etc...

review.title: Great location-great hotel!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, will definitely go back!  Located within walking distance from EVERYTHING!

review.title: Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Holiday in was very nice and appropiate for the price.
review.locationRemarks: tourist shopping. lots of site seeing trips on double deck bus's

review.title: Room faced alley with vagrants went thru trash!
review.reviewText: Ground floor room in alley way. Homeless people went through trash & vehicle raced down alley & fights took place.  Had to pay an additional $90 to park.  The room was mot worth the $431.00 plus parking
review.negativeRemarks: Better rooms for the price. Thicker walls
review.locationRemarks: Tons of things to do on fishermans wharf

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf and pier 39.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a quiet location.  Everything you need is close by. Transit to downtown right outside hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Loved the location, handy to the tram and big buses, appreciated the apples on the counter, business centre and wifi free and easy to use.  Even had free mouthwash in the bathroom.  Price was what you come to expect in the states, changeable according to the day of the week.  Bed was very comfortable and even though we were  above the street it was not noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, staff and free apples on the counter

review.title: Vacation trip and hotel was im a good location
review.reviewText:
Great time and beautiful weather
It was a great place to take a late vacation
Everything was nice, organized, clean and the staff was effective and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide a free continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Near fisherman's wharf.  Can walk to it from there.

review.title: Great value for Money and Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Great location - good hotel and very customer oriented.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: It is in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf - perfect location for sight seeing.

review.title: Window on the action
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because we wanted to be close to fisherman's wharf. We were placed on a ground floor room  with a view on garbage container's in an alley where homeless people would spend the night ( one of them even wave his hand at us ). We could hear a lot of yeelling from the street (it was saturday night) and people coming at their room at 3 o'clock am and speaking loud. Needless to say we didn't get any sleep that night. We spent 3 weeks on the coast of california and this was our worst night.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location close to the wharf
review.negativeRemarks: The kind of room we were assigned to  should not be sold for customers .
review.locationRemarks: Close to fisheman's wharf restaurant and many attractions.

review.title: Good location by Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText: Rooms were good sized and clean. Staff was courteous and helpful. Would stay at this location again.

review.title: SUCH A PLEASANT STAY
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a seminar and it could not have been any better. Arrived early and the front desk accommodated us with an early check in.  Our room was clean, comfortable and perfect. Would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Excellent location.   Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Can't wait to come back to San Francisco.  Definitely stay at the holiday inn.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: The hotel is a convenient location and clean. My only beef is the fee for parking in the hotel parking lot. I think guest should be allowed to park for free.  $40 per day is rediculously high.
review.negativeRemarks: $40 per day is rediculously high. I think guest should be allowed to park for free.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We stayed in the annexe building located on Beach Street which in our opinion was the better location. There is a 24 hour Denny's diner on the ground floor which we found useful. The hotel is close to shops, restaurants, bus stops and Pier 39 and a short 5-10 minute walk from Ghiradelli Square and cable car stop. The Grey Line tours office is just round the corner on Taylor Street. Our room was clean, large and comfortable, plenty of complimentary tea and coffee on offer, we found the reception staff were helpful and informative. If in San Francisco in the future would stay at this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes away from Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, Cable Car stop.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to everything.  Room was just average nothing special.  WiFi is very slow.

review.title: Conveniently located to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nicely located to Fisherman's wharf and the MUNI transportation with connections to BART (access to SFO). Room was very clean and ready for our early check-in and had a great view over the Bay and Alcatraz. No free continental breakfast was included but a Denny's was on the premises but had some very high prices. Hotel has on-site parking but at a steep price of 40$ per night. Room rates were high but comparatively low for the location. I would stay there again and I would recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: It's good view, comfortable beds and the great view.
review.negativeRemarks: The inclusion of a continental breakfast and less expensive parking would make a great package!
review.locationRemarks: It was located just one block from Fisherman's Wharf and some great sea food dinning. The SF MUNI system was just across the street.

review.title: Great Experience!
review.reviewText: Great staff in the restaurant.  Super location, Great value!
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating, for example, rather than a combination lock, the room safe used a key!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to so much!

review.title: Good place to stay near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great place to stay because of proximity -- Fisherman's Wharf is literally down the street (awesome).

review.title: Good value hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Having never been to San Francisco before, the Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf was in a brilliant Location to get to all the sights. It was a short walk to Lombard Street and only a 15 minute walk to get to Pier 33 for our Alcatraz visit.  The staff were very helpful in providing information we needed during our stay.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.  :)
review.positiveRemarks: Its proximity to landmarks and the Wharf and the friendliness of the staff
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe provide creamers/milk separate to the spoon and sugars etc...
review.locationRemarks: So much to do near the hotel, easy to get bus from across the road to the Golden Gate Bridge, easy to walk along the front to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Nice hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Very convenient if you are in fisherman's wharf. Parking is too expensive. No ref and microwave. Breakfast is very expensive. Smells horrible when we came in the room coz the aircon was off.

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText:
First night bad.  Room next to side street where bar on the corner.   Noise with band and people, garbage trucks in AM. Cars etc.  Next morning changed rooms.  
Staff was great.

review.title: Late Arrivals
review.reviewText: I arrived late to the Hotel after traveling all day from Dallas, only to find out my room would cool, when I asked for a car for a 6AM flight back to Dallas, the concierge told me he would require a $10 deposit. He wouldn't take a credit card so I had to use the onsite ATM because no other one was known of  and that cost me a $2.50 service fee. My car was ready but it was a limo service that charged me $3.00 to use a credit card and I specifically told the concierge I needed a cab that took credit cards.   When I got to the airport I assumed my $10 would be credited but nope, the driver said I would have to go back to the hotel for that. I couldn't believe the scam Holiday Inn has going on.
review.negativeRemarks: Communication

review.title: Walking distance
review.reviewText: It was not worth the price out dated rooms had a problem with door key parking wad 45 buck breakfast was 60 for 2.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Good location - one block off Fisherman's Wharf, with easy access to public transport, restaurants etc.  We were in the :"Wharf" annex, not the main part opf the hotel, which did mean access to hotel staff was some times slow.
The rooms were clean, reasonably modern and a good size.
review.negativeRemarks: Why only double beds - why not queen or king size.  The room is big enough to git larger beds.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf only one block away, with easy accss to all the facilities related to that.

review.title: Great hotel to stay at!1
review.reviewText: It is a great hotel. It is close to everything! only about 10-15 min walk to Fisherman's Warf. We also took one of the double decker bus tour about 5 min from the hotel. We had a great view of Coit tower and downtown!!
review.positiveRemarks: I view was awesome and everything was close by
review.negativeRemarks: We didn't expect to pay for hotel parking. But it beats paying for taxi
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's warf was close by

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText:
Stayed with the family and enjoyed the good location 
Staff was very helpful

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 1 week, located rite on the Wharf. Great location and and base to cover everything.Cleaner done the room every day.Dinner down stairs is very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Fisher and wharf, great places to Eat,

review.reviewText: Nice place great location. Parking price a little steep.

review.title: Wharf
review.reviewText: Took a bay cruise, great time. Will return 1 day.  G G bridge amazing view.

review.title: Tried and True Place To Stay
review.reviewText: We stayed for two nights here and was not disappointed.  We were met with a pleasant and courteous staff and was allowed an early check-in.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  The location of this hotel was great with an easy access to public transportation to get around without using a car.  There was nearby stores, restaurants and a stone throw away to Fisherman's Wharf.  We would definitely stay here again when we visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, personable staff, clean rooms, free wi-fi and had a convenient indoor restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovate lobby area and hallway.  Air Conditioner is noisy.  Replace old drapery.  Provide an extra suitcase rack.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to public transportation to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square.  It is a stone throw away from Fisherman's Wharf and Trader Joe's.

review.title: Clean & Quiet in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is not your budget hotel but the staff are very approachable and the rooms are spotless. If you don't want to pay big dollars for a breakfast buffet (I certainly can't eat enough to warrant paying $26) there is a tiny restaurant only a block away where you can get a huge breakfast for a very reasonable price. The name is Joanies Happy Days Diner and two people can eat here for the price that one can eat at the hotel.You will know once you visit why it is very busy.
review.negativeRemarks: I often choose Holiday inn because the breakfast is included. It is not included and it is very costly at this facility.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions.

review.title: Great location fair hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a safe and very great location to see sites along fisherman's wharf. The bed needed a new mattress, no other rooms to be had as we asked to switch. Window faced a wall. Would have liked a cleaner room on day one but the rest of the days it looked good. The front desk was not familiar with surroundings attractions. The concierge was not familiar with bus routes, she told us we could not access the gold gate thru local transport unless it was before 9 or after 5, so we paid 44 dollars to take a ferry only to find out there is local transportation hourly for 10 dollars for the 2 of us. We requested a taxi reservation for the morning of departure, night staff told us to call next morning 10 mins in advance and we would have a taxi. Morning staff at front desk was upset as this should have been done ahead. They asked another person if we could co share their cab (which they did) we luckily got to airport on time - paid 70$ to cover the entire cost as we felt fortunate to have this lady lend a hand.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quiet, it met our basic needs. Free wi fi, free morning paper and an apple if you wanted.
review.negativeRemarks: new mattress in room 438, lumpy on one side and depressed on the other side. Offer free breakfast or coffee of a reasonable price at the front.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf. Ferry to Sausalito, Cable car ride, Muni public transportation to gardens, museums, Piers 39, Alcatraz within minutes.

review.title: A short block away from the wharf area
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very convenient location, relatively quiet. The staff was friendly, though I could rarely reach anyone at the front desk by phone. The concierge desk was empty most of the time. The wifi is mediocre. If you need to stay on business, especially if you need vpn to your office connection, find another hotel that offers wired ethernet. Wifi here just didn't cut it, and I had to go through the frustrating process of registering my connection for all 4 devices once a day for each of the 6 days. Annoying. Although they clearly state on the wifi card that they do not suggest streaming, we wanted to stream netflix and there was frequent buffering, in my opinion this is as basic as buffering water in the taps, this is not reasonable bandwidth. When will hotels get it? Anyhow, we ordered a carafe of coffee via room service, and it arrived on time and hot, however it wasn't a real carafe it was one of those mini-carafes, which I would have appreciated knowing before ordering. The included breakfasts were awesome - better variety than most hotels - and the staff were great when one could reach them.
review.negativeRemarks: better internet

review.title: Overpriced.....parking $40. give me a break
review.reviewText: This was our last Hotel stay after a 9 day trip up from San Diego - and staying in many very nice Hotels along the way...none that were over $300.  and all offering breakfasts, wine and cheese, free champagne in  fridge, scented sachets on beds. And then we have this@ $324. + a nights Reservation read 1300 Columbus Ave. upon checking in at this building told no rooms except on ground floor (may be noisy) so we are putting you in the building next door.   There is no fridge, furnished cheaply (have stayed in better Super......) for $88. Desk clerks available from 7am to 10pm. but you can get coffee and food in Denny's down where the parking and elevators are....oh job. Not even any decos on hallway tables. I wish I could put the picture of the view from our room a dumpster (big) containers of used linens from the main hotel later picked up by transport. Tour buses constantly up and down the street. Way...way overpriced.........tacky loction......
review.negativeRemarks: a fridge would be nice.....some decos around

review.title: October 2015 in San francisco
review.reviewText: Good location but others nearby may be better option. 45dollars/day for car parking a bit steep.hotel looks a bit tired and needs makeover
