review.title: Convenient to fisherman's warf
review.reviewText:
Airport pick up was late.
Front/bellboy didn't call or make any efforts for confirmation. Just telling "coming" "on its way" then finally made some calls and still couldn't find out what's going on.
Driver just showed up 10mins late.
Aggressive driving with "f" to other car.
Was $55, no tips of course he was late but then he "f" to me.

Better choose right company to serve your guests. Understood that you dnd the driver hadron relation but there is a chance for some guests think that it us a part of your team.
Excellent service, perfect location, clean, helpful staff, checked in 5 hours early with no problem. Highly recommend.

review.title: Holiday inn stay
review.reviewText: Rude frond desk, room infested with ants and bed smell and I heard from the front desk is sorry about that. Feel like wasted my money .

review.title: It's ok, good location
review.reviewText: Good location just a block or two from fishermans warf, cable car, Madame tousonne wax place, ripleys believe it it not, lots of good restaurants! Don't go to bubba gumps we have bad service/ food was terrible. The hotel was ok I probably won't stay again. We woke up both mornings to ants everywhere :-( all the hotel did was take off $50 for 1 night. I expected more! Also my husband lost his wedding band in the hotel gym & it was never found :-( someone took it

review.title: Nice hotel near Wharf.
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff once we got past the check in clerk.  Great hospitality and friendly.  Very helpful and we would go back.  Very clean room.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel has two locations-when we arrived we had to walk one block away to our location of the hotel.  Rude clerk when we checked in and poor English.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of site seeing!  Great location.  Would go again!

review.title: Good value, location and service.
review.reviewText: If you book the hotel in advance it's definitely a good buy. The location is close enough to fisherman's wharf to walk along the piers and on the bus route downtown but far enough to get a good night's rest. Wifi was free and strong. There is a business center where you can use desktop computers and the printer for your travel/maps. The concierge was always nice and informative. Beds were comfortable, stain free, bug free and the rooms were well-lit and air-conditioned. The cleaning service always thoroughly cleaned our rooms and provided towels and toiletries with no fuss.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to the piers.  San Francisco was wonderful. Add the hotel and location and it's perfect.

review.title: In the heart of everything
review.reviewText: The hotel was not much to speak of, our view was a brick wall, the staff was nice, the room size was not worth the price, Expedia never booked the reservation!!

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: OK, nothing special for the price. This Hotel does not offer anything extra or special for $300.00 /night.
review.positiveRemarks: was not my first choice. But it was on the Wharf where I wanted to be

review.title: Nice hotel walking distance to PIER 39
review.reviewText: Enjoy my birthday vacation . Visited all restaurants, close to china town and took tours to alcatraz and other adventures.
review.positiveRemarks: Place hotel is  located didnt have to take any taxi to enjoy everything was near hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing our my experience
review.locationRemarks: Right close to PIER 39 walking distance

review.title: Very close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText:
We have been to San Francisco 7 times over the years and stayed in some lovely hotels. but this hotel is our no 1, it is almost on fisherman's wharf, and also so close to the famous cable car's. 
The hotel is very clean and comfortable, the room was very clean and the beds so comfortable, complementary bathroom toiletries. the room was just a perfect temperature, not to hot and not to cold the only issue we had was after a very long flight and a late arrival there was no water in the vending machine, when I told the gentleman on reception, he wasn't interested and just said there is a walgreens 2 blocks away, and the following night there was still no water.
I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quite location - comfortable room - very clean - and close to fisherman's wharf and cable cars.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable beds, cleanliness,  comfortable rooms, close to fisherman's wharf and cable cars, friendly staff, lovely reception, just everything
review.negativeRemarks: water in the vending machines!
review.locationRemarks: you are so close to fisherman's wharf and the cable cars, it is very central

review.title: Walking distance to Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel is ok.The bed and pillows were comfortable but the air-con was a bit noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning

review.title: one night stay
review.reviewText: convenient, well-maintained. A bit pricy for Holiday Inn but that's just San Francisco. Have stayed there before, and would do so again. Convenient enough to transit that a car is not necessary for attractions right in SF.
review.locationRemarks: very handy to Fisherman's Wharf and transit to Chinatown, Embarcadero and downtown

review.title: Great wharf location
review.reviewText:
When checking in they could not find my reservation, they had the wrong spelling of my name. Checked with Expedia and they had the correct spelling.  After 10-15 minutes finally got checked. 

On our last day we set up a taxi pickup for our party for that evening through hotel staff.  When cab arrived it was undersized for our requirements, a few minutes later another small cab arrives. The company sent two small cabs instead a minivan.  At this point we had very few options, ended up having to use the two cabs thus doubling our cost to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was overpriced for being very average. It would have been nice for the price charged to at least have had a small refridgerator in room.
review.locationRemarks: Great wharf location

review.title: Perfect location,  easy access to public transit.
review.reviewText: This was a great location close to fisherman's wharf and public transit. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. Plenty of close reading options.

review.title: hotel stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a location that is within walking distance to many of the sites, which is nice if you do not have a car.
review.locationRemarks: Close to many restaurants and Fisher's Wharf

review.reviewText: The soda machine on my floor had no product in it!  The toilet paper is too scratchy.  The chain takes advantage of it's great location.  The room service food was terrible.  There should be a laundry room on each floor.
review.negativeRemarks: See above in: about my experience.

review.title: Great location with very accommodating staff.
review.reviewText: My sister and I arrived at 11:00 in the morning and were hoping we would be allowed to leave our car in the hotel parking lot prior to checking in.  Not only could we leave the car, we were checked in at 11:00 and were able to begin enjoying our day.

review.title: wharf area
review.reviewText: I had a lovely time in your city and the hotel was centrally located for everything that I wanted to do.  Mary the front desk clerk was an exceptional helpful staff person.
review.negativeRemarks: complimentary coffee in early am
review.locationRemarks: centrally located for all transortation and tours

review.title: close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Center of activity and easy walking.  Staff was very friendly and helpful

review.title: hotel
review.reviewText: nice hotel,well located, would definitely stay there again

I think this is a decent hotel very central to many sightseeing opportunities. Like other hotels near Fisherman's Wharf, it is a bit costly however, it is very clean, safe, and the staff is very courteous. I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: adequate
review.reviewText: For price of hotel for one night and out the next morning to airoirt we would have probably better off staying closer to airport.

review.title: Nice hotel in the Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, centrally located, nice rooms.  No complaints!!!'

Affordable price   near fishmen warf
Loud AC   $40 parking fee is extra

review.title: Good location, easy access to transportation
review.reviewText: All staffs are friendly but when we first checked inn, the front desk personnel informed us with a bit of attitude that someone else has checked inn at our room already. We provided the proof of payment and waited for 20 minutes for them to figure the problem out. It was a hassle and inconvenience for us because we were tired. I understand that mistakes could happened but please do not make assumptions that guesses always wrong. However, the hotel concierge are the most polite and helpful staffs at this hotel for us.
review.negativeRemarks: Formal apologies and politeness are necessary for service industry even though guesses are wrong. Please train you staffs to treat guess fairly.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman Wharf, monorail, and 15-20 minutes away from golden gate bridge and park by car.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a very positive experience.  Everyone was friendly and helpful, and our room was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was within walking distance to everything we wanted to do.  The location couldn't be better.

review.title: Overall it's good
review.reviewText: From my room ,at night there were noises ,coming from the street ,people partying and talking loud. I think because the windows are single windows and don't close good.

Hotel is in a great location close to the embarcadero and pier 39. It's within walking distance to restaurants and shops. Fair price for the accommodations considering the location and city, San Francisco is quite expensive.

review.title: Perfect location for fishermans area!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a great location and there is a lot to do!
I was here on business so it was great being so close to everything in the evening to chill out.
The gym is very small.
Staff were friendly but there was little interaction unless you approached them!!

review.title: Holiday Inn/San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
My friend and I had tickets to a show and decided to stay at Holiday Inn because the price was the best we could find and Labor Day Weekend, at the Wharf.  We were close to the show, Little Italy and North beach.  When we arrived,  we easily got parking and the Registration Desk was absolutely pleasing and very informative.   Answered our questions and directed to persons who could help for the questions we couldn't.  The overall attitude and outstanding customer service was very noticible to me.   Part of me didn't expect the service we got for a Holiday Inn, it was more like a 5 Star hotel.  In fact, I have had much worse at a 5 Star.
We both noticed right away and our Bell Hop was simply amazing, quick, informative and a sheer pleasure of a human being and didn't come accross working for a tip, rather a nice person by heart.  My friend and I were both pleasantly surprized and will be back!  We stayed on the bottom floor right next to lobby, elevator for parking- extremely convienent.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Excellent Service, Kind people. Very clean, Beds and covers were great. Wanted to take linens home they were so comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: really can't think of anything, everything was clean, ice etc close.
review.locationRemarks: Beach Blanket Babalon, Little Italy, CAnnery Row, Fishermans Wharf, Ghirradelli (sp) Square, North Beach if you wanted to lay on sand or swim.

review.title: Expensive for the quality
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an ideal location in the Fisherman's Wharf area of town. The hotel was large, but understaffed.  We waited at the front desk for service any time we needed assistance.  Our hotel room window on the first floor was open when we arrived.  The front desk staff dismissed my concern bout the street level window being wide open.  The street noise was loud even through the closed windows.  Parking was an additional amount that was really, really high, plus tax  per day!  The room size was fine, but nothing special.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff could be friendlier, there could be more staff at the front desk.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is walking distance to the Fisherman's Wharf- and once we were parked at the hotel, we didn't need to drive again for the whole weekend!

review.title: Hotel was close to everything .
review.reviewText: Clean, modern hotel. A little pricey, but you are close to fishermans Warf, downtown and you could walk everywhere!! Only thing missing was a mini fridge

review.title: Affordable and close
review.reviewText: Planning a trip quickly (On Friday- to arrive Monday!), it wasn't easy to find a hotel that had rooms- or didn't require my selling my kids for ransom.  The staff (A shout out to the dining room staff!!) was helpful and very friendly.  The hotel was within walking distance of touristy things to see & do.  And their help in getting s back to the airport was stellar.
review.negativeRemarks: food available in the middle of the day
review.locationRemarks: FIsherman's Wharf is RIGHT THERE and easy to walk to and around.

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located.  It was fairly clean but in need of updating (popcorn ceilings...ugh).  The traffic noise was really really bad and the hallway was also not quite.  Plus it was very expensive.  But the room was large and the staff was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: location, location, location & onsite parking (expensive as it might be)
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need updating and the windows need to be replaced to cut down on outside noise.  Minifridge should be standard,
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf

review.reviewText: Great hotel within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: clean and convenient
review.reviewText: The location is good, the room is clean. there is a 24-hour Danny's restaurant in the ground floor. The only issue is no free parking ($45/day). All other is good. A safe area with lots shops around.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking could be free or cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: Gift stores and sea food restaurants around.

review.title: location location  great
review.reviewText: move to annex was no problem got there early and was moved to new annex with no problems
review.positiveRemarks: close to everything we wanted to see
review.negativeRemarks: airport shuttle

review.title: Hotel was convenient to everything
review.reviewText: Hotel was convenient to everything. We even felt the earthquake when we were there!  lol  Staff was friendly, we were able to check in early after a long day on the plane.  Hotel was well maintained, convenient, overall a great experience.  Would stay here again!

review.title: Convenient hotel close to pier 39
review.reviewText: You have to be sure to check in in the main building or else it is for young people to explore. Good overall but most convenient to the port

review.title: Great location-close to everything
review.reviewText: Concierge and hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Bed very comfy and toiletries nice.Lots to do close by. Hop- on Hop off bus great way to see the sights. Play, Beach Blanket Babylon in Little Italy so much fun and good food near by.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradlli Square, Hyde street cable car, maritime museum, Little Italy- all within walking distance. Great restaurants.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Location is family friendly but our room had view at the parking lot and we were not in the main building.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The people serving breakfast are very nice. Friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great  place to stay and enjoy San Francisco
review.reviewText: Parked the car and didn't need it for three days, walked or rode the hop on hop off buses everywhere . Location to wharf and pier 39 awesome. Be prepared for $40 a night parking   tax so whatever deal you get through expedia add $45 a night. Worth it to me for secure underground garage and just leave it.

review.title: not what we sign up
review.reviewText: We were put up in the second hotel which it wasn't what we sign up for. Our view was a dumpster out our window. We paid for location. Ask which hotel you will stay in.
Good location, friendly staff, WIFI very slow and wish the room came with a microwave.
review.negativeRemarks: wish the room had a microwave and fridge

review.title: best place
review.reviewText: Beautifuk hotel,staff was so helpfull, great location,beautiful room, very best beds,we loved it
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: lots of wonderful place to eat with in walking distance

review.title: Nice location, close to major attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice, location is perfect, but I wish they have a fridge in their rooms. When you stay longer then 1 day and with kids, it's really inconvenient. I won't choose them next time only because of this. Even if I eat out a lot I really need a fridge to store some products like milk.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect, 2 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, about 7 minutets walk to Coit Tower and Lombard street, Marina district.

review.title: Hotel tired but staff faultless
review.reviewText:
The hotel needs a complete make over to bring it up to date , but the staff more than made up for it.
The room was comfortable , clean and the free wifi was a real bonus , easily handling 3 ipads and two phones.
The old fashioned style of the hotel is reflected in the genuine customer service given by the staff.
Yes we would stay there again but with fingers crossed for a bit of a revamp in the near future ....
review.negativeRemarks: Decor
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to Fisherman's wharf and all amenities , couldn't be better located

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed this hotel.  It is a quiet oasis in the center of Fisherman's Wharf, providing convenient access to a lot of popular tourist locations, including the pier for Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, and North Beach.  It is also surrounded by restaurants, shops and other tourist activities, including cable cars, museums, tour operators, rental car companies, bike rentals, and more.  It was the perfect home base for our stay.  We could quickly get to where we wanted to go and then come back to a peaceful, relaxing atmosphere at the end of the day.  The staff was also very accommodating. They gave good advice about things to do, provided discount tour tickets, and also helped us arrange for a car service.  Everyone was really friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: We appreciated the central location, the helpful staff, and the peaceful atmosphere inside.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were a little soft for our taste.

review.title: Great location but average hotel!
review.reviewText:
First room had a musky odor and had to request a change.
Beds are all sagging in and could not sleep all night. Roon window was facing the back side where trash was stored and had Homeless Guys sitting all day going through the trash. Very poorly maintained .

review.title: Decent stay
review.reviewText: Close to the wharf so that was good, but you pay for it. Did not like the $4 cup of coffee, especially at the price we paid to stay at the hotel. No amenities in the room such as fridge or micro, unless of course you pay through the nose for them.  There is a starbucks a block away. They charged us $1 two times for two calls we did not even make. Seemed strange that they would not delete these two $1 charges especially since it reflects poorly on their integrity and the review I gave them. We paid $1250 for 4 nights (taxes, parking, etc.), any normal person would drop the $2 for some calls erroneously charged to our room.
review.negativeRemarks: room amenities and customer service
review.locationRemarks: wharf, lots of good food, Pompei Grotto has outstanding food at a very reasonable price, I highly recommend that place. Waitress was rude.

review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  We will be staying there again next year.

review.title: Great location near the wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed in the annex building, not the main building.  It was very quiet there.  I never heard activity in the rooms next to us, above us, nor below us, which says it is well insulated.  We asked for a quiet room and got one.  The parking was a little more $$ than parking in one of the lots nearby, but we lucked out every day and got to park right outside the entrance door of our building.  Worth it to us.  This hotel is within walking distance of everything you want to go see on the wharf and close to bus tours as well as the trolley car.  I don't know why we paid to rent a car when it sat in the garage everyday.  Lots of good food nearby, all around this location.  Now the Dennys in the building is another matter... Not recommended to eat there.  Hotel staff were friendly and efficient.  Our room and bathroom were well taken care of.  I would recommend this location to anyone despite the cost.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything you could possibly want to do and see.  Starbucks right down the street.  Andersons bakery across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the Dennys and its staff.  Bring in a better restaurant.  Bring down the price of hotel stay here.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley car, Ghiradellis, Joes Crab Shack, bus tours, Alcatraz, cruise the bay, bikes to rent, a lot of good food places.

review.title: Front Desk staff needs basic training
review.reviewText: Booked this super last minute. Prices were kind of high but I understand thats most likely because it was last minute and during Outside Lands weekend. I called before checkin to add another name to my reservation. Was put on hold for 30 minutes. I assume staff forgot about me because I called back after and was helped immediately. Experienced the same problem when I called from the hotel room to ask about check out time and was put on hold again. Front desk either needs to be retrained to remember to pick up calls they put on hold. Location was great. Had an issue one night with the door not opening even though key card was working. Security guard was able to open it after using some brute force.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: So close to most SF must see. Muni stops just outside the hotel.  Parking fee was about the same rate as other hotels.  Really friendly staff.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Excellent service, the price of the buffet a little high, but is San Francisco and everything is expensive.

review.title: close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Checked in was ok, then told us we had to walk a block to get to our hotel. We rolled are bags a block we were staying in annex, no one told us that so a block to walk to pool and to be picked up for any trips. We were told they did not pick up at annex but we seen alot of people being picked up there. When we got to room one of the keys didn't work so a block back and one back .We were told we has a frig in our rm. we had requested due to storing meds, no frig so another call. Staff was friendly and helpful after we got past front desk screw ups
review.negativeRemarks: Communications  check in ,, check in hotel you are really staying in

review.title: Convenient and so close to everything
review.reviewText: Everything went smoothe! Parking was secure, the room was clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The fitness facility was nice to have. Helpful and friendly staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, our waiter at the breakfast buffet- Quang. Quang  is very friendly and works hard. Edwin at the front desk is very helpful and nice!
review.negativeRemarks: We could have used more fold out holders for the luggage.
review.locationRemarks: Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf at 1300 Columbus Ave. San Francisco. Things to do nearby,  Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, The Embarcerdero.

review.title: Nice hotel-Great location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay!! The staff was all friendly & helpful!! The hotel was clean & quiet. Great location-only 2 blocks from Pier 39!!
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do!!! Pier 39 was a lot of fun!! Did a tour of Alcatraz-incredible!!! Lombard Street was a few blocks away-so much fun to see & do in the area

review.reviewText: It was very noisy outside our window starting at 8AM.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location - location - location it was good.
Maid service was excellent
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Everything was a short walk away. It was the reason I decided on this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, wonderful location!
review.reviewText: Overall, the experience was wonderful. I'm definitely going to book this hotel again...

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: close to Pier 39, we could walk to many locations and local restaurants were great
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant---food quality under par and very overpriced
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, close to beach,

review.title: Great location to see the wharf area
review.reviewText: We were not told we were in a separate building that was not convenient from the parking lot! At least if there was a gate out of the parking lot to the other building it would have been easier.

review.title: Very noisy
review.reviewText: We had to wait one and half hours after check in to get our room because they were still in the process of cleaning it. The room was right on top of the employee parking lost and the employees were very noisy early in the morning trying to get started with their work. Toilet was very old and dirty looking. Cleanliness was OK. Overall for the price it was terrible but the location is good.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to be updated and need better staff to assist their clients.

review.title: Dated
review.reviewText: Dated hotel with a view of the next building 10 feet away. Staff was either rude of barely understandable.  Location close but worth the walk for a better hotel.  Feels like a motel 6

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We had a great stay, very comfortable and the staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost is excessive for a Hotel like this one but it seems to be the status quo for all neighborhoods in SF.
review.locationRemarks: We went to a Giants game and enjoyed a great evening at Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Comfortable room.  Excellent bed.
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Wharf. Didn't need a car at all.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is 2 blocks away.  Buses and trolley run by hotel.  Great rooms, great location.

review.title: To Consider:
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel traveling by car. In general our experience was pleasing, but the cost for parking day is ridiculos!! 40 dlls per day is excesve.
review.negativeRemarks: parking rate
review.locationRemarks: Lambard Street, walking to Pier, travel to Alcartaz, visit Chinatown, Japantown.

review.reviewText: Would stay there again. Great location for many things to do.

review.title: Pleasing hotel close to the attractions.
review.reviewText:
Good Hotel generally close to all the attractions of Fisherman's Wharf.
Ground floor room a bit noisy as an service road ran passed the window.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to all the attractions of Fisherman's Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Better room location

review.title: my stay from 7/26-7/28
review.reviewText:
Ashley at front desk was super. I definitely wanted to remember her name because she was very accomodating towards us when I had originally requested a refrigerator. Only had interaction with one housekeeping staff and tipped her at that moment that she helped us out.

I wish there was a microwave. Should be standard. 

Parking cost is absurd. For a rental car hardly used, the $40 per day is such a  big chunk out of your pocket, then to find out that hotel charges another $5 per day for the tax on the parking. That is way too much. Refuse to pay that next time. Will choose another location than the Wharf. Will use Uber next time now that I know about it.

review.title: Nice hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Our stay at Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Warf was excellent. Even though parking was around $45 we were able to park until 6 pm the day we checked out. The parking garage was convenient and safe. We loved the location of the hotel as it was easy access to everything we wished to do. The facilities were clean and modern.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco-- we walked everywhere: China Town, Pier 39, Fisherman's Warf, Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Great Family Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean and nicely furnished. The staff was very nice. Front of hotel car/taxi/bellmen were great. We loved the closeness to Fisherman's Wharf, bus tours, restaurants, and shops. Concierge was very helpful. The down side was that there was no breakfast option on site except for the $24 buffet. Luckily we got a refrigerator for medical reasons and bought some breakfast foods close by to do our morning meals. Our family had a fabulous vacation and enjoyed the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast that was affordable.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location with great access to everything we wanted to do and see.

review.title: Pleasant hotel with great location in North Beach
review.reviewText: This hotel has one of the best locations in Fisherman's Wharf with easy access to transportation which can reach all of San Francisco. Cable cars, the big bug, F line cars, restaurants, and much more are easily accessible within a 5 minute walking distance or less. Would recommend to any travellers looking to experience the beauty of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of room

review.title: Noisey
review.reviewText:
Everything about the hotel was great. The staff was helpful and greeted and helped me as I arrived and walked to my room.   The room itself was clean with some hair on the towels but nothing to serious...we all shed lol. the hallways and street were very noisey...kids running down the hall and traffic. shutting the curtains didn't seem to help. overall it was a nice place to stay, i think for the amount of money I spent i would probably stay somewhere else and if you arre a light sleeper I would suggest the same.

 Hope this information helps and as I said before the staff was wonderful

Bright and clean room, soft sheets, close by to shops and dinning.  
Breakfast buffet was ok, potatoes were dry, service was slow.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: The room was great, but the bathroom inside the room wasn't to clean.

review.title: There is no balcony and something like that.
review.reviewText: Wireless really slow. There is no balcony. There is no roof. Parking is so expensive. They think a car is like a human!! Terrible..  But te room was clean it's ok

review.title: Perfect Location. Friendly Staff!!
review.reviewText: Wonderful location!! 10min or less walk to Cable Car, Beach, Piers, Lombard Street and lots more!! Made traveling with kids easy... Friendly/helpful staff. Clean, comfy rooms.  Plan to stay again!!  Only negative is their advertised free wifi would never work.  Tried & tried.... Could not connect unless we were in the lobby.

review.title: Decent hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We were assigned a room in the Annex to the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf.  The attached Denny's provided basic dining. There was no pool without walking outside to the main hotel. The room was beside a busy street and the glass window, which could have been double pane to cut the noise was simple single.  I admit a hotel  should be only a stop off point to rest before going out on the next event but the while the bed and washroom facilities were good the atmosphere and some of the creature comforts were lacking.  The reception clerk made a point of noting our reservation was made through Expedia and while I cannot be positive I do believe we may have had better accommodations had we reserved the room through Holiday Inn. As a retired accident investigator I still read body language and tone of voice pretty well. The best part of staying at this hotel was its location to all of the holiday venues such as tours, restaurants and access to city transportation. I would recommend this hotel but also state that travellers must request the main hotel if they want some nicer amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Access to all of the holiday venues such as tours, restaurants and access to city transportation.
review.locationRemarks: Tours of Alcatraz prison, ferries across the Bay to other cities, restaurants of all tastes, naval vessel tours, access to city transit

review.title: Near everything but.......
review.reviewText: Visiting SF for vacation.   Hotel was near everything.  This is not a terrible hotel, but being pushed off to buildings across the street from checkin was a surprise.  This should really be made clear when reserving the room.  Room was not dirty, but it was dated and not really clean.   Didnt know the building we were in had a front desk person til we checked out in the other building.   Beds were not very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds.  Better communication about off main premises building and available services in that building.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: It was the perfect location in Fisherman's Wharf.  It was in walking distance to everthing.  Everyone was very helpful.  Rooms were big and clean.

review.title: Free movie
review.reviewText: My bath tub was backed up, it was fixed in minutes and I was offered a free movie for my troubles.  The staff was great and friendly.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Wonderful Location!  Close to the wharf & ghiradelli, Walgreens right across the street, and many restaurants close by. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Great value for the area. Front desk staff was very accomodating - gave us an early check in and parking is a great deal considering this is SF and you can leave your car until 6pm the day of check out.  I see in other reviews there were comments about the distance between the main building and the building closer to the wharf - we didn't find it to be a problem or much of an inconvenience even after using the pool the walk wasn't too bad and the second building has it's own front desk to accommodate the guests of that building.
Bed linens needed to be switched out because they were musty

review.title: Nice hotel, good service & close to activities
review.reviewText: We stayed few nights in the a Holiday Inn & we were really happy with our stay. Good location, good service & very close to all the action in the Fisherman's Wharf. Plenty of restaurants, activities & walking distance to many attractions. We would have liked a slightly bigger room for a family of four, but somehow managed. To top up things there is also a coin laundry at the new wing.

review.title: Nice hotel, but watch out for extra fees.
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a good location for walking to most places. We were surprised at the additional $45 we had to pay to park at the hotel. On the hotel info page all it says is "Self parking (surcharge)" but does not tell you how much. There is only one lot at the main hotel and if your room is in the other building like ours was you have to shlep your stuff across the street. The curbside unloading is a joke next to the building and the tiny garage for 20 minute check-in (mind you ALL the spots are marked that) is very frustrating to get into.For the price you pay it would be nice to have a complimentary breakfast, but no such luck. The continental breakfast they offer is an additional $18 per person. We recommend going to Anderson's bakery right next to the hotel. Great prices and great food. For 2 of us it was around $13 for everything. Do not go to the Denny's. It is "tourist priced" meaning that everything on the menu is doubled in price due to the location. The room was fabulous (we got a towel animal on the bed) as well as the lobby and hall ways. The front desk staff was nice and professional and helped us find a better way back to the freeway. We also recommend walking a couple blocks away from the wharf for some great local eateries and watering holes that won't break the bank.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper parking and more clear fees.
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's wharf. Andersen's bakery next door is the best for a quick breakfast. The trolly turn around is up one block within walking distance.

review.title: nice room/strange setup
review.reviewText:
the hotel we stayed in was about a block from the Wharf - which was convenient, but the 'main hotel' with the poo and restaurant was 2 blocks away, so after check-in we had a porter wheel our luggage past the bus stop and down the busy street, while my family and I walked along behind, to get to our room...very strange and inconvenient setup.
The room itself was ok, double beds instead of queen made it difficult for my wife and I to be comfortable in the dame bed, so I shared with our son instead.  I would have preferred to have only stayed 2 nights and moved on the our next hotel in Watsonville a day earlier, but we did get to see fireworks on the wharf and then walk back to the hotel, so that was a plus...
review.negativeRemarks: guests should be notified of the building situation in advance of check-in
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli square, Sausalito ferry...what isn't nearby?

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Our first family vacation to San Francisco was great thanks to the great location of this hotel.  We were close to many food and restaurant choices.  We were also able to catch cable cars, buses, and street cars within short walking distances.  We were there for the 4th of July fire works in the Wharf and it was packed!  Thank goodness we were already in the area without having to catch a bus or drive to our hotel.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, and housekeeping was available as soon as we requested it.

review.title: Easy to drink
review.reviewText: Close to pier makes for easy grab booze and walk. Then back for refill. Hollywood cafe down the street has the best french toast! Worth the wait!

review.title: Expensive and tawdry
review.reviewText:
Very poor property 
Expensive but really poor experience
The room was not good
Not recognized as Priority club member
Staff was great
Building aweful

review.title: Will not stay again
review.reviewText: Hotel is good, but you will pay a big price for location including $40  tax a day for parking.  Good luck getting WIFI connection, very bad.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Fun vacation with the family - was able to visit all the usual tourist sites (Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, Bubba Gumps, Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, Chinatown, Aquarium by the Bay, Alcatraz - purchase tickets in advance because they sell out...would also recommend new show called San Francisco Dungeon - was really fun ... they have also opened up a new Ripley's Believe it or Not and a Wax Museum.) Weather is great - low 70's in town and cool 60's by the wharf and on the water. Shorts and T's are ok but bring a jacket as it gets chilly when the wind blows. Would recommend getting a weekly pass if you plan on using local buses and street cars - so much more convenient than trying to find parking - plus it's really expensive if you do find it. Great places to eat everywhere. Enjoy!
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Muni buses and street cars. Clean room, friendly staff, quiet, safe. Near restaurants, shopping, Walgreens.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked to have a microwave & fridge in room.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Fisherman's Wharf & local transportation-easy ride to Golden Gate Bridge, Six Flags, Downtown, Height Ashbury, Zoo, Aquarium by Bay, shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel in Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText:
Kind of worried when I saw some reviews saying that the garbage truck stopped by early in the morning and woke up the reviewers. I was staying on the 5th floor of the second building (1 block away from the main hotel building) and it was very quiet in the morning during my 3 nights stay. Not sure if the original reviewers were staying at the main building.

Wifi is not super fast but still good enough for checking email and surfing web.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very good as it is right in the middle of Fisherman Wharf. Really love the location.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Well position lovely hotel, great rooms
review.reviewText:
Our time with you was great although we planned to stay with you as we had door to door pick up and drop off for our two nights at Yosemite National Park. We had been travelling around The West side of America for 6 weeks and being Australian we had luggage and had to pay to store it else where at our cost as you would not store it even though we were coming back to stay with you which disappointed and upset us. In total we stayed 5 nights and enjoyed it and were happy there. The luggage incident disappointed us as we had never experienced any thing like that in all our travelling we have done over the years.
Also just a little grumble on our last night we went down to the bar for a drink and after asking staff for the barman you could see they were embarrassed eventually told us he wouldn't be long  he was on a break !!! Sorry not good enough.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and position were great staff very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Storing of luggage for travellers when returning to your hotel
review.locationRemarks: We were visiting relations so were getting taken around, the little free time we had we did enjoy walking around Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Everything overpriced, poor internet
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok. Being a tourist, one seeks the hotel concierge for recommendation and the agent they used charges US$130 each cash only (there were 3 of us) for 48 hour hop on and off tour includes Alcatraz and night tour. If you walk round the block, you get free entry to Bay Aquarium which we were not given through the concierge recommendation. The key fails to open our room on several occasions. Often, we can't access the internet in our room which was on the 3rd floor only.

review.title: Nice close to the wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was able to give us a room near pool- important when with kids! First room they gave us was in another building across the street- you might want to request prior to going at peak times!

review.title: Great beds
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great staff. The bed I slept in was wonderful. Close to everything at a resonable rate.

review.title: Hotel is split between two roads
review.reviewText: The main building vs the newer building.  We were happy to be in the new building however going down and around the street  w luggage and a baby was difficult.  Elevator requires a room card to go up Parking seemed high and hard to find, only 10 spots at the " new" building.  Room at was very loud.  Maids were great and friendly.  Don't waist time on $10 day fridge it's half the size of a mini fridge.

review.title: Hidden costs
review.reviewText:
Lots of hidden costs upon check in that were not disclosed to us AFTER purchasing the tickets several days prior. I also called the hotel # from the confirmation receipt and asked if continental breakfast was included and was told yes. Upon check in, they said they do NOT offer breakfast to us and it would be $22 PER PERSON! We were charged $45 per day for parking and had to pay $50 per room for incidentals UP FRONT with a credit card or $100 per room if we paid cash. We had 2 rooms. We were not financially prepared for these hidden costs.
That evening, we went to play pool in the lounge area and were told we could not play after paying for the game because a bartender was not present. They couldn't say something BEFORE paying for the game? What did they think we were going to do when we walked past the security guard to round the corner where the pool table was located. It was literally 10 minutes after walking into the pool table area that he came and told us we couldn't be there.
This hotel was not friendly and I am dissappointed with expedia not disclosing hidden hotel fees.
To top it off, the area the hotel is located has very few bars or clubs within walking distance to hang out after 10pm.
Stay was okay, no wonderful or horrible, just so so.

review.title: Family vacation to San Fran
review.reviewText: Staff provided us with a room at 10 am so we could drop off our stuff and begin sightseeing. Held our baggage on checkout day as flight didn't depart till 7:30 pm. Cleaning staff cheerful, friendly, did a fabulous job. Great location of hotel to wharf, bus lines. Would definitely stay here again. Great room #332.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, location, cleanliness, coffee maker, safe in room, size of room, cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing
review.locationRemarks: Wharf, bus, cable car, Walgreens, restaurants inexpensive and higher end

review.title: Hotel O'K, yes close to everything
review.reviewText: Our 4 nights there were enjoyable we chose your hotel as it was a pick up point for our trip to Yosemite Park but you don't account for travellers with luggage,we had to store our luggage indepentally which is an inconvience as we have booked backed into your hotel again when we get back.
review.negativeRemarks: As travellers from Australia you could store luggage for us to do small tours,

review.title: Great location and a nice feel to the hotel
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night however the hotel was everything we needed, and the location was perfect. Room was clean and well presented. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really

review.title: Extra charges are extreme
review.reviewText: Parking was an extra $50 and the continental breakfast was $20 for each adult

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I was expecting more from this hotel. The carpet seems dirty and old. The bathroom has a bad decor and look. They have the poor quality towels. However, the room looks clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Decoration, carpet and entrance hall.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to everything, Fisherman's Wharf , Pier 39, good restaurants and bakeries.

review.title: Nice hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel with an OK price considering the convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: $40 extra for parking seem a lot consider the fairly high room price

review.title: Don't plan on sleeping in...
review.reviewText: The maids are crazy loud. The racket starts at 6am. They argue in Spanish at the top of their lungs non-stop, then the vacuuming starts in the hallway banging the vacuum into the doors as they go. Then the banging on the doors announcing "housekeeping". All this and more can be yours for a mere $259 a night. Oh boy. Did I mention the loud drunks in the walkway off the lobby? Went on for a good 15-20 mins before I called the front desk and had to argue with the broken english speaking person answering the phone that hey were not on the street and in fact were on the hotel property under my window. I wouldn't stay there again if it was free. Oh yeah the room was very cramped also.
review.negativeRemarks: wrangle the maids
review.locationRemarks: close to the piers

review.reviewText: Good stay. Excellent location. Nice clean hotel with good amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and pillows were very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Very short walk to the fisher mans wharf, site seeing buses and bicycle rentals. Good restuarants nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf.
review.reviewText: The staff was very pleasant. We parked at the hotel and was able to walk to all the sites we wanted to visit. Our room was clean. I would stay there on my next visit to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant the service could have been better
review.locationRemarks: The location was great. We were in walking distance to everything.

review.title: Great Fisherman's Warf Hotel
review.reviewText: The bed was very comfortable, the location was perfect, and the concierge gave us two free tickets to the Aquarium on Pier 39!
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square

review.title: room was nice,but when we got back,there was a lar
review.reviewText: Room was nice. But when we returned.There was a large insect on a chair.He ran under the heat/a/c unit.didnot see him again.Nice view of Alcatraz. Very good location.I did not worry about 1 insect.
review.negativeRemarks: maybe an exterminator.
review.locationRemarks: close to everything!!!

review.title: No breakfast! And 45$ parking charge!!!
review.reviewText: Very disappointing - the room was ok, bed was uncomfortable. There was no breakfast- as promised in the booking - and the parking was 45$ extra!! Very expensive for poor quality. The location is good- but...

review.title: Poor Check-In Service and High Parking Fees
review.reviewText: I was not given a gate key to exit the hotel parking upon check-in (didn't know I needed one, so did not know to ask), which made it difficult to get out of the parking garage the first day. Front desk also did not provide me with the internet password upon check-in and I had to ask later. The front desk person seemed to lack knowledge and comfort with his job. The parking fees are TOO HIGH! Forty dollars per night to park my car is ridiculous! I was not pleased, overall, with the service and amenities at this hotel, so I think I will choose differently when I go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk service; Parking fees
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf Ghiradelli Square Chinatown Alcatraz

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We were able to walk everywhere we wanted from this location. Close to several good restaurants. Desk staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: We were very surprised by the parking rates, they were VERY high.

review.title: Convenient to Fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
Hotel needs updating. Staff helpful but rooms not appealing.
Breakfast very expensive and poor quality. Go to Bourdains only 2 minutes away and half the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor
review.locationRemarks: Obviously good given that Fishermans wharf nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel and close to the P39
review.reviewText: This is the best hotel , you can have fun and close to anything in SF , nice services

review.title: Good hotel location with many nearby amenities
review.reviewText: Very friendly hotel staff, nothing was too much trouble. Quiet area and bed very comfortable with choice of soft or firm pillows - slept well every night. Hotel is split between two sites a very short walk from each other but both have reception areas so no need to use the main building if not staying there. Expensive to eat on site but not a problem as surrounded by many eating places. Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location,friendly staff,quiet area,very comfortable bed,tea/coffee-making facilities in room.Complimentary provision of any toiletries etc forgotten.
review.locationRemarks: Many eating places,shops and attractions with excellent transport links to the city.Cable car 5 minutes and MUNI streetcar 1 minute away.

review.title: San Fran Love
review.reviewText: This hotel was walking distance from just about all of San Fran's main sights. Nearest to Fishermans Wharf. Great location and wonderful staff.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The stay was great! We were walking distance to bus stops, popular piers on Fishermans wharf and great food spots. Very clean, good wifi connection and the lot. Highly recommended.

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText: Rooms were not connecting as requested even tho room next to us was vacant first night. Room was musty smelling.

review.title: OK ~ but don't expect much
review.reviewText:
Nothing really to moan too much about [other than we were charged for a film we didn't watch but this was politely sorted by staff] but room had no fridge which was huge disappointment

Lobby was always horribly noisy, full of shouting tour groups or screaming children

Coffee / tea machine in room didn't work well, when rang housekeeping got abrupt woman with limited English who was quite dismissive. Not impressed

Not a hotel for the quiet over 50s like us

We stayed at the Courtyard 2 weeks before, a lovely experience in contrast & well worth the few extra $
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping staff manners Fridge in room
review.locationRemarks: on the wharf near the F line street cars

review.title: Can someone help me with my luggage please
review.reviewText: My experience was not great. I arrived at 1300 Columbus to check in only to be told that I was actually staying at the newly renovated Holiday Inn which turned out to be a block away. If these rooms were considered newly renovated I would hate to see the other rooms. It was obvious I had alot of luggage with me. I was there for a race and had a huge awkward case with my disassembled bike in it, another large roller suitcase and a equally large knapsack. The weight of my luggage was the equivalent of me. I am a middle aged though fit woman. One would have expected given I had to travel a block that I would have been offered assistance. I wasn't. In fact as I was struggling with my gear to the hotel a local young man kindly offered to help me to the hotel. Unfortunatley there were two more holiday inns back to back and I went to the wrong one as the directions weren't clear. Again I was assisted by hotel guests (not staff) when we finally figured out I was in the wrong hotel. One of the guests inquired for me and we were pointed to the other holiday inn. Again no assistance was offered as I trudged outdoors. As I made my way to the other hotel, two more hotel guests took my larger piece of luggage from me (all of assistance done without my asking yet never by a hotel employee) and helped me into the lobby. I had hotel guests helping me into the elevator and offering to assist me all the way to my room.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was decent and bed comfy. However there was a two inch gap from the floor to door which I had to put towels down. Wierd.
review.negativeRemarks: All of the amenties, pool, conceriage, 24 hour service were in the other hotel. This was misleading. I was paying $220/night.
review.locationRemarks: close to Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Clean, comfortable, convenient
review.reviewText:
Would highly recommend this hotel to any potential tourists. It is conveniently located (within walking distance) for all attractions along Fisherman's Wharf, i.e. Pier 39, Alcatraz cruise etc. Cable car terminal at end of street, takes you to a large shopping area with all the main shops. Hotel has very comfortable beds and free WiFi in the rooms. There is a buffet breakfast for around $20 p.p.

Only gripe was that the room was cold as we were unable to switch off the air con.

review.title: Great hotel near the wharf and beach.
review.reviewText: easy check in. clean room in newer building. Luckily parking was available in the tiny 15 car lot downstairs and even though it was $45/day, it was very convenient!
review.negativeRemarks: shower drained kinda slow. add a few more kid-friendly TV stations.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION, BUT,...
review.reviewText: Excellent location near Fisherman's Wharf, although I don't like that the hotel is split into 2 buildings. Although it's a short walk from the main lobby, you still need to walk on the outside and on the sidewalk, and if it's late at night, like when I arrived, it would've helped to have hotel staff offer somekind of help with our luggage, but it was not offered. I requested 2 beds, but I got 1 bed instead, and when I addressed this to the night manager, he said all rooms were sold-out and nothing could be done. I addressed this to the day manager 2 days later, on the day I was checking-out, told him I was returning for another stay later in the week, which I booked on Expedia as well, and said by choice I would rather not return, but it was already paid for. Although he could not compensate my room rate, he upgraded my room, made sure I got 2 beds this time, and offered help with our luggage, even offered free breakfast and parking, but declined both because I was leaving very early the next morning and already returned my rental car. Overall, the day manager, Stephen was great. He listened and was VERY professional. I would probably return, but only if Stephen were checking me in.
review.negativeRemarks: A shorter route to the next building or offer luggage service, which I wouldn't mind tipping for due to the inconvenience
review.locationRemarks: 2-3 blocks away from Ghiradelli Square, Cable Car turnaround, and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice, close to attractions, but pricey bistro.
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable, but the bistro is expensive. We ordered a 2 egg omelet (we shared the meal) and two coffees which totaled $38.00. Great place to stay, but recommend eating at other restaurants:)

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, close to Fisherman's Wharf, clean building, and friendly staff.

review.title: First Rate Hotel
review.reviewText: My son and I had a fantastic 7 night stay at this hotel. Wonderful location, friendly and courteous staff, super clean rooms, excellent breakfast, swimming pool, child friendly, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. I am a seasoned traveler. Would definitely recommend and will stay again. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. 10 out of 10
review.positiveRemarks: Everything .. especially location, cleanliness, staff, food, parking, facilities. Excellent all round.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf. All amenities close to hand. Ripleys Believe It or Not. Excellent cuisine. Shops.

review.title: Over night stay
review.reviewText: My daughter , wife, & I stayed over night for a baseball game . Our stay was great . It was quited comferble. We are planing on a order stay. This time a little longer . To enjoy our room & what San Francisco has to offer .

review.title: Awesome stay!!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. Hotel had the most comfortable beds. Hotel is in a great location. We will be back!!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location!! Great place to eat. Desk staff very helpful. Very comfortable beds!!

review.title: Great location, comfy and clean
review.reviewText: Located in Fisherman's Wharf, near bus stops. Able to take the bus or walk to everything. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly. Good for the price. The only thing I didn't like was there was a $10/day charge if you wanted a refrigerator in your room. I've never stayed anywhere that charged for a mini fridge! There is a Denny's in the hotel that is open 24 hours which is nice if you are a late night eater!

review.title: Excelent location, good hotel
review.reviewText: Excelent location, near Fisherman Wharf and near Ghiraldelli Square, some blocks from Lombart Street. Beautiful hotel, very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, near everything matters in San Francisco

review.title: Hotel was close to the activity center.
review.reviewText: It was easy to go from the hotel to all the activities(alcatraz, cable cars, sightseeing bus)
Great location and close to every kind of public transportation...I strong suggest you this hotel. Best regards

review.title: Very nice location close to Pier 39.
review.reviewText: Wonderful nice quite hotel.  Nuce restaurant with good food.
review.locationRemarks: Close to pier 39

review.title: In walking distance of several attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel was quiet and clean. Room was large with comfortable linens. Only a short walk to many attractions - Fishermans Wharf, Cable Car, The Buena Vista. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and well-kept. Staff was accommodating and friendly. The hotel is literally on the front door-step of Fisherman's Warf. Lots or restaurants & tour companies nearby. Lots of street performers adding to the ambiance.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive ($45 per day at the hotel and $20 per day at the public lots). Use public transportation, if possible.
review.locationRemarks: Located right in Fisherman's Warf. Walking distance from North Beach (Little Italy area) and China Town

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText:
Walking distance to Fishermans Warf. Good service, friendly people. Pool was disappointing.
Would definitely come back.

review.title: good value in the heart of Fisherman`s Wharf
review.reviewText: Wanted a simple clean inexpensive room in which to relax after the strenuous legwork of sightseeing. This hotel supplied that.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: It was hardworking vacation. Reception staff had heard what we needed for the stay. We so appreciated good rest each night.
review.positiveRemarks: High standards in keeping rooms tidy.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff at the hallways, usually porters, didn't respond to our hello's or greetings.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed the visit. The hotel is within walking distance to Ghirardelli Square and Pier 39. Check in was a breeze, the nice woman who checked us in gave us a map of the area and circled some key places we wanted to see. The room was clean, comfortable and roomy. The bathroom was clean, but a little cramped for space with 2 people sharing. Wifi was easy to connect to and we had good signal strength the entire time. Parking in the underground structure was a bit of a nervous experience, but I guess that's what parking in a city is like. We will definitely stay here again when we come back.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, helpful staff. Beds and pillows were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: If you are close to ground floor, be warned that the street sweepers come by every morning at 3am.
review.locationRemarks: Ghirardelli square and Pier 39

review.title: hotel
review.reviewText: clean, comfortable hotel, close to attractions, however rooms noisy with road traffic noise

review.title: Everything is fine except for wifi
review.reviewText: I have stayed in this hotel for almost one week and I have to call the service centre everyday to fix the issue. The speed is so-so and it keeps off and on from time to time without any reasonable cause. Everything else is fine. The room is comfortable. The facility is doing okey.
review.negativeRemarks: The wifi service
review.locationRemarks: Eating Cobbs in Fisherman Wharf!!

review.title: Great hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf

review.positiveRemarks: Enjoyed San Francisco very much and the location of your hotel made it possible to visit everything we wanted to see
review.negativeRemarks: Should be small fridge in room for refreshments to be stored. Bathroom seemed very tired.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants, shopping, hop-on hop-off buses

review.title: Handy location
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, clean rooms, food OK - Lack of knowledge by concierge, restaurant service OK, except Usha was amazing and really made us welcome and gave great tips on San Fran and looked after my very old parents and young daughter, more so than the rest of the staff put together, who made it feel more like a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge who were there I think just to book tours, they didn't have knowledge on the Muni tickets on the public transport.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Best location!
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights with the wife. Right on Columbus Ave. and a rocks toss distance from cable cars, best bus lines for access to Golden Gate Bridge, and the F line trolly that runs a loop from the Wharf to Downtown SF. Only a few yards from the entrance to Fishermans Wharf too(AAAAND the In-And-Out Burger)! The hotel isn't very tall, so outside noise was my only complaint, but it's not enough to stop you from getting a good nights sleep. The girl at the front desk the day I checked in was super helpful (and cute!) when I bombarded her with questions. I'd definitely stay here again

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Travelled as a family (boys ages 7 and 9)) and found the hotel to be perfectly located, just 1.5 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, 1 block from the start of the Powell & Hyde cable car, 1.5 blocks to F-line streetcar stop, and 1.5 blocks to Ghirardelli Square. So close to LOTS of attractions and restaurants, which couldn't be better for a family! The only downside of the hotel was the noise in the morning from outside, even being on the 4th floor didn't help much. We would definitely return to this hotel again the next time we visit San Fran.

review.title: Struggled for heat& hot water
review.reviewText: For our first 2 days our heat would come and go. Maintenance came and turned the unmarked knobs for us. He came the second night also. That time he offered us blankets that he would send via housekeeping. They didn't come until I called. Then he brought 1 blanket for 4 people. We called to have another sent up. It never came. First shower, fine-next person got barely warm,3rd-too hot , 4th was cold.Changed rooms. Better.Rooms were dusty,could be cleaner. First room was noisy. Could almost touch the cable car line if you leaned out window. No refrigerator in first room.

review.title: Great location but ok hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great location in SF, but possibly better hotels available. Laundry facilities were expensive and half machines were out of order requiring long walk to second building to use facilities there which also were partially out of order. Beds tiny for couple but ok for single bed sleeper, rooms offers basic accommodation.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing really stood out apart from location and I guess pricing
review.negativeRemarks: Make the beds bigger. I am not a tall person only average but felt like I was sleeping in a large single bed
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge, pier 39, Alcatraz, great eating on waterfront, cable car station, trolley station with these two giving near total access to SF

review.title: Value for money but they charge parking fee,

review.negativeRemarks: the parking fee should show on the booking page

review.title: Convenient stay

review.negativeRemarks: When we went to Denny's we had to wait almost an hour for our food. The other restaurant was too expensive.

review.title: Nice and quiet.

The room was big and clean and there were great amenities and the staff was very helpful, there was free wifi and breakfast even though we didn't take advantage of it. Best value for the price of any hotel I've stayed in. I will definitely be staying here again.

I did read the reviews before my purchase and was skeptical but glad I picked it will return ..so I hope I get the same great room when I visit again and hope new comers will experience greatness as well

review.title: Disappointing Stay.
review.reviewText:
There are 2 separate buildings of the same hotel, the principal with most of the facilities, such as restaurant, fitness center, business center and swimming pool, and the secondary, which is about 1 and 1/2 bocks away from the other, for what there is the ned to go out to the street to get to the principal.
When checking in, I was sent to the secondary building, because the principal,l I was told, was totally occupied, advising me to check the next morning for availability, at which time I was again refused to be moved to the principal building, apparently because of the same reason. However, I realized, since the last afternoon, that guests checking in after me, were offered the principal building. I was apparently discriminated, probably because I didnt realice my reservation with the hotel, but with Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: Avoiding discrimination for the source of the reservation and informing beforehand what building is available and where you will be located.

review.title: Close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was close to all the action at Fisherman's Wharf, that was the big feature. Pricey rate for the little you get: no fridge, bad coffee machine set-up, shampoo and conditioner only but no extras; would have been nice to have mouth wash and body gel. The hotel is on 2 separate blocks and we were unfortunate to be on the block with no pool so we had to walk across the street to get to the pool; very inconvenient. I would come here again only if I could not find a better deal in hotels.

review.title: Fair Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was located close to the wharf and very convenient for many attractions. The staff were friendly and having Denny's restaurant connected was great for breakfast. We asked to upgrade to a king bed and were given a handicap room, which we were told wasn't needed. The room had no counter space in the bathroom. Daily cleaning consisted of making the bed only. I have never stayed in a hotel that did not offer cleaning daily. By day 5, the bathroom mirror was splashed, rug needed vacuuming, and even a makeup spill was left on the floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning should occur daily.
review.locationRemarks: It was within walking distance of the wharf several restaurants, tour, stores, and several attractions.

review.title: Clean and comfortable @ a $$$

review.title: Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel has 2 buildings, one across the street from the other, so if you are wanting to swim in the pool you should ask to stay in the main building. We stayed in the 2nd building, 5th floor. The 2nd one has a 24 hr Denny's. Only one elevator was working. Not a big deal for us. The room was clean, quiet and the beds were ok comfy. The location of this place is the huge seller. It is a short walk to the Pier and the waterfront. Walk up the hill and you can catch the cable cars to China Town. You have to pay $45 dollars a day to park your car here, but having the car to go to the Muir Woods was fantastic!
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators did not work very well and the front desk staff wasn't very friendly.

review.title: Good location and clean room

review.title: Good location but noisy room
review.reviewText: This was the last hotel of four that we stayed in during our vacation, and was sadly the worst. We had to walk our luggage from the first building to the second, didn't get to use the pool as it was in the other building (we didn't feel comfortable walking back), and our room was near the elevator that was being worked on starting at an earlier hour. They did relocate us for the second night, but we just did not find this hotel as pleasing as the other ones we stayed at along our route. Would pick a different one when staying in San Francisco in future.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel was located within walking distance to Pier 39, the Alcatraz departure pier, cable cars, Ghirardelli, etc which is why we picked it.

The staff were okay but could use more on the desk as you wait in line while they take reservations and inquiries on the phone. In line to check in and out. Big plus we got to keep,our car there the next day while we toured. Though found out about the cost of parking at end of non refundable reservation. Loved the closeness to the wharf and wish we had more time to look around.. The drive up took too long.
review.positiveRemarks: The close walk to the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Third person charge and parking fee not evident when searching for best price.

review.positiveRemarks: Safe, clean and friendly helpful staff.

review.title: Adequate hotel in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night in this hotel. It was a typical Holiday Inn, though it seemed a bit run down. Maybe that's why they were working on it at 7:30 in the morning! GACK! The staff seemed interested in doing their jobs, but they were clearly just doing their jobs. The hotel restaurant was incredibly expensive ($24.00 for the breakfast buffet, which was very limited; $8.00 for a bowl of oatmeal). The bed was comfortable enough, but the noise was awful.

review.title: A lot of drama this time!!!
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here before with no hiccups, but this time was a whole different experience.

We were put to stay in the building where the 24hr Denny's is. Never stayed in that building before. It's closer to the wharf with a better view.

There are two elevators and one was being serviced. Nothing wrong with that, but if you take the stairs up, you cannot open the door to your floor. Really makes no sense other than keeping unwanted people off the floors. Either way, dumb idea.

Our first night there we were awaken by a fire alarm at 12:30AM. It had rained so it was really cold. I have a 6 year old so I took the comforter off my bed to keep her warm while we waited for the firemen to turn the fire alarm off. Apparently someone thought it would be funny to set the alarm off. We didn't find it funny at all!!

There is a lack of personnel at that building. The front desk was closed most of the time we stayed there. We were headed out to dinner and needed a taxi. No one around. Had to use the house phone to call someone at the other building. Taxi didn't get there for about 20-30 minutes. They also tried to sell me a town car ride instead of a taxi to the dinner place which they said was cheaper. Turns out the taxi was cheaper by $15.00.

I actually love this hotel although it may not seem like it with this review. There were just a few things that bothered me THIS time. I will always try to stay here when in the area
review.positiveRemarks: Closer to wharf than other building 24hr Denny's in building
review.negativeRemarks: More personnel needed!!!
review.locationRemarks: Very nicely located to everything. We took the public transportation the whole time we were there. No need for a car.

review.title: Cheap Hotel in an Expensive Area
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel based on its prime location and excellent price. However, upon checking in I soon noticed that the hotel was inexpensive for a reason. The first room we were given had wallpaper partially hanging off of the wall, with a substance that resembled mold on it and the wall. The second room we were given was better, but when I asked for a room with a view, I was given a room with a view of the wall of the next-door building. The bathrooms were musty and lacked proper ventilation. The hotel staff did give me a free night of parking for my trouble. The downstairs restaurant was insanely overpriced, the breakfast menu prices rivaled dinner prices of the same quality in the area. The Fitness Facility was cramped, with barely enough room for the items located within it, let alone the ability to exercise inside of it.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel needs a complete renovation.

review.title: Beautiful view
review.reviewText: Had a great experience

review.title: Clean, safe and close to warf
review.reviewText: It was great. Cheap food nearby too...Subway and a good coffee shop around the corner. Friendly staff. Only negative was that our bathtub/ shower didn't drain very well.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Overall, a pleasant experience, no problems with the facility or staff.
There is a fair amount of street noise early every morning from garbage and delivery trucks, and some in the late evenings from partyers passing through on the street below. The single pane windows did not block it at all. Our room was 3rd floor at the corridor end, and only had one shared wall, so interior noise was not an issue. Furnace a bit noisy though.
The only real disappointment was the in room coffee, which was awful. Next time I would bring a package of high quality instant for the first cup of the day and use the coffee maker for the hot water. There is a Starbucks in the lobby for the next cup.
Our room had a small un-stocked frig, which was handy. There's a Walgreen's only a block or so away with reasonable prices on beverages, and a liquor store sharing the corner, but it is more expensive.
The usual hair dryer and iron were provided.
In an overview, this is a mid range hotel with a really good location.
review.positiveRemarks: The really comfortable pillow top mattress and oversize pillows. The linens were fresh and clean. The beds were made up well.
review.negativeRemarks: The in-room coffee was undrinkable, and I am not a coffee snob. If you want that first cuppa when you get up you have to go to the lobby and buy it.
review.locationRemarks: Within convenient walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, many restaurants, and muni transport is very close.

The price of $40 extra to park your car.
review.locationRemarks: Very good Location.

review.reviewText: I wasn't expecting our room to be so nice and clean but it really was! And the bed was so comfy! And in great location. Perfect for anyone on a budget! I would stay here again anytime!

review.title: Nice place, parking on street not an issue
Good cheaper hotel option on FW area
review.reviewText: Good hotel in excellent location - walked to most of the local attractions. Would recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: A little dated in some areas. generally good.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, Alcatraz Little italy, china town all within walking distance.

review.title: Close to the wharf but needs some help.
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights while visiting SF. Room was clean but it is an old hotel with the slowest elevator I've ever used. Hotel is actually 2 seperate buildings on seperate streets so after checking in we had to carry our bags the 1/4 mile to the other building. Ok place if all you do is crash there each night after a day of sight seeing.

Tried to check in the Main Lobby--and hotel--Counter person said we had to stay down the street at another location of
theirs upstairs from Denny:s Rest. Our luggage was put on a cart and wheeled down the street to that location. The lobby was old and without facilities like the Main Location i.e. Restaurant / Bar / nice lobby with chairs and tables to visit friends/ breakfast facilities etc.

We were not told in advance we could not stay in the main hotel or we would not have stayed . We talked to the assistant manager who was of no help, just plain excuses. He said they were full-but traffic did not evidence that comment.
