In any event, poor service and a reservation disguise . I have stayed their in the past but NEVER knew of the shuffle without any knowledge . We had to leave our car at the main location. What if it was raining and /or a handicap situation??. POOR__POOR--Never again---jack Sanford--Also our reservation was made a few days before arrival so they knew in advance of the situation.
review.positiveRemarks: The main hotels location---and the use of the lobbies facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and notification of the shuffle down the street--Our friends are in one location and we are down the street-Should book somewhere else.
review.locationRemarks: Many other hotels to consider--same location

review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was my only complaint. Nowhere to put your toiletries, too little counter space, and could use a few hooks to hang items.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText:
Wonderfully located to close to everything we wanted to visit . Staff was very helpful in planning tours and locating everything !

We really enjoyed our visit !

review.title: Upscale Holiday Inn
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, better than the average Holiday Inn, in excellent location
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was especially nice, location was great and easy to get to all the places you want to see in the city
review.locationRemarks: Very central location,easy to walk to Fisherman's Wharf attractions and restaurants and quick cab ride to other San Francisco hot spots

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect for tourists. Mere steps from Pier 39 in the Fisherman's Wharf area with the restaurants, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location as well as the outdoor firepit area and "back door" to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.reviewText: too expensive for the hotel quality

review.title: Nice hotel, very convenient to the waterfront
review.reviewText:
the location is great, close to piers 39 etc. (where the action is)
it is comfortable and clean, would stay there again. $$$ pricey for a Holiday Inn, but location is worth it.

It was good. The parking is a bit of a rip off. Then walking from one part of a hotel to another is quite tedious. One of the elevators was out of order. The room was nice enough if a little out dated. The pool table wasn't in the best condition.
review.positiveRemarks: How close it is to the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Get the elevator working again. Upgrade the furnishings. There was a bunch of scuff marks on the walls of the hotel rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Good place if you would like to be close to the wharf.

review.title: Close to important objectives
review.negativeRemarks: No mini bar in the room
review.locationRemarks: Great location, best places near by

review.title: location,location,location
review.reviewText:
We arrived around 3:30PM, room was ready and check in was OK, because our room was in the other building, except to go the other building, you have to go outside the hotel back on to the street
to go to another street, but when we got there, we found out that we could have check in from there,and the frt desk at the main bldg., did not offer to take our bags to the other bldg either.
We booked the room weeks ahead, the hotel could have notified us the other building's address so that we could have gone directly from the airport to that location. Room was clean and nice size,except it only has one desk chair and no sofa chair by the window/reading area, we ask for another chair and got a dining chair with stains, that end up being a suitcase stand.
There were some noise issue from the hallway on our first night, we call to frt desk and security took care of it right away.
When we book through Expedia, it said Free Local Call for this hotel, but when We reconfirm this with the hotel, they said there will a charge for local call.
But this building has better location than the main one, closer to the fishermans wharf, a short walk to pier 39, the streetcar, the ferries , all bus tours, cable car starting point, Walgreen(for water) and many restaurants.
.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Location. Comfortable Rooms. walking distance to al lot of things
review.negativeRemarks: on the Expedia site, it stated free local calls, but the hotel said there is a charge for local calls. who is right ???
review.locationRemarks: There is a Andersen Bakery just across the street, great coffee, bagels and breakfast sandwiches and they open at 6AM, so you could have a good BB bef

review.title: Great location for exploring the wharf area
Fair deal for San Francisco
review.reviewText:
When on business trips to San Francisco I usually stay at Union Square or the Financial District. I tried this Holiday Inn at Fishermans Wharf and was pleased. The price was good, the hotel is clean and quiet. I was able to get a passing cab for my ride to the airport. Though I didn't eat there, a Denny's is attached. A Walgreens is on the opposite corner so there are some nice conveniences at this location.

Overall, a good value.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Warf.
review.reviewText: Staff were helpful and friendly. I asked for a room change and they were very accomodating. We ended up with no hot water one morning which was stressful for the staff, but they were patient and professional.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating perhaps?
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf, Short walk to Cable Cars. Many restaurants near by.

review.title: Pleasant Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: This Holiday Inn is in the best location to enjoy walking to Fishermen's Wharf, excellent seafood restaurants, Pier 39, Maritime Museum and Hyde Street Pier exhibits, and the starting point for the Powell & Hyde cable car line. The rooms are clean and well-appointed. The very nice check-in clerk gave us a suite because we got there at 9pm when they didn't have any regular rooms left with a king bed as we requested. There is quite a lot of street noise, but that's to be expected in a big city. However, the walls are thin, so you do hear other guests in the halls and next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise issues from the streets and other guests in hallways and next door.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermen's Wharf, great seafood restaurants, Pier 39, Hyde Street Pier, Waterfront Museum, Powell & Hyde cable car starting point.

review.title: Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for four days in mid-October. Great location. Walking distance to restaurants on the Wharf and Columbus Street, bike rentals, the ferries, and lots of other activities. Hotel was clean, the concierge had helpful recommendations for eating, and the staff was knowledgable. Reasonably priced for SF lodging.

review.title: Nice area walking distance to a lot.
review.reviewText: Hotel was walking distance from many attractions as well as having a spot to catch street cars right behind the hotel. Convenient and has parking garage under hotel (extremely hard to find in San Francisco!) I think they should allow guest to park for cheaper as it cost $40 a day even if you are a guest. Only $5 more if you are not a guest.

review.title: Close to THE pier
review.reviewText: The hotel is not far drom fishermena wharf. THE pier is 5 minutes walking distance away.

review.title: Nice Hotel Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to the Wharf. We were able to park and walk everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower parking fees.

review.title: Not a worthy experience
review.reviewText: Staff provided a fake concern with promises of upgrades for the delay in room assignment. "Your room is not ready, so we are going to put you in an upgrade...", which turned out to be just a normal room.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoother check in without delays. It's not like we were just walking in. Reservations had been made months in advance.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Trolley, Ghardellie

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but our room (160) was in a corner at street level and was without a doubt the noisiest hotel room we have ever stayed in. I would only stay in this hotel again if we were guaranteed a "Quiet"room at night!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff were very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing!

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: In Fisherman's Wharf you are close to all the trips you would want. also close to Public Transport to visit other area's of San Francisco, if you are there for more than a few days of you will want to spend a lot of time doing other things. Being Fisherman's Wharf (A posh Blackpool type area) you have the Bus tour trips, The Cable Car trips, The Bay tour ships, Alcatraz (if there is not a Govt Shutdown). There are lots of tourist shops for your tee shirts/baseball caps etc. Obviously as the name suggests there are a lots of restaurants selling Sea food but you can get other types. China Town is relatively close by bus and there are a whole spectrum of places to eat. Again there are trips to the national parks (if there is not a Govt Shutdown) and you can do trips to wine country if that's your thing. San Francisco does appear to have a higher proportion of homeless and you will see lots around the Wharf area. In general they are not aggressive with their begging. I went in October and the weather was great. Not even any fog. I even went to Mama's @ Washington Sq nr Stockton for breakfast. It opens at 8am but they start queuing from 7am to get in. Fantastic food.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Room Upgrade, friendly staff, they look after you.
review.locationRemarks: Being Fisherman's Wharf (A posh Blackpool type area) you have the Bus tour trips, The Cable Car, The Bay tour ships, Alcatraz

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for travelling around the entire city and the room was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Nice and celan hotel. Clase to the warf
review.reviewText: Unforgetable , nice place and near from the warf. The best place of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve about the press water in shower
review.locationRemarks: Visit the warf. Eat the best clam chowder near in boudin restaurant and walk around the neighbor

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: My family of five had a great experience staying at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf. Can't think of a better location. Very safe. Near all shops and restaurants, Ghiradelli Square, Piers, Golden Gate bridge. Just about everything is in close walking distance. Transportation is literally right outside the hotel. Walgreens across the street. Food is very expensive in SF. Kids breakfast is free with adult purchase. This was obviousy a plus. Denny's is also inside of hotel. World class city. Very nice hotel. We really enjoyed our stay
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary parking would be nice
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location on the Wharf, as it was right next to Ghiradelli Square, close to all shops, Pier 39, and fairly close to Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: facility is not matched with the price we paid for
review.reviewText:
- Requested quiet room but got the room at corner of the street and the parking corners for beach merchants.
- Didn't expect fancy views but our window view is the big dumpster for the hotel. For the price the hotel charged,
we expected at least clean and decent view.
- The furnitures of the room are so outdated and chipped. It's not a pleasant place to go into and we were so
anxious to get out of.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything needed to be improved. No one cared we were there!
review.locationRemarks: Sorry, we try to forget the experience. There are better places to go!

review.title: Nice location. Very close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Close walk to the Wharf experience. Hotel staff, nice. No shuttle to airport.

review.title: Good hotel with excellent beds
review.reviewText: Hotel is very comfortable and close to Fishermans Wharf, cable car, F line trolley car, tour buses etc. The room was large, clean and the king bed was really comfortable. The only issue was the the laundry was not working and we had to use the facilities in the other building which was a pain. Cafe in the foyer was good for a coffee and quick breakfast.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, stayed just by main lobby 2nd floor. Friendly staff, helpful. Room was clean and well maintained. Booked a double bed room, got a king size instead when we got there. Very close to fishermans warf, block and a half. easy walk. buses nearby can get easily to anywhere you need to go.
review.positiveRemarks: clean, friendly staff and well maintained
review.locationRemarks: Close to fishermans warf and other attractions

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location was great. One bus takes you downtown to great shopping and restaurants. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was okay, the halls smell dusty but the room was clean except we noticed mold growing on the ceiling in the bathroom and in our room on the outside wall between the ceiling and wall. We also felt the price for food was quite high.
review.positiveRemarks: The location. Also the staff of the hotel were very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Remove the mold from the rooms. It is very dangerous for some people's health. Also better air flow in the hall's.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Walking distance to little Italy which have great restaurants and wine! Lots of great restaurants and shopping at the Wharf.

review.title: Central but pricey for what you get.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to Fisherman's Wharf and as such is convenient to most of the tourist attractions. Check in was fast and easy, but we then had to walk to a block across the street with all our luggage to our rooms. The hotel is fine but not flash. The rooms were OK, bathroom was a little dated. At several hotels we visited, including this one, the cleaners had trouble replacing the number of towels taken (4) with the right number which was slightly annoying. It is a great place though to base yourself if you want to be in the thick of waterfront San Fran for a few days.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge was aloof and not very helpful - unlike the bell desk fellow who was... The Denny's for breakfast was expensive and service poor
review.locationRemarks: close to all attractions

review.title: perfect in every way
review.reviewText: great location---we were there with our daughter and 2 children 13 years and 10 months--all went great
review.positiveRemarks: the total experience was just what we were looking for
review.locationRemarks: pier 39---the tour buses with on and off locations

review.title: close to bay
review.reviewText: Although it was nice to be within walking distance to everything we wanted to see, the hotel was a bit to be desired. Our room faced an alley that had been tagged and it was unappealing. The cleanliness could have been much better, but the beds were very comfortable. The staff were top notch and extremely helpful and kind. I would spend a bit more money next time and stay in a nicer hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: That it was close to the bay area and we could walk everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness inside and out
review.locationRemarks: The location was awesome and it was close to so much in the bay area i.e; fishermans wharf, Ghirardelli, the piers etc .

review.title: Good tourist location
review.reviewText: Fairly basic and great location, but we were located in the extension which was a bit inconvenient when first booking in. The tea and coffee machine was a joke and they should consider a simple kettle as a more convenient option.
review.negativeRemarks: See hot drinks making above
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the main tourist area where you can access all main tours and transport options.

review.title: Be careful when checking into this facility.
review.reviewText: We went to check in and they tried to put us into another property that was a few blocks away. They offered to help with our luggage. Are you kidding? I specifically chose this property for it's location and amenities and the "other" location was a Holiday Inn Express.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk clerk - Geoffrey.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf was a great place to be. Plus, there was a wonderful breakfast place across the street - Joanie's Happy Days diner.

review.title: Trip with the folks!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Holiday Inn because of it's location and proximity to the Wharf and it worked out pretty well. I had a conference to go to but my parents got to enjoy all of San Francisco's beauty. There was transportation nearby that literally stopped across the street from the hotel. The hotel also had several parking garages. There where plenty of restaurants nearby to walk to and the mornings were especially nice and peaceful on the Wharf. I would definitely stay here again and if you are traveling with elderly family members this is a perfect location.
review.negativeRemarks: The windows seemed dated.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to the Wharf, restaurants, Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The location was great. The hotel looked great and up to date. I loved the extra side mirror in the bathroom. The hotel was clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location of this hotel. The staff was very helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is right there.

review.title: Nice Hotel in a great area to discover San Fran
review.reviewText: Was very pleasant to stay there for 7 nights. Quiet and comfortable rooms. Handy to everything including bus transport. Great restaurants in the area especially in Columbus Street.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could do with a lick of paint
review.locationRemarks: Everything is handy, Fisherman's wharf, San Francisco Downtown is only 35 minute walk or 15 minutes on the bus

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel for the second time with our 18 month old toddler. A double queen room was great, because our daughter can sleep in a big bed. However, staff emphasized that they were more than happy to wheel in a cot for her. Spacious room, bathroom appeared new-ish, everything very clean. Rooms are literally soundproof, as the screaming of our child could not be heard in the corridor or the room next door, as the guests there reassured us. Great to have laundry facilities on the same floor when travelling with a child.
We knew about the hotel being split in two locations, as we already stayed in the other part across the street from the main building the last time around. We didn't mind the walk over there with our luggage. The location is amazing, Fisherman's Wharf only a few minutes walk away. We were there to watch the America's Cup races and were able to walk to the AC village as well as park, which was great considering the daily traffic jams.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious and clean rooms, quiet, yet fantastic location literally only steps from Fisherman's wharf. Friendly staff.

review.title: Very close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Was a nice pleasant stay with decent sized rooms, only issues were that the newer building is a bit of a walk with your luggage and we didn't get any help plus the parking was confusing and not cheap.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor could do with modernising but still very clean
review.locationRemarks: Location is right near the wharf if thats where you want to stay and its very easy to get around in a car, I wouldn't advise to walk to Union Square

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: My husband and I came to San Francisco for our anniversary. We wanted to stay near the wharf, so we booked at the Holiday Inn. The staff is very courteous and pleasant to work with. The room was very clean and comfortable. They had to replace the locks on the door while we were in our room, and they gave us a coupon for a free movie for our inconvenience, even though they were in and out in 5 minutes. I had been to the area before, and we had stayed in the same hotel. Our experience was so memorable that I chose to stay in the same place again. Within walking distance to everything you'd like to do on the wharf. I'll definitely be a repeat customer!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, knowledgeable staff. They helped us when booking a town car, and a shuttle back to the air port. Clean, comfortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing......keep up the great work!!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the wharf. Close to many restaurants, Pier 39, cable cars, and shopping.

review.title: Great place to stay when visiting the Bay!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, near the Fisherman Wharf! Hotel staff is what really made our visit more pleasant. They were very helpful providing directions in places we wanted to visit but most of all making us feel secure during our stay. I had misplaced some very important documents in my room and Joy; one of the hotel staff, assured me that they will do their best to help me located them. She immediately contacted the hotel security manager when I contact her with my concerns and assured me that they will do their best to help me locate them. The next day, I found the documents in another place within my room. I immediately apologize to Joy for the inconvenience and thank her for the words of comfort when I approached her. The feeling of staying in hotel that goes out of their way to make you feel safe when you are away from home is something I will never forget. I travel a lot for business and pleasure and yet this is the first time that I have encountered such a great experience. I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting the Bay area!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, caring staff and great location!

review.title: Great location for touring San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great central location to see San Francisco Bay. Good places to eat. Within walking distance of attractions. Good access to hop-on-hop-off trolley tours.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, other popular destinations & food.

review.title: Disappointing!
review.reviewText: Overpriced and not comfortable, bathroom had strange arrangement, it was for a handicap person and I am not sure that they would find it handy either. It was not convient to the room and charging a high rate to park, then have to walk a block pulling your luggage to the hotel, my first time ever of having to walk down a street to get to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel entrance connected to check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 and shopping.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and decor was appealing. Located in the heart of the wharf, discount coupons and directions were available from the staff. Extra safety precaution of required key for entrance to elevator.

review.title: Excellent location in Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText: Stayed in the annex building, clean and tidy with friendly accomodating staff and excellent location. Have stayed in many Holiday Inns in different countries and this is typical good standard. The only negative I can think of was the price which seemed very high but I expect its the location that sets the price point. All in would stay again if needed to be in the FW area.

review.title: Nice hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: My daughters and I enjoyed this hotel and its location.
review.locationRemarks: I loved the location. It was located right in Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to many attractions.

review.title: Great location, nice hotel.
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf and we were very pleased with it's excellent location. We were minutes from the wharf attractions, the cable car terminal, and Ghirardelli square. The hotel itself was very pleasant with a beautiful lobby and very nice dining area. My only complaint is that the offer I booked through Expedia included a full breakfast. I had indicated that I was travelling with four people so I assumed that the offer would include breakfasts for 4 people. When I arrived, I was told that I could only get 2 free breakfasts per day, which was never stated on the Expedia offer. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is very expensive, so I would have had to spend much more money on breakfast than I would ever want to spend. After pointing this issue out to the hotel management, they finally agreed to give us all vouchers for breakfast and resolve the issue through Expedia. I would highly recommend this hotel, but I would be cautious about the wording of any hotel offers.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: easy walk to major attractions yet it's two blocks away from the noisy Pier 39. Hotel is clean and staff is nice. 15 min walk to Chinatown and Little Italy. Good for family with small kids.

review.title: Great location, pet friendly, but no pet area
review.reviewText: This hotel has great location and clean. Love the walking distance to wharf and Ghiradelli Square. It is pet friendly but there is no grass (not even a small pet area) in the hotel. And so we have to go out at midnight across the park. The parking is excessive and the hotel does not pro-rate. We arrived at midnight and they still charged us full rate from 6pm to 6am. They were not willing to pro-rate.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to fisherman's wharf and other retails.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a pet area a small grass section for pets. The parking is excessive. The hotel should allow pro-ration.

review.title: Close to Wharf great.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel close to ev'thing. Will come again.
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerator in room.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do.great location

review.title: Holiday in SFO
review.reviewText: Don't be surprised, hotel self parking is about $45/day, in & out. Other parking in the vicinity is $8/hr and street parking is very hard to come by.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is conveniently located near Pier 39
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located near Pier39 where you can hop in for a bay cruise or trip to Alcatraz.Walking distance to Italian restaurants & Chinatown

review.title: Family Vacation
review.reviewText:
The hotel was excellent for our 4 day 3 night stay in San Fran. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms we clean, quite and comfortable. The location of the hotel was 1 block away from the wharf and other sights/shopping. It was a perfect location!

I would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: dinner menu.
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from the wharf. Close to public transportation and excellent restaurants.

review.title: Great location for sites in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Many sites within walking distance and easy access to public transportaion and interstates. A little noisy from street partiers at wee hours of the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf,Ghiradelli building, catch cable cars to Ferry Building.

review.title: Excellent location in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very good location, short walk to Anchorage center where we can take the hop on hop off bus to explore the city and close to Pier 39 . Staff is friendly and courteous. Room is clean but bathroom is small. Breakfast if included is only for 2 adults per room. For convenience, we would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Anchorage center. Pier 39 - 43 1/2. Ghirardelli square

review.title: Comfortable, Clean, In the Heart of It All
review.reviewText: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf. Very easy walking distance to cable cars, Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39, many restaurants and shops. I was there with two young kids and my wife, we all felt comfortable, safe, relaxed in this hotel. The hotel is divided into two separate buildings and we were in the one across the street from the main lobby and pool, but it didn't bother us. There is a Denny's right inside the building we were in, made breakfasts very convenient. We had a little difficulty with the nighttime staff on the first night-- I called and asked for a roll-away bed and it took nearly 3 hours for them to deliver it to the room, so my 10-year-old stayed up til midnight waiting for his bed. I had to call multiple times and no one could give me an update on when the bed would be arriving. I was pretty sure after that that I would be writing a bad review. But then over the next few days the rest of the staff was great, the place was clean, quiet, comfortable and we had a wonderful time there. So I decided the problem the first night was an anomaly. We would absolutely stay in this hotel again.

review.title: nice hotel close to the beach
review.reviewText: it was a great hotel friendly service the parking was not the greats but it had to do

review.title: Hotel was okay, restaurant staff not
review.reviewText: Hotel was okay, only double beds, average room with small washrooms but at least clean. Families with children will enjoy the pool, fitness center is very small though and there's no whirlpool or hot tub. Not much bang for you buck. We've stayed at far more superior hotels at more reasonable rates. We purchased our room with breakfast included but was sadly mistaken when we arrived as we received only 2 buffet vouchers/day/adult & children were only free if they ordered from the limited kids menu a choice of 4 items of pancakes & bacon, cereal with a banana, yogurt & fruit or oatmeal. The 2 out of 3 days we were there we ordered the buffet for our kids (10 & 13 yrs) for an additional cost so they could get a better variety of food. We were there with another family of 4 & when asked to sit separately they accused us of not wanting to pay a tip. We always paid a tip even though the servers only brought coffee, removed plates & one time brought our kids hot chocolate the day we ordered the buffet for them. Funny as the breakfast voucher had "gratuity included" printed at the bottom. Hotel staff at front desk were very friendly and helpful but restauant staff not so good. Be prepared as this area of San Fran is expensive & parking is at a premium. Wharf hotel parking will start you at $40 plus tax/day. You might be able to find parking on the street but be mindful of meters, curb colors & parking times/signs.
review.positiveRemarks: Conveniently located near Fisherman's Wharf and family who live in San Francisco/Oakland Area.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant staff attitudes, not very family friendly
review.locationRemarks: Exploratorium, Alcatraz tour, shopping, cruises/power boat rides, cable cars, Chinatown, hop on/off bus tours Get City Pass includes alot

review.title: Nice close to the Fisherman Wharf
review.reviewText: Good very comfortable close to more interesting areas of town

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: last minute booking of this hotel and wish i would have stayed there the entire trip. great location down by the bay.

review.title: Not good hotel & Not happy...
review.reviewText: Not good hotel...I've been itching when we were sleeping. Same with my family. Bath tub shower smells super bad. I hated it :(
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything except China Town &
review.negativeRemarks: They need to remodel bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Close by to Fisherman Wharft etc.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We were very please with this hotel. It was very comfortable and quiet. We were within walking distance of so many places we wanted to see while in the city. The complementary breakfast was a full buffet and the food was delicious.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and comfort of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Ghiradelli Chocolate Factory, the Hyde Street Canble Car and Fisherman's Wharf were all close by

review.title: Nice hotel in the city center
review.reviewText: Close to many scenery points, just the price expensive, and parking will charge $40

review.title: Disappointing hotel in a disappointing area.
review.reviewText: The first room we were given looked directly at a concrete wall five feet away. The room was dark, depressing and the furniture was very beat up. We asked to move and were politely accommodated but the second room, although brighter with a better view, was still pretty run down. This was by far the most expensive room we booked on our driving holiday and by far the most disappointing. We have stayed at various Holiday Inns, none of which have been this bad. It doesn't help that Fisherman's Wharf seems just as run down.......
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is in desperate need of a renovation.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotel has an excellent location where you don't need to worry about driving around the find parking. You just leave your car in the hotel's parking and walk to Pier 39 and all around it. The staff is professional and the rooms, lobby, and rest of the facility is clean and modern.

review.title: good hotel near the wharf
review.reviewText: its a good hotel.room is comparable to holiday inn express.the only thing is that i was hoping there was at least an inclusive breakfast(buffet).just like the express.

review.title: noisy!!--rooms facing the street--
review.reviewText: very noisy--garbage and delivery way too early--530am---rooms need to be more soundproof--sounds like they are right in your room----paying $200 a night--and no free anything!!!no complimentery coffee or anything else --how cheap!!!leaves a bad taste in your mouth---overwise ok--rooms clean --staff curtious
review.negativeRemarks: how about stop being so CHEAP--continental breakfast should be included---restaurant with overpriced everything
review.locationRemarks: great location--close to everything at Fishermans Wharf--San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel within walking distance to everything !
review.reviewText: We stayed here for two nights in August . Rooms were clean and comfortable. Beds a little hard. But overall very nice staff and a great stay.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText:
Our number one priority was a 3+ star hotel within easy walking distance of the waterfront, which this hotel fulfilled.

The staff we met were friendly and had many suggestions to take advantage of our location. We would have never found the small Hollywood Cafe and its excellent food without a staff suggestion.
review.positiveRemarks: Best thing about this hotel is the location, followed by the staff and facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: The bay front was a two block walk and Pier 39 was six blocks up from there. Public transportation was nearby as we had planned trips to Oakland (Mun

review.title: Nice Hotel in walking distance from the Wharf.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location from the Wharf and the surrounding attractions. There is an additional $40 parking fee that I did not know about but it is for 24 hours so you can stay parked at the hotel after you check out. It is a nice place and the rooms were somewhat comfortable. I found hair on the bathroom floor that was not properly cleaned when we arrived. The staff was very friendly. Overall, I found it overpriced. I've stayed in the area before and had better experiences for the cost. But, don't get me wrong I'm not saying it was a bad hotel, I would stay there again if the price was right.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and in walking distance to good restaurants, wax museum, Ripley's and Pier 39.
review.negativeRemarks: A/C system is very loud and woke us up each time it kick on.
review.locationRemarks: There is a wide variety of bay cruises, Ghirardelli Square (yum if you like chocolate) walking attractions, the aquarium and of course Alcatraz.

review.title: Nice location and staff, but cleanliness issues
review.reviewText: The staff and rooms were nice enough. The halls and dining room were not fresh.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty. Carpet and curtains not fresh. Everything is sticky in the dining room. Tables are badly worn and pealing, but food is good.
review.locationRemarks: Many tourist attractions near by.

review.title: Horrible wi fi. Don't expect to stream anything
review.reviewText: This hotel advertises that it has wifi. It has he worst wifi connection and network ever. This is the same with all holiday inns I've stayed at. If you are expecting to video conference or download any large file, forget it. Business travelers expect more than the ability to check email. I complained to the desk manager who said he would get back to me and he never did. The contract tech support even said there was a problem. Still no response. Don't stay here. You will also experience black mold on the popcorn ceilings. This place hasn't been redone since the 1990's.
review.positiveRemarks: The bell stand staff was great
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi connection, responsiveness of management, cleaning up mold, remodeling rooms

review.title: Nice, Clean Hotel - Excellent location
review.reviewText: Everything was very clean & nice. Comfortable beds.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent downtown SF location - no need for a car. Can walk to multiple attractions and use MUNI (mass transit) for all others.

review.title: 3rd leg of vacation
review.reviewText: great location, close to everything I wanted to do. Staff was all very friendly and helpful and hotel was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: add smoking rooms
review.locationRemarks: near all tours and all of fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great location, staff and services.
review.reviewText: Our family loved staying here! the only downside is that we were in the second building and the kids had to walk outside and across the street to use the swimming pool.

review.title: TOO EXPENSIVE
review.reviewText:
Location was pretty good, but almost $300 for an old Holiday Inn was not worth it, plus $45 a day for parking!!
We were not impressed!
review.negativeRemarks: Price of room and parking

review.title: Close to almost everything.
review.reviewText: Good location, expensive but it's what you pay for during the summer in San Francisco. There's parking so if you're driving this helps a lot. It has a small pool, but it has a pool- so that was cool. Good, nice staff. Small bar inside is ok; you can have good priced drinks during happy hour :) Beds are ok...again; you pay a lot during the summer in this area. Overall ; I would recommend this Hotel.

review.title: great location, nice staff
review.reviewText: very happy with our stay. Great location for what we wanted to do. Staff was very helpful to whatever we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: there was a lot of loud metal banging sounds above our room. not sure if we were below a storage or laundry facility. very loud room surroundings
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, giardellis square, lots of shopping and sight seeing

review.title: Located near the wharf. It was in the heart!
review.reviewText: The experience was wonderful. We will most definitely book this hotel again. The room had a great view of Alcatraz and the Bay. The location was excellent and the room was very clean. It is also a location to walk to events and book travel excursions for pick up.

review.title: Family hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, easy access to all the sights, transport and restaurants. Safe, clean and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Food only available at set times in dining area, would of been nice to be able to get a snack at any time (we were on different time zone)
review.locationRemarks: Great location, easy to get places on foot

review.title: Good Solid hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for one night with relatives from out of town. We had three separate rooms and all were clean and well appointed when we arrived. This is not a fancy place but rather a good solid choice for families with kids and folks who aren't spending a lot of time in their room. The location is perfect and the wifi is free. Parking is steep but it is all over the city.
I would stay here again.

review.title: Glad we didn't spend much time in the room!
review.reviewText:
Happy about the location, but...
surprised we weren't staying in the main building, no parking at the our building, had to drive back to main building and then walk back to our building (no valet).
Asked concierge for dinner suggestion- something with local flavor- he recommended RainForest Caf- we can eat there at the mall at home! Finally got him to suggest a few places in North Beach.
A lot of peeling wallpaper in bathroom

review.title: Great location for access to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at this Holiday Inn on Fisherman's Wharf for 6 nights. It is a very desirable location as you can walk to just about anywhere for dinner, shopping or sightseeing or even catch a ride on the famous cable cars. The king bed we had was so very comfortable. The linens and pillows were soft and luxurious. It seemed like the hotel had just replaced all of the linens as the towels, washcloths, etc were brand new. Also, the elevators were super fast. We were on the 5th floor and never waited more than 3-4 seconds before one of the 3 elevators opened.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the idea that the hotel has an outside heated swimming pool which we used and enjoyed.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to "the crookedest" street (Lombard) which is only 4 blocks from the hotel. Ghirardelli Square is about 3 blocks away.

review.title: dissapointing
review.reviewText: air conditioning is old and very loud bed wasn't comfortable my room didn't have a do not distrube sign so maids knock on the door twice every morning which was very annoying. I wanted a top floor room with a ocean view didn't get that either

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location! Very close to many points of interest. Room needed some TLC. Wall covering was peeling in places. Not what I would expect for $300/night. No refrigerator in room. Wireless connection in room was terrible. Very slow connection. Almost useless.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless speed

review.title: San Fran stopover
review.reviewText: this hotel is very central to lots of activities in San Francisco. Generous, clean, comfortable rooms. Enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Second time around.
review.reviewText: Staff is friendly. The hotel is very clean and staff at front desk very helpful. Used the services of the concierge, he was helpful. Great bartender.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, very close to Fisherman's Wharf. Bus and trolley close by. Close enough to walk down town, China Town.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and accommodating. It is in the heart of San Francisco's warf area and within walking distance of everything the area has to offer.

review.title: Family fun trip
review.reviewText: We found the location great. Close to fisherman a wharf and pier 39. The cable car is just around the corner and easy to get on. I found the hotel staff to be very helpful.

review.title: Conveniently located close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located close to Fisherman's Wharf. We were able to walk down to the wharf, beach and all the shops and restaurants. We forgot out toothpaste, but placed a call to the front desk and received a courtesy tube in less than 10 minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel to our family and friends.
review.positiveRemarks: On site parking until 6:00 PM the day of check out was a big plus.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, shopping, beach, restaurants, Alcatraz Island, Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39

review.title: Stay 7/4/13
review.reviewText: Hotel was old, dated, small and loud. No fee breakfast as per usual with Holiday Inn. Disapointing for $250 per night.

review.title: safe and close to the action
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed at the Holiday Inn recently had had a great time. We booked it because it was close to Fisherman's Wharf and because it had a pool. Since the pool is outside and its San Francisco (cold), we never considered using it. Lots of extras at the hotel and definitely a do over if we go back to the city. There is a Dennys in the lobby for a cheap breakfast.

review.title: Parking and pool:(
review.reviewText: Disappointing to learn I had to walk a block to get to pool and parking.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Terrific location near Fisherman's Wharf. Room a bit dated but clean and fairly spacious. In house restaurant was shamefully overpriced. Walk around the corner to the Denny's for similar fare at half the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need updating

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We stayed here the 4th of July. It was convenient to walk to our destinations. We could park the car and not have to worry with traffic. Room was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the trolley turn-around.

review.title: Good location in fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Good location, can walk to resturants , sights, close to cable cars, bus line. Didn't need a rental car.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText:
The main Holiday Inn complex is situated on Columbus Ave which has all the facilities like swimming pool, gym, free wi-fi etc.
The room we were allocated originally was in the second part of the Holiday Inn only a short distance away and was in the quieter part of the hotel complex.
Our flight had arrived early and was told our allocated room wasn't yet ready, however we were offered a room at the main complex if we prefered or wait until the other room was ready.
The staff by the way were fantastic, very friendly and helpful..
The room unfortunately had no view as such and would have been a great dissapointment if we had stayed there for the duration of the holiday so we opted for the quieter part and we didn't have time to wait because as soon as we had checked in our room was now ready brilliant and worth the wait.
The hotel complex is a little dated but the staff are brilliant, housekeeping great no problem if you had a late night, very understanding thanks...
Only slight let downs were, tea and coffee facilities in the room poor, we like strong coffee in the morning but the coffee sachets were just producing very weak coffee.
The internet was free to use, first day though all the computers had problems but that was quickly resolved.
The hotel has an in house restaurant called Denneys, but we found a great little place for breakfast especially if you like traditional american like eggs benedict, waffles, pancakes look out for Joannies Place on Columbus Avenue just brill..
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, Cable Cars, F-Car (old tram style) all very near..
review.negativeRemarks: Soft Drink machine faulty and ATM's sometimes runs out of money
review.locationRemarks: Ideal, everything within walking distance

review.title: Great location by wharf but pay for parking?
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine. My only complaint is that we had to pay $45 for parking and we were hotel guests! I can see charging visitors, but not paying guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide parking free to guests!

review.title: Comfortable, close to the Bay Area , accessible
review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 days comfortably but the parking is so expensive, it's ok coz its san francisco but they should include it on the hotel prized so as not to surprised their guests or patrons.
review.negativeRemarks: Some front clerk not so pleasant
review.locationRemarks: Accessible with everything, cruising, walking,sightseeing, shopping,Etc

review.title: great hotel, perfect location for walking
review.reviewText: stayed there for 8 nights recently. staff was friendly & helpful. will definitely recommend & stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: close to pier 39, ghirardelli square, public transportation right outside

review.title: San Francisco break
review.reviewText: Good position for Fishermans Wharf.Friendly and helpful staff.We stayed in the recently built annexe,so everything was in pristine condition.Pier 39 within 5 minutes walk from hotel.Overall very good.
review.negativeRemarks: no criticisms.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Nice Hote. Within Walking Distance To Restaurants
review.reviewText: 1St Time To San Francisco And The Overall Experience Was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel Was Clean And Personnel Was Friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Close To The Piers, Restaurants, Shopping And Tours.

review.title: Friendly service and great location
review.reviewText: Everyone was so nice here! I am a southern girl and wasn't expecting such warm hospitality from people in a big city. My son got really sick upon arrival and the staff at the hotel connected me right away with a doctor. I also ate one of the best BBQ cheeseburgers I have ever had from room service at your hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, food, very helpful and friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, little Italy, aquarium

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText:
Comfortable beds, clean, and friendly staff! The location was unbeatable. F Line, which services the Fisherman's Wharf area, Pier 39, Alcatraz boarding, etc., was a 2 minute walk from the
Holliday Inn annex building we were in. However, we found most of the tourist areas to be within walking distance from the hotel.

review.title: San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: Hotel in great location. Staff friendly and helpful. Easy access to public transport, restaurants, shops.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, spacious rooms which are spotlessly clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: No bar fridge although one could be hired.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for Fisherman's Wharf area and good access to public transport for other areas.

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: If you stay in the annex at Jones st, you will have to move up to main building with entrance at 1300 Columbus Ave to use the pool and exercices room also to take the breakfast . It was very bad for us.
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: Close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Very pleasant and courteous staff. Hotel and rooms very clean and the hotel location is close to the Wharf. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: My experience at the hotel was so awesome. One most thing I like is all I can be convenient to get breakfast at Denny's restaurant in this hotel.

review.title: Great locaton
review.reviewText: This is in a great location. I would stay here again without question. Very safe.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to everything.

review.title: Grandkids vacation
review.reviewText: Maid understood what I told her about sheets and towels
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee is very weak in the hotel room. It is almost clear! I had to use two bags for one cup of coffee.

review.title: Great location and friendly hotel
review.reviewText: Great stay. Fabulous location. Convenient for all attractions. We had adjoining rooms which was great as we could wander in and out of each others rooms. Pete the taxi driver to the airport attached to the hotel was fab.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Convent for all attractions. Close to shops and shoreline

review.title: Conveniently located to major items to see
review.reviewText:
Very frustrating-took 3-4 tries to get key that would open the room. Every guest was having the same challenge; staff were aware, yet nothing was done to prevent inconvenience to guests.
Housekeeping staff needs to be asked to be aware of boundaries with children. Our 2 1/2 year old Grandaughter was put into an awkward situation; the housekeeper imposed hugging.and embracing our Grandaughter. No harm-No foul; BUT with another child it may have had a different outcome. The hug was initiated by staff, not by child.
review.negativeRemarks: It was higher priced taking advantage of their location.

review.title: holiday stay at SF fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText:
Over all stay its OK. Everything is near : Transportation, eating and sight seeing. The bathtub does not empty fast enough.
no refrigerator in the room.

review.title: Our experience
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful. Thought we were booked for columbus street but then had to drive around to Beach St...bit stressful at the time but all OK in the end.
review.negativeRemarks: Price.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Great location, we could walk everywhere
review.reviewText: We spent the first night of our vacation at another hotel and moved here on day 2 and we were very pleased.

review.title: Excellent hotel, perfect location for the beach
review.reviewText: The front desk reps were great, they accomodated my family and I even though I showed up at 11am. They also recommended some quality restaurants which impressed me. The rooms were also super clean, it felt like home.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable, clean, and close proximity to the Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Parking: $45 and if you find parking don't move your car
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, across the street from Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel with my family several times now and we have always had a great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location near wharf with easy access to street cars, cable cars, and buses to get anywhere in the city. Concierge service is always a great help
review.locationRemarks: Great location near the wharf, restaurants, bay cruises, Pier 39 and more.

review.title: Excellent Value-Don't Pay More Elsewhere
review.reviewText: My husband and I go to San Francisco several times a year. We have stayed in many different hotels and have found this Holiday Inn to be the best value near the wharf. This location cannot be beat and we have paid much more for hotel rooms that were not nearly as comfortable or well kept. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near the wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: It is comfortable and very clean. The location is excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: My only complaint is not something the hotel could control. There is quite a bit of "street noise" on weekend nights.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, F-Line stops, etc., are all close by

review.title: Great location for sightseeing/ shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location on Fishermans Wharf so you are able to walk to most of the things you want to see like pier 39, Alcatraz ferries, restaurants and shops. You are even close to the cable car that will,take you to Nob Hill and Union Sq for shopping and more sights. It's split over two buildings and we had a room in the other building so didn't use the restaurant or other facilities. Overall a nice hotel with friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy beds
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything

review.title: Nice place to stay at the Wharf---
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn. Their breakfast buffet was excellent and the service the best. We would stay again!
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located--

review.title: "Super service"
review.reviewText: Super close & easy to get ont the cruise lines. In the center of the heart of SF

review.title: Great hotel, great location, very clean
review.reviewText: The hotel was situated right in the middle of many of the great locations in San Francisco. The room was very clean and comfortable- the cleaning lady was so nice each day and faithful to ask if there was anything we needed. The restaurant on the first floor was convenient on days we needed to have a quick breakfast. Overall, it made our vacation in San Francisco very pleasant. I have no complaints, and would not hesitate staying there again on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Room with a View
review.reviewText: This was our first time to San Francisco and we picked this hotel because of the location. We picked the perfect hotel. When we checked I asked if there was room with a view of the Bay, we were given the best room. The hotel was close to everything and had easy access to transportation if you didn't feel like walking. The staff was very helpful with any questions you had.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to a lot of shopping and restaurants plus attractions
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet a little dated
review.locationRemarks: Great location...Shopping, restaurants within walking distance. Pier 39 just 7 to 10 minute walk from hotel.

review.title: Awesome location to everything LOVED IT! A++ staff
review.reviewText: We stayed for just one night on a quick trip & chose to stay here & I am so glad we did after touring the city &seeing some other options we were considering for hotels to stay at & the neighbohrhoods they were located in I am soooo glad we picked this one! It is very close to Fisherman's Wharf, the Piers, the Fort, eating venues & shops are all a short walk & if walking isn't your thing, the MUNI, SAM or Sightseeing Tour trolleys all have stops really close too!! Room was clean and comfy too :) Theylet us check in when we arrived early at 10 am & held our bags after check as we were not flying out until later. They had a restaurant & little coffee/muffin shop but we did not eat at either but we did eat however TWICE in our short 24 hr visit at a little diner just off to the right on a side street, good prices (compared to eating at Pier restaurants) EXCELLENT food and service, Joanie's Happy Days Diner, they are only open for breakfast & lunch &close at 3 but serve both breakfast and lunch the whole time! The place next door to this diner too looked jsut as good and quaint as Joanies so may want to try that one too :) The pool was not open when we were there, was small outdoor pool but looked alright they have a small fitness room too that did it's job :) The staff was awesome and very helpful. Teh hotel had town cars/SUV/limo services to/from the airport that were just a little cheaper than taking a cab and if we would ever come back with kids would totally use that option!
review.positiveRemarks:
Location, Location, Location
Staff & room quality
Price compared to other hotels in Wharf area
Felt safe
Early enterance to room adn baggage holding
review.negativeRemarks:
We had to come home ;)
Price was good but wish it had breakfast or airport shuttle add on option or airport shuttle period
Pool was closed
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!!! Close to the Wharf, Piers etc and several eating venues and tourist shops to buy stuff to take home! Felt safe even in the evening!

review.title: 1st time road trip experience
review.reviewText: the hotel was excellent and walking distance to most places like Lombard st, pier 39 and famous sour dough clam chowder place. We love the lady at the counter name Mary she was wonderful. We will definitely come and stay here again.

review.title: Fine in a pinch
review.reviewText: The first room they gave me smelled of mold. The second one didn't and they were very professional about it. But the shower ceiling was black with grime near the vent. The tub/shower is the cheapest kind of one piece fiberglass. Free wifi is wonderful. Windows let the the road noise in.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty shower ceiling

review.title: Weekend Get Away
review.reviewText: Nice hotel centrally located close to Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach. Hotel is well-maintained both inside and out.
review.positiveRemarks: Very pleasant and helpful hotel staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower/tub combo did not drain well at all. Smoking should not be allowed so close to hotel entry/exit.
review.locationRemarks: The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to be close to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nice, but pricey parking
review.reviewText: Nice close vicinity to Fisherman's Wharf and other local attractions. The only bummer is the high price of parking at $40 per day. We didn't drive at all because everything was close by. You can catch the open-top bus only a block away to tour the entire SF area. Lots of restaurants, etc., also close by. Also not too crazy that the hotel consists of two buildings, so we had to park our car and then walk about a block with our luggage to our room. They have a 24 hour Denny's, but would have preferred a better restaurant. You can find Denny's anywhere.

review.title: Nice stay without out a doubt
review.reviewText: Great place , friendly staff great location. I will come back again for sure , good spot for the Americas cup , coming up this year.

review.title: Great location for family
review.reviewText: The location is great! It is a block from Fisherman's Wharf and a great location if you have children. My only issue was the noise. Our window faced Beach St where the cable cars passed through and they are very loud. The cable cars run 6a-1a, leaving very little time for quietness.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from cable cars
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf and near fun things for kids

review.title: This hotel was very clean and relaxing.
review.reviewText: When we first arrived at the Holiday Inn the transmission went out on our vehicle. The hotel was very accommodating on where we could place our car so that we could continue with our holiday but still leave our vehicle within easy access for the tow-truck the following day. They made our stay very enjoyable. They also serve an excellent breakfast with a wide variety of choices that we enjoyed very much. Highly recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: It was within walking distance of all shops and Fishermans Wharf; also there were buses and the Trolly close by.

review.title: Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: It was an extremely pleasant experience. We were located right at the heart of Fisherman's and near public transportation that took us to and from downtown. The room was always clean and the staff was very friendly and approachable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those who are looking for a great nights sleep and great service.
review.positiveRemarks: The nearness to public transportation, food, and the Wharf!
review.locationRemarks: Being right at the heart of the Wharf, allows for a variety if activities and sightseeing. Pier 39 is only a few blocks away!!

review.title: Amazing bargain
review.reviewText: Amazing Location. Amazing quality for the price. Amazing service. Highly recommended.
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf is only 2 blocks away! Also 15-20 minute walk away from china town.

review.title: Excellent hotel in an amazing location
review.reviewText: My childhood friend and I met up for a quick vacation in San Francisco. The hotel was in a great location and was wonderful - clean, comfortable, and the hotel staff were so accommodating and helpful! I arrived before the check-in time and they were able to give me a room prior to the 3 pm check-in time without any problems. And the staff was very helpful with recommending activities and contacting transportation for us to return to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is fantastic - it is within easy walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and on many of the bus lines for ease in getting around town.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Pier 33 - Alcatraz, easy access to Hop-On/Hop-Off buses, shopping, and many great restaurants.

review.title: Great Hotel down at Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Our hotel was in a central location down in Fisherman's Wharf. Trolley and bus station across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Small refrigerator in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Great breakfast shop across the street if you want an alternative to Denny's in the hotel. Excellent breakfast sandwiches!!!

review.title: Outstanding Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel accommodations and staff were outstanding. My husband had a bad fall while we walking on the wharf and the staff was very helpful to us. We needed to stay in our room past our checkout time and we were given the extra time even though the hotel was fully booked. We will stay here again and would recommend the hotel for others who are vacationing in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, very clean, close to transportation.
review.locationRemarks: Short walking distance to the wharf and very close to Muni, street car and cable car routes.

review.title: good location, customer service needs improvement
review.reviewText: The upkeep was good but we had to walk to the beach location with all our luggage. They sent someone to help pull the luggage cart and he waited outside the room until we felt obligated to tip him. The staff at the desk was cold, not welcoming until we checked out & then a very pleasant man did checkout. An older man with beard but didn't catch his name. Location is good and is the only reason we reeturn.
review.negativeRemarks: Coolness of the hotel staff

review.title: not worth it
review.reviewText:
45$ for parking per a night?
unbelievable!!!
after charging 330 per a night i think that was unfair !

review.title: Good family hotel
review.reviewText: No fridge, and no parking, otherwise great location and good hotel

review.title: Reasonably Priced Hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Spent 3 nights in San Francisco, only one night at this hotel but we should have stayed here the whole time. Reasonably priced, very near Fisherman's Wharf and parking is much cheaper ($40/night vs. $60/night at other hotels hotels downtown). Rooms were clean, and met our expectations despite getting 2 double beds instead of a King bed which we requested but since it was one night this was not a big deal. There was a Denny's downstairs which was convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Laundry facilities; close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive for guests staying at the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, Alcatraz

review.title: now what it seems
review.reviewText: I was excited about this trip, despite pricing which seemed WAY out of range for the emmenities. I really felt as if me and my party were pushed aside to an overflow are of the hotel, then i was told that it was actually quieter and had more to offer as far as convenience, like being closer to starbucks, etc. Well in the main hotel, they have a restaurante, quieter, but yes smaller rooms, more access to parking where as the overflow building had none??? I mean over all i enjoyed the town, but none of my enjoyment was brought on by the hotel, considering they did not live up to their own standards or espectations. I think that the best part of the hotel stay was the elevator ride!!! Dont let them tell you that they are sold out and running at a 100% occupancy at all times either - total lie!!!
review.negativeRemarks: accomodations
review.locationRemarks: fischermans wharf is pretty awesome, though next time i would like to stay closer to union square.

review.title: Location is good.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a good location, near everything or good transportation.
Our only complaint is that they do not tell you until you register that your room is in the annex.
Across the street and around the corner. Not terrible, but unexpected.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great, on the Wharf, near transportation.
review.locationRemarks: Located only 2 blocks from the Wharf. Near transportation, a short walk, not too many hills, to Ghiaradeli Sq and the cable car turnaround

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: good location, right by Pier 39. Disappointed in the room..we booked 4 months in advance- we got a handicap room, no shelves to put toiletries and cosmetics on.( We are not handicapped) A mini-fridge would have been nice. The alarm clock didn't work :( But like I said it was in a good location.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText:
Great place to stay. Close to Fishermans Wharf
Nice clean rooms

Only bad thing is parking hotel wants to charge $45 a night
When across the road you can get it for $35,

Dennys 24hrs downstairs was handy

would stay again
review.negativeRemarks: Parking prices
review.locationRemarks: GREAT location.

review.title: Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Overall the stay was pleasant. The room was about what we expected. The primary criticism deals with the lack of information regarding the parking at the Hotel. The Expedia site indicated there was a parking fee. At checkin the clerk indicated there was a $40 charge for parking. What was never stated was the charge was a per day fee! After a five night stay the parking fee cost more than one night's stay. Had they told me what the charge was on Expedia AND THAT THE CHARGE WAS PER DAY I probably would have chosen a different stay. I was very irritated by this matter and remain so now.

review.title: Good hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: We did not rent a car. Public transportation was readily available, streetcars, cablecars & busses. Hotel is just a block from Fishermans Wharf. Overall, just an ideal location. On our last day, found the best place for breakfast, Hollywood Cafe, around the corner.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was within walking distance to the wharf & Ghirardelli Chocolate, & shops. We requested a quiet room after reading reviews from other travelers who spoke of noisy locations & Praji, a Manager, assigned us a courtyard room. His help with that was very much appreciated as we were in the city to attend an Aneurysm & AVM walk in memory of our lost family member & we had to get up very early the next morning. The staff could not have been any more attentive. Only gripe would be the cost for parking, but it is San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could use some updating & the acoustic ceilings in the rooms could use some attention.
review.locationRemarks: All you need is within walking distance! Park in the garage & set out walking.

review.title: A great week in San Fran
review.reviewText: The location was fantastic and the breakfast was great and perfect start to everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect walking distance to all nearby attractions, it was also close to public transit including buses, and cable cars.

review.title: SF Vacay
review.reviewText: This is a great location for a visit to San Francisco. My fiance and I took his daughter for her 13th birthday. She loves SF so this was perfect. We were able to see and do a lot. Pier 39 was a few blocks away. We did not have a big issue with transients as I read in some of the inital reviews of this hotel. The staff of the hotel was great and were able to direct us on attractions close to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and stay again myself.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was the best. The hotel was clean and close to SF attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall experiance was great. No complaints.
review.locationRemarks: The locale is perfect. We were within blocks of Pier 39 and the Wharf. Public transportation is within a few feet of th hotel but not loud and noisy

review.title: Hotel by the wharf
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and location. Was inconvient that we had to park at one building unload all our luggage and walk across the street and down a little to the other hotels buildings.

review.title: lovely hotel, ok management
review.reviewText: It was good, the front of house staff were ok, but could be better. They never dealt with things themselves, they always got others to help.

review.title: great location and hotel
review.reviewText: We had an amazing stay at the Holiday Inn. Our rooms were clean, our bathroom was spotless, our beds clean and comfy. Loved it!!! Location close to everything we wanted, Pier 39, Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Comfortable room. Close walk to a lot of things. Parking in parking garage was expensive, but very convenient. Only minor improvement would be a quiter heating & cooling unit.

review.title: Over priced let down
review.reviewText: Over priced and run down hotel. The beds were old and noisy. The only good thing about this place is the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds are one and noisy
review.locationRemarks: Nice location

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great location, clean and well-maintained. Friendly staff. Free Wi-Fi with good speed. Easy access to Ghirardelli Square and the tourist attractions at Fisherman's Wharf. Only complaint is that parking and breakfast were expensive, even co.pared to the rest of the area. Also would e liked a mini fridge. Great stay overall.

review.title: A place to stay
review.reviewText: A very conveniently located hotel in just a short walk from the Fisherman's Wharf. Staff are welcoming and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very friendly staff and helpful, had a good nights sleep, rooms are clean, lots two do and see near by, and the hotel is close to bars and restaurants.

review.title: Good except for the parking/checkin situation
review.reviewText:
I feel that the guest parking rate of $40 day was not communicated in advance and should be lower than the market rate for guests not higher. This is especially true for the separate building that we were in. We had to walk a block and 1/2(outside) from our $40 parking space to our hotel.

Also we were told that we had to park at the main lot to check in with our luggage in the other building a block and 1/2 away when there is a lot right there in the other building.

The staff were courtious.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Perfect multi-purpose location
review.reviewText: Very convenient for getting to attractions and a 10 minute cab ride from anywhere downtown, convention center, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Walk to any attraction, bikes, etc
review.negativeRemarks: It was loud in the streets late into the night, but

review.title: great Stay
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Thanks for another great stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Helpful staff and room was comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: The view from my window (wall)
review.locationRemarks: Everything was in walking distance, including the trasportation system which was easy to use to get anywhere I needed to go.

review.title: Provided everything I needed.
review.reviewText:
Great location for Fishermans Wharf.
Excellent staff and service

review.title: Good enough!
review.reviewText: Would have been nice to have a fridge and micro in room. Other than that it was cool. It was our second time staying there.

review.title: good last minure reservation
review.reviewText: Nice Holiday, room was little small, and did not like finding out on arrival that there was an additional parking fee of 45.00.
review.negativeRemarks: The last minute 45.00 parking fee, totally unexpected, had no other options
review.locationRemarks: alot of restaraunts

review.title: College trip stop off
review.reviewText: Nice room...comfortable and clean. Parking was $45 a night!
review.negativeRemarks: The huge cost of parking

review.title: Disappointing for the price
review.reviewText: The most important thing in a hotel room is the bed - this one was not comfortable, the pillows were lumpy and I did not get a good night's sleep the whole stay. The vending machines were out of all drinks with the exception of water. The room service was out of chocolate ice cream the first night and both vanilla and chocolate the second night. The best thing about the hotel was the location which was one block off of Fisherman's Wharf. I would not stay there again considering that the price was a high for what you got.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed
review.locationRemarks: Great location - everything we might want was within a block or two walking distance.

review.title: Good location for families
review.reviewText:
Perfect location for a few days in San Francisco, so many great locations for eating breakfast and dinner within easy walking distance that we didn't' sample the hotel offerings.

Parking is expensive, but no more so than anywhere else in this part of town.

review.title: If you don't mind getting no sleep at all!....
review.reviewText: I am extremely unhappy with the noise coming from a nightclub immediately across the street and on the same level as our room. The music and sidewalk did not let up until after 2:00am and the club cleanup crew was out on the street again at 4:30am dispensing of all the beer/liquor bottles in a huge bin where they shattered upon impact. I complained, nothing could be done. I flew from PA to LA and drove up the coast with my kids and Holiday Inn/Fisherman's Wharf was our last stop. Horrible way to end the week. $225 for one stinking night and no compensation at all for complete lack of sleep!!

review.title: Ideally situated.
review.reviewText:
Brilliant position for Fisherman's Wharf - easy walking position.
Good value for money. Excellent breakfast.
Would definitely return and recommend.

review.title: A hotel in the middle of the wharf
review.reviewText: It is in a very good location to enjoy the city. We stayed there for three nights; the hotel was clean and the breakfast buffet was satisfactory. The staff were very helpful and kind. The building seemed to be a little bit old, yet it was not a deal breaker.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf - Right in the heart of It!
review.reviewText: We loved the location of the hotel and it was pretty easy to find. The staff was just outstanding and the room was nice. Interesting view. Outside pool with no hot tub but nice enough ... we didn't happen to use.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is just awesome & the staff was SO NICE!
review.negativeRemarks: I brought to the attention of the staff & they said they would notify maintenance that the toilet sprayed you when you flushed it.
review.locationRemarks: So close to everything you want to do in San Francisco especially the waterfront and Ghirardelli Square and the cable cars.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with just my 11 year old daughter and myself. Everything we needed was within walking distance and we felt safe in the area. The hotel was located very close to the Warf, trolly cars, and other attractions in San Francisco. There is also a laundry facility at the hotel that others in the area didn't offer. Since it was raining a little while we were here it was handy to have here.
review.negativeRemarks: prices in the restaurant...luckily a friend recommended a place across the street. It was in a Victorian house across the street
review.locationRemarks: Great that is close walking distance to main San Francisco attractions!!

review.title: Great location!
