review.reviewText: Location is great, easy access to the Fisherman's wharf and tours, busses, cable cars, and other tourist attractions. Protestors across the street were annoying and loud early in the morning. Rooms were spacious, a family of four was fairly comfortable in a room with two queens.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: See hotel website I just typed a whole bunch of information there and don't want to retype it all.
review.negativeRemarks: Price for breakfast, upkeep of broken items, coffee pot, leaky tub
review.locationRemarks: Safe, very close to cannery, wharf and ghiradelli square

review.title: Good location,close to all action on the warf.
review.reviewText:
Our room was towards a back street with container and noise,ground floor.
Not easy to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: Right near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: It's really close to Fisherman's wharf. But most of the rooms do not have a view or face each anywhere but Fisherman's wharf. We were luckily enough to get a room that faced Fisherman's wharf so it was beautiful but overall the room was extremely beautiful, nicely upkept, really comfortable and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking charge is high but it's like that for every hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Clean and comfortable close to Fisherman's Wharf,
review.reviewText: Pretty good hotel. Parking was good, fairly close to Fisherman's Wharf (we were able to walk and feel safe and comfortable#, laundry services came in handy, restaurant was good and accommodating #we arrived fairly late the first day but hadn't eaten and even though they were about ready to close they were happy to serve us whatever we wanted to order). Overall I was happy with it. I guess the only drawback was the temperature of the pool; it was a little chilly, and since it's in the shade in the afternoon it wasn't worth getting in. Maybe during hotter months this is a benefit, but in March it was just too cold. Still, I would recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable and roomy bed, free wifi, close to walk to attractions
review.negativeRemarks: cold pool, no hot tub
review.locationRemarks: corner lot not too far from Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Heart of fishermans warft
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for our stay. We could walk to most places or hop on bus or cable car. The staff was fantastic. They could answer all of our questions and had great recommendations. They made our stay even better!!!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Great hotel for a family!
review.reviewText: Excellent location to main attractions, good restaurants, stores and transportation.

review.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText: HELPFUL FRIENDLY STAFF, ROOMS ARE A GOOD SIZE AND CLEAN, VALUE FOR MONEY AND WOULD RECOMMEND. DENNYS WAS A GOOD PLACE TO EAT.
review.negativeRemarks: NOT ENOUGH MILK & SUGAR { I DRINK LOTS OF TEA }
review.locationRemarks: EXCELLANT LOCATION, ON TOP OF FISHERMANS WHARF PIER 39

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location: walking distance to the Fisherman's wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Room not in main hotel but in an adition across the street

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Great location on the wharf! Located on the F Train line.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great on the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: A/C leaked in the room
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located on the wharf

review.title: Great
review.reviewText:
Everything was great. Very clean............
.......
........
..........

review.title: Too expensive for what you get.
review.reviewText: My room was very outdated, raveling rugs, sheets that had little balls on them (not good quality) just outdated. Did not feel clean to me .

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Great location. Good parking (although there is a daily charge). We had one senior citizen and two small children and this worked well for us. Low points were the tired decor, the 24/7 Denny's in reception and there was a very long walk with very heavy bags from reception to our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Denny's
review.locationRemarks: Close to cable cars and wharf.

review.title: two hotels
review.reviewText: did not like the fact it is in 2 buildings in fact 2 hotels with all amenities eg gym swimming pool in the other block from where we stayed.it is 2 hotels pretending to be one.Also holiday inn express is next door which is another hotel again.Very confusing.When checking in we went to 2 buildings before finding right one
review.negativeRemarks: two buildings
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was conveniently located to everything. You could walk to almost anywhere you wanted to go or to the trolley or Muni to get where you wanted. The rooms were basic but clean. Beds very comfortable. We were on ground level and really didn't like that our patio opened to an alley way as we had children and it did not feel as safe, so I suggest a second level room. Parking was limited and the most expensive in the area. Parking is about $15 cheaper 2 blocks away. I would stay here again for the convenience, but would definitely research other hotels in the same area and compare prices once you add on the parking. But this is a great location. I would definitely stay here again all things being equal. Rooms look just like the pictures on their website.
review.positiveRemarks: THe location and the comfy beds were the best part of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: High parking rate of $40 per night.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Alright stay...
review.reviewText: We got a great view... Of the dumpster. People were smoking weed a few rooms over and the hallway stunk!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Dated hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: This is a hotel that shows its age. Rooms are OK, but dated. Beds are old and uncomfortable,. It is also quite noisy. The window in my room had a piece missing that was covered with a piece of cardboard. Breakfast, when not included in the rate, was quite expensive. Even a small espresso cost me $4.50, and it wasn't that great. The location, though, was ok, just in the middle of the hotel strip of Fishermen's Wharf, one block from the final stop of the F tramway.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, upkeep
review.locationRemarks: Touristy, but OK.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great location -- good price --- and very nice accommodations

review.title: Get this on the hook
review.reviewText:
Holiday inn in the USA is far different to what we Aussies would expect the hotel is a major chain and are in good locations. That being said San Fran was a great hotel clean and tidy room very large room good size bathroom. Very large hotel two locations on the one address (express) and non. Rooms were clean staff very polite and helpful.

Could not fault the service of any of the staff.

Onsite eating at either Main site or the express has a Denny's.
review.negativeRemarks: Nil
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf close to all locations

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: perfect location, just one block from fisherman's wharf. The price is just right!

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Room being next to the road was a bit noisy when vehicles pass by. Maybe a more sound proof window would reduce noise to make sleep more peaceful.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful location, lot of restaurants around, clean and internet is free
review.negativeRemarks: Noise since its closer to the kitched
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic with lot of restaurants around

review.title: Great location, decent room, mediocre common areas
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Rates were surprisingly affordable. Room was OK, but TV remote didn't work. Parking garage is in a separate building and VERY expensive ($46/night). My biggest issue was the fact that the card for the garage would never work when I tried to get out, and at the front desk they would always tell me that the card was fine and I probably wasn't inserting it properly. On the last day, it didn't work again but this time someone had left their card behind. I used the leftover card and it worked in the first try.
review.positiveRemarks: Room service was the fastest one I've ever seen. 10-15 minutes between the time I ordered breakfast and the time it was received.
review.negativeRemarks: The garage and my card that would never work, combined with the staff attitude always telling me I didn't know what I was doing.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location right by the Wharf.

review.title: what a pleasure
review.reviewText: Great beds, great location, great for a young family, very quiet. We loved our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: close to shops food and San Francisco highlights

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Hotel shows some wear, staff tries hard, is friendly
Especially housekeeping, we love the location price is too high for parking.
Room rates are high too for the age and class
Of property.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking price and bed could be nicer
review.locationRemarks: Great, convenient

review.title: Great location dont eat here
review.reviewText: Out dated Holiday Inn we stayed for 2 nights the food down stairs was expensive and not good at all the parking cost $45.00 a day which was expensive great location and close to pier 39some people who worked there were rude the computer center was nove to print the boarding passes no complimentary breakfast just go to the Starbucks down the street way better taste and same Starbucks prices good place if you plan on not being at the hotel a lot
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel Resturant
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the piers

review.title: Great location at Fishermans Wharf.
review.reviewText: My room was clean, had a decent view houses on the hill and in a great location at Fishermans Wharf. I was pleasantly surprised to be so close to the Wharf. It was convenient that there's a Walgreens only a block away from the hotel. In fact, the locations was convenient to the cable/bus lines, Alcatraz and other sightseeing boarding areas.
review.locationRemarks: The location was fantastic because it was a SHORT walk to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: SF Trip
review.reviewText: Everything was very nice with the exception of the gentleman that was at the concierge desk on Sat night at 6:00. We were told when we checked in on Thurs that all we had to do was ask him and he would see to it that we had a taxi. When we did ask, he told us that he could not get up and go do that and to just go out front and wait for one to show up. We did not find that very friendly or professional. We did get one finally on our own.

review.title: Parking $40+???
review.reviewText: Hotel is very close to the wharf, just a quick walk. There are really two hotels though... they put us in the hotel across the street from the main hotel which meant after parking our car we had to walk through the main hotel, then down the street, cross the street and go into our hotel. Be ready for a nightly charge of $40+ to park your car at YOUR hotel. I guess paying a hefty price for the room isn't enough so they really soak you on the parking charge. Probably would not stay there again...
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charge and having to walk a block to my room!
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Across the street from the a Starbucks and Walgreens and a quick 2 minute walk to the wharf. The hotel is outdated but our room was quiet. Can't beat the price being so close to the wharf and able to walk everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Kind of run down looking
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf

review.title: family stay
review.reviewText: We stayed over thePresident's Day weekend. The hotel is within walking distance to pier 39 as well as many other attractions and restaurant. I would say the downside is the 40 dollar parking plus tax is 45 per night. I seen there were some parking lots directly across the street that were around 32 dollars a night, so you may want to look into that. I would recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Tourists Delight--very close to the attractions!
review.reviewText: Within walking distance of Alchatraz Pier 33 (10-15 min walk) and fishermans wharf is around the corner. Paid the $40 for parking which is a little steep, but we walked everywhere. Boudin's bread factory and Rainforest Cafe were 2 blocks away and there were plenty of places to eat. We never did eat at the hotel. Rooms were nice and location is fantastic. Pool was nice too. We wish there was a hot tub--we were there in February so it was too chilly for the kids to swim. Overall, very happy with our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Pay $40 each day to park and no hot tub
review.locationRemarks: Best Location I can think of

review.title: Prepare for rudeness and high parking prices
review.reviewText:
The room was large and clean. That was the only plus.

Be warned that parking is $40 per day!!

The staff we dealt with were all of varying degrees of rudeness. We asked for a luggage rack so that we may bring up our own luggage as were travelling with some very expensive/fragile pieces of computer equipment for work (we were on a working vacation), and, rather that trust hotel staff or make them assume responsibiltiy if something gets lost or broken, we prefer to haul around our own luggage. When we asked the bellman for the rack he asked if we needed help and we replied, no, that we just needed the rack. He stared us down for a good 10 seconds, rolled his eyes, went to a room, retrieved the rack, and, without as much as eye contact, shoved it my husband's direction and said, "Bring it back."
The following morning the housekeeping staff knocked on our door before 9 am. Check out is at 11.
We called the front desk for another baggage cart. It was delivered to our room by an older Asian man who asked if we needed help. My husband gave the same reply as the previous night. The bellman said, "then, next time get it yourself. Don't call the bell desk," who we didn't call in the first place! Save yourself the hassle and stay elsewhere. We will next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Rude hotel staff, high parking prices, pets are allowed.
review.locationRemarks: Location is ok. Within walking distance to Pier 39.

review.title: great Hotel
review.reviewText: room was clean and there is a denny's in the middle of the lobby which worked out nice because we came in late.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Good for family but beware noisy heaters.
review.reviewText: The location was excellent. They kindly extend the parking time to 6PM on the checkout day. Overall it was OK, but the heater was really noisy. Every time it turned on, I woke up and couldn't sleep well.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy heater
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Quite comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel was quite nice to stay in,was a little noisey at night from outside traffic etc. but hey, it's a city.Stayed on L5 business suite overlooking the bay.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for everything

review.title: Fun in S.F.
review.reviewText: The hotel location was perfect for our long week-end. We were in walking distance to all the local attractions. Lots of good local cafe nearby. Safeway and Rite Aid were handy being 2 blocks away from hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Very close Fisherman's Wharf and Trolley cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise in the middle of the night outside our window.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: happy travelers
review.reviewText: Over very good experience, great location. $45.00 per night for parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds, cable TV
review.locationRemarks: Block and half from wharf, easy walk and planty to do.

review.title: Not the best, but best value for very nice.
review.reviewText:
For Fishermans Wharf, this is an excellent location. Everything else about the Holiday Inn is a bit of a compromise, from slow (but free!) internet speed, one-cup coffee maker, to lacking a fridge for leftovers.
The price was excellent, but if you have to pay $50 per night for parking, less so. This is not unusual! Check parking rates at other hotels and see. We used public transit on this trip and several bus and trolley lines were within a block away. BART and Ferry service was user friendly. Amtrak train/bus service runs to nearby Pier 39. None disappointed.

review.title: Positives greatly outweighed the one negative.
review.reviewText: The room was loud because of the noise from the pub on the corner. I'm willing to over look that though based on location and service. I loved that we could walk to the local tourist spots that my children love. The best part was the parking. it was 45$ but we could stay parked with in/out privledges until 6pm, even after we checked out of our room!! Awesome! I would stay here again when visiting with out of town guests wanting the tourist tour. Good location, good value, nice staff and clean rooms! Worth it and will stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: noise from local pub
review.locationRemarks: walking from fisherman's wharf and Ghiradelli square

review.title: Great stay.
review.reviewText:
Very close to water, and to cable car into town.

Don't ask me too much otherwise I'll abandon this effort

review.title: Good location, parking scarce
review.reviewText: Was great to be so close to the wharf. The room was clean. Enjoyed the low rate but the parking was alot of money for the few spaces available.
review.negativeRemarks: Heater in lobby wasn't working
review.locationRemarks: Only one block from wharf

review.title: Family vacation 2012-2013 frm Hawaii
review.reviewText: Great convient place to stay, I didn't feel like security was 100%....breakfast buffet amazing, Ushua is thee most fantastic servers there...
review.negativeRemarks: Security
review.locationRemarks: Awesome

review.title: Close to Wharf and transits
review.reviewText:
This is always a nice safe and clean place to stay in San Francisco. It is close to good food and all transit, public and private. The trolley is around the corner and the bus across the street. Cabs are always around and there are several car rental sites close by. It is a few blocks to the wharf and the marina.

Not spectacular but very very nice.

review.title: Mediocre Needs upgrading
review.reviewText:
Mediocre The property Needs upgrading it is over rated for the price paid for the room
although the staff is noce they all work in slow motion .

And the seem to be guests waiting in line every where

Room need to be detailed prior to selling we had a broken leaky shower and hair on the sheets
review.userLocation: Detroit, MI, USA Global traveler Loyal HH Member

review.title: Hope you dont need the internet
review.reviewText: Only complaint is the internet speed and access. It was extremly slow. I tried printing off my boarding pass at there "kiosk" and stood there for 35min and never got my boarding pass. I proceeded to use the "business center" and it took 14minutes to even load up US airways website..... left there with no boarding passes as well.

review.title: Perfect location for a family on a city break.
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location! No-frills family hotel that does everything pretty well for a great price and so convenient to downtown San Francisco. Loved my morning run through Fisherman's Wharf to Chrissy Field and the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: convenient to SanFran sight-seeing locations
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised to find that this was a full-service hotel -- bell-hop, doorman, concierge, etc. Full restaurant, so presume room service available, but didn't check into it. Staff was all very helpful and pleasant during our stay (Christmas Day through New Years' Eve Day). Concierge was especially great/ helpful, and gave us a few good off-the-beaten path food recommendations. Location very convenient/ walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf/ Pier attractions. For access to the rest of the city Muni (bus/ streetcar) stops are also very convenient (same block bus stop; F-car is just a couple blocks away)! Highly recommend booking here for your SanFran adventure!

review.title: Right in the heart of the warf
review.reviewText: The only problem I had was that even if you are staying at the hotel, they still charged us almost $50.00 a night for parking.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText:
Internet was soooooooooo slow. (almost can not use). Room was very cold due to wind coming in from a bit open space of windows. (do not recomend to stay in this hotel in winter)
The location was excelent!

review.title: A clean place to stay
review.reviewText: High speed internet is a joke! My phone was much faster. No special services. Coffee would have been a nice added touch.
review.negativeRemarks: No Coffee unless you paid for it and it wasn't available until 6 am.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for the Warf

review.title: Nice Hotel In Good Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was neat and clean and in an excellent location for visiting tourist attractions. Parking was overpriced and there was no indication when the reservation was made about the additional $40 per day cost.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost to part the car
review.locationRemarks: Good location near the Wharf and other attractions

review.title: Ok but hotel needs a renovation
review.reviewText: Overall the stay was pleasant. The hotel certainly needs an upgrading. Carpet was dirty, bath room looked too tired. However, the staff were all very helpful. Location is great as it is near to so many good eating places, fisherwharf, the trolley, tram, and so much more to offer in terms of convenience. If the hotel has an upgrade to their current condition, I would definitely go back again, But not right now.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location to the Fisherman's Wharf sights. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We wish there had been a complimentary breakfast with the room, and since we stayed in the Beach Street location you had to go outside to the other building to buy coffee, but overall it was a good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: worn carpet in the rooms, no complimentary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Near the Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Try to negotiate a lower price.
review.reviewText: Breakfast buffet was $25 and was your typical buffet, although in a nice setting. Check-in computers broke-down several times while checking in, I technically checked-in three separate times. Sodas in the bar were flat and tasteless and they would give me a new drink after I tasted it. Rooms had no fridge. My room had a window that could be opened on the first floor and did not lock to prevent entry though the window. Furniture was old and drawers were broken. Thermostat/PTAC would not keep the temperature at a constant temperature. When trying to talk to the front desk about issue with my room they pretended to misunderstand me and would not make consideration for changing my room out. Conference room (Sonora?) thermostat/HVAC was horrible, one minute it was cold and the next minute it was scorching hot. The coffee ran out in the first 30 minutes of our meeting on Friday and when asked to replenish the coffee they said they would - they didn't. After lunch, they only had water and a few bottles of soda that again ran out except for the diet crap. Overall, public areas looked nice and clean enough, but after scratching the surface, the hotel was a hole.
review.negativeRemarks: details
review.locationRemarks: Right in the center of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: OK if you do not stay indoors
review.reviewText: Good location. The hotel has two wings, one with the main reception, one above Denny's. I lived in the second one. The premises and the rooms were not up to the expectations. Also, the hotel had a very dull environment.

review.title: Great Location and nice rooms.
review.reviewText:
Great location for access to Fisherman Wharf and Pier 39. Overnight parking is expensive but the many public transit options are located nearby.
Free wifi was nice, but the network was pretty bad for anything other than simple emails or a website you don't mind waiting for.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rates

review.title: Good value for Money
review.reviewText: Hotel is very well located and staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel was recomended to me and I will pass on this recomendation to friends. I would say good value for money as the amenities are adaquate rather than luxurious. There are a lot of good restaurants within a short walk and close to cable car and tram pick up points.

review.title: < GO NAVY>
review.reviewText: Kudos to your staff ! ;-}}} thet ia all i can say about that

review.title: Expensive to park the car
review.reviewText: The $50/day without tax charge to park the car takes away from the value of staying at a budget hotel

review.title: Best location and value.
review.reviewText: Location was awesome, great experience all around!
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: You tend to pay a bit more for hotels in San Francisco so this was ok for the price . Location is handy to all of Fishermans Wharf ameneties .Don't mind a beer myself with plenty of fun bars nearby . Don't expect the red carpet treatment but I would go back again .

review.title: nothing special.
review.reviewText: is too big, not personal attention and expensive for what they offer for clients.
review.negativeRemarks: is like a hospital...too big!
review.locationRemarks: nice area, but far from the airport and central area

review.title: Exceptional except for the parking price
review.reviewText: Hotel room was very nice. It included a fridge and microwave. Conviently located. Staff was exceptional nice and polite. I took a star off due to the high price of parking. $40 dollars a day to park and then they throw another $5 on as a tax for each day! Other than that I would have given the hotel and its staff a 5 star!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, convinent location, nice room
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Much like large hotel chains it is about charging for everything. Parking $40, telephone call for 1 minutes with assistance from the operator $10.

review.title: Great location & close to the action!
review.reviewText: We love the location of this hotel to many of our favorite restaurants & places. Easy to get around with transportation very nearby. Will definitely be back!
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to our favorite places!

review.title: Good hotel for family
review.reviewText: everything good except the power went out when i was in the shower. Would come back anyway. Good service, clean room.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotels location was the best. We were able to walk to all attractions from Ghirardelli Square to Pier 39. We only have two complaints...The gentleman who checked me in didnt speak fluent English, and miscommunicated that we would be able to park across the street where we were staying(there were two seperate hotels), so we carried all of our luggage down the street and around the corner, only to find parking right there. The second issue was that the power was knocked out around 9am the following morning, and nobody came by or called to see if we needed anything. You couldnt see anything in the bathroom, and we had alot of things in there, so it was a difficult process to ensure we removed everything and had a shower. A flashlight would have helped greatly.
review.negativeRemarks: $40 for parking
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was super nice and very helpful, we will definitely stay there again. Thank you
review.negativeRemarks: The pool was a little cool
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of fishermans warf

review.title: Perfect for links to fishermans
review.reviewText: Great base to visit San Fran. 5 minute walk from fishermans wharf and pier 39. Bed was very comfy, plenty of room and nice powerful shower. Yep it wasn't glitzy and maybe it needs a freshen up but I don't go on holiday to judge decor!
review.locationRemarks: Only 5 mins walk from the wharf

review.title: Location is best.
review.reviewText: Best location, nice rooms, very nice value and not a dump!

review.title: Clean hotel; good location; horrible service.
review.reviewText: There was a general unwillingness of front-desk staff to assist guests. One time, when I asked about public bus lines, the person behind the desk sighed, rolled his eyes and said, "You'll need to speak with the Concierge about that," and pointed to the desk where NOBODY WAS SITTING. When I pointed this out, he took another sigh and said, "Then I suppose you'll have to wait." Can you even imagine how angry I was?

review.title: Just a place to sleep
review.reviewText: When we got to our hotel we had to walk a block & half to get to our room with our luggage in toe. Also the bathroom had no counter to put you toletries we uncomfortable set up
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Nice location - over priced.
review.reviewText: Location is good with respect to Fisherman's Wharf but the price does not seem to match the overall quality (but it is a Holiday Inn and not a Hyatt or higher class hotel). Restaurant food (only had breakfast) was pricey but the food was good.

review.title: Good location...bad room!
review.reviewText: The room was hardly worth the price. Carpet was dirty overall and completely frayed under the door. We had double beds and each had a worn mattress that smelled of body odor. The shower had a very slow drain, in fact, we had to wait for the tub to empty of water before the other person could take a shower. The lobby of the hotel looked as if it were converted from a garage. It was drab and cold. We would never stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: the room

review.title: Nice stay but too many sections.
review.reviewText: This hotel had different section's. I think it had 3 sections. The buliding we stayed was across the street from the main buliding. Also the building where we are had a Denny's restaurant inside which was 24 Hrs. We also found the hotel and a bar or lounge which was across the street from ours.

review.title: A great hotel to stay at the wharf.
review.reviewText: A great hotel in a great location - just one block from the wharf and surrounded by great restaurants. The hotel was very clean and smart, and the staff very friendly and always helpful. The concierge team was particularly helpful and knowlegeable. The slight downside is there are two builiding and we were placed in the Beach Buidling, which was a little walk from the main hotel (and breakfast restauarant) but just as pleasant. Great location and highly recommended.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: They put us in their" NEW quiet building" As she called it... we had neighbors that partied the entire first night, until almost 5am. Three times we had security come, and they were told to quiet down. It got worse every time after security left. On the 3rd security call I actually went down in my PJ's to get him to come back again. These people were ridiculous. they should have been thrown out, and we should have gotten that night free. The other thing.. The beds were very comfortable, but for being a NEW building, the carpets sure were dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: LACK OF SLEEP DUE TO THE PARTY NEXT DOOR.. CARPET COULD BE CLEANER..

review.title: Holiday Inn is great for all!
review.reviewText: It was great! Good location and easy access to tranporation! The beds were so comfy and the rooms spacious! We will definatly come back!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, size of room, and comfort
review.negativeRemarks: Parking location in relation to room---it was a bit of a hike we were not expecting
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans warf which is beautiful and easily accessible to all major site seeing attractions!

review.title: Bot recommending to friends
review.reviewText:
-Staff was not friendly upon arrival
-Wallpaper peeling in room
-Called ahead for fridge in room and was not there upon arrival and when asked they told me there would be a charge (would like to know these things ahead of time)
-Tiles falling off in bathroom
-Half the hotel is in another building across the street, which became a problem when I wanted to use exercise facilities, walking over to main building in rain in the morning is not ideal (they don't tell you that there are two buildings)
-exercise facilities are pathetic (a cluster of equipment in a tiny gazebo, and only machines working were treadmills)

Overall, very displeased.
review.positiveRemarks: Was in convenient location for Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Staff, cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Good location, but Fisherman's Wharf can get old after a couple days

review.title: Great hotel, great view, great location
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel and will go there anytime I go back. It's 1 block away from Beach St, which is the main drag of Fisherman's Wharf. It's a short walk away from great food, Ghiradelli Square, 2 cable cars, city bus tours, and so many other great things.

The room I had was super clean and had a view of Alcatraz from my window. It was clean and the staff was so friendly.

HIGHLY recommend it to anyone looking for a great hotel, within walking distance of great attractions in Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Great Location... Nice Hotel!
review.reviewText: Our check in clerk graciously gave us a great wharf view room even tho we were checking in early. She gave us directions to the nearby cable cars, and general information about happenings in the city. The only downside was a VERY SLOW internet available to all thru a computer on each floor. They had internet available in the rooms as well, if you brought your laptop.... but Apple needed special help. But we were there for close proximity to Fisherman's Wharf area, the cable cars, Ghiradelli Sq and the famous Buena Vista!
review.negativeRemarks: Internet was SLOW.... but FREE So, not good for business travel.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to catch a bus or cable cars.... you are IN Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Great hotel and very close to attractions.
review.reviewText: Very close to everything - ferry building, pier 39, Alcatraz, in and out burger, Denny's, chipotle, Franciscan, slanted door, car rentals, and etc.

review.title: meh
review.reviewText: meh it was passable not good. just in a decent location

review.title: Cool Hotel for the Price and very convenient!!
review.reviewText: It was great..My husband requested a room near to the main floor because Im pregnant and they did it! staff was very nice, room clean and beds confy! and Hotel is located on a Prime location u do not have to drive or rent a car!
review.negativeRemarks: missing microwave and fridge in room to warm the milk for my son
review.locationRemarks: Excellent Location!

review.title: Excellent hotel if wanting to be close to Pier 39
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our hotel stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. We only wished there had been a microwave and small refrigerator in the room.

We were close to Pier 39 for shopping and restaurants and the staff in the hotel was very pleasant, always trying to please us. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend to friends and family. Denny's restaurant next door was a definite plus.
review.negativeRemarks: We were disappointed there was not a mini refrigerator in the room or microwave
review.locationRemarks: Main hotel was across the street with bellmen to assist with luggage. I was very concerned about the walking distance.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded our expectations as we were concerned it is an older place in the Wharf area and could be rundown. It has been refurbished very nicely with all modern features. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the comfortable bedding, fluffy towels, and flatscreen TV. Our room was in their 2nd building on the interior side so there was minimal street noise. The location was perfect to walk to the Wharf for activities and dinner. The Denny's located in the lobby wasn't great food but it was very convenient for breakfast.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: The quality is pretty good except the bed is slightly itchy

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location to restaurants at piers. Quality of the space isn't amazing but fairly good enough.

review.title: great place to stay in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Great staff. Very helpful we will visit again soon. Thanks Expedia!

review.title: Terrible decor but ok hotel
review.reviewText: First impressions were disappointing, the decor is appalling. Very dull and old fashioned. Gave off the wrong vibes. Room was spacious but we were told we couldn't have the roll away bed we requested because of fire risk. Like that we could print out our boarding passes of a machine on the landing.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor
review.locationRemarks: Location was near the attractions and restaurants of fisher mans wharf, but at 4 am the dust carts started emptying from ours and adjacent hotels.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We come up almost every year for Fleet Week. Instead, this year we were there a week later. The hotel is not extravagant, but serves our needs. We like to walk to the wharf and mosey around the bay. The hotel is conveniently located, clean and reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: The bar needs something---
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for our needs

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at Holiday Inn, Fishermans Wharf, Location, Location.

review.title: Good base for the full tourist experience
review.reviewText: The "free" WIFI only worked one day out of four. The staff were aware of a capacity problem, and were frustrated that the chain management were taking so long to sort it out. Aircon was by an in-room unit which was too noisy and windy to leave on, but in October we only needed it on for 15 minutes to cool the room. Breakfast was good but expensive. Room layout was such that we could not watch TV from the sofa! Everything else in the hotel was good. Staff were very helpfu. Location is good if you want to be in the tourist area. There is plenty of public transport including two cable car lines nearby. We walked to North Beach -not a beach but where there are lots of Italian resturants. We were on vacation, but it is probably good as a business hotel (apart from the WIFI)

review.title: Disappointed guest
review.reviewText: Price does not match amenities :poor internet (Wi-Fi),bath towels need replacement,no fridge and for the kind of money they charge,breakfast shoul be included.Remember,this was on Expedia rate
review.locationRemarks: Number one. Closer to most of the things. Easy access to transport

review.title: place to stay
review.reviewText: I would stay there for business or with my family.

review.title: Comfortable place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel only has 5 floors so the view isn't great. Good location. Wifi is terrible, although access to the business centre is handy. The room is comfortable. Having the Laundry facilities in the hotel is convenient.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Great location, hotel is a bit dated but comfortable. Don't eat at the Denny's diner in the hotel annex...worst customer service ever, rude staff and pushy to get you out, circling the tip on the bill...not to mention the less than tasteful food.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit pricey
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, tram to downtown and cable car.

review.title: Staying in the wharf!
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Fisherman's wharf area, Trolly cars and Girardelli square. Great location!

review.title: Great hotel for no sleep.
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms experience too much external noise. Questioned staff and they said they asked Holiday Inn to double glaze windows and the company was not interested in doing it. Shame because everything else was great. If you don't want sleep perfect hotel to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Central to all attractions

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We found it bery pleasing it was very close to fishermans Warf and the cable cars we had a nice walk around town

review.title: Great hotel, staff and location for all tourists
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at the Holiday Inn Wharf Hotel previously and was so pleased with it and the staff. On this holiday we took our daughter and two grandaughters with us and we were all pleased with our stay.

The staff goes out of their way to make your stay comfortable. The Hotel is close to Pier 39, the wharf, both trolley lines, great restaurants and shopping. Easy access to any transportation to go downtown or any place in the San Francisco area.

When we head back to San Francisco we will definitly stay at the Holiday Inn Wharf again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location and great staff, clean rooms...
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of one thing
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39, both trolley lines, great restaurants, shops and the wharf.

review.title: Good but could have been better
review.reviewText: The hotel and the room were good, the reception staff were also good but other staff were a bit cool. Althought the room was nice and clean, the window sashes were loose in the frame and rattled in the wind ( when you are situated near Fisherman's Wharf there is a lot of wind). The windows also had a poor soundproofing rating, the noise from the street especially early morning was annoying. I would not recommend eating at this hotel, food was very average. Overall, depending on price, I would consider using this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Food
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Nice hotel, superb location
review.reviewText:
Great location, only a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.
The on-premises Denny's isn't much, but there are dozens of very
good restaurants within a few blocks. Staff was helpful. The room was fairly big.
I would stay there again.

review.title: Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent location, really good place to stay, close to public transport and the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is on two sites, but in practice this didn't matter.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of the Wharf, Cable Cars, and Trams - really a great spot

review.title: Parking nightmare
review.reviewText: Everything went well except for the parking situation. This hotel does not have enough parking for their guests. We had to park a block away. When we arrive at night after a day of touring we had to walk a ways just to get back to our building. Not very convenient & the hotel still charged us $90.00 for the parking.
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: 1 block from the warf, close to everything.

review.title: Great Location for Wharf fun
review.reviewText:
I don't think we would recommend taking the Airport Shuttle from this location unless you have lots of time. We got picked up first and proceeded to drive all over the city picking up several other parties. Yikes!! We were really worried about getting to the airport on time.
also, the Denny's seems convenient but the service suffered and it was really noisy. The buss boy loaded a tub at nearby table, and I thought he was trying to break the dishes he was dropping them in so hard.Almost funny, but not at 8:00am.

review.title: Not certain I would book again
review.reviewText: Be careful when booking rooms for this hotel as you think you are getting a room in the main address where all the amenities are, such as the parking lot, pool, gym, cafe and shops but yet when you get there, they put you in a hotel down the street that they call there building 2! so inconvenient specially with kids.

review.title: Large cars not easy to find parking
review.reviewText: Parking a large truck was difficult.Location was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking cost
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Great Location with close by transportation!
review.reviewText: It's a great location with close by transportation into the city...very easy....
review.positiveRemarks: The location to the F Market
review.negativeRemarks: The very slow internet connection to print out boarding passes.

review.title: Good location for exploring SF
review.reviewText: Denny's was a let down. Food not good. Service just passible.
review.negativeRemarks: Dated and old to the point its starting to look dirty
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: There was nothing really wrong with our stay, we just didn't like the hotel, the location or the room. The location is noisy and a bit gritty, and the room was on the small side for two adults and two kids.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Noisy and a little gritty

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and in serious need of some new paint, wallpaper, carpet, etc. If your intention is to use your hotel for sleeping, then stay here. If you are looking for any amenities, find another hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location is ideal. Literally a short block to the wharf. We walked everywhere and had easy access to the Muni (public transport) if we needed it

review.title: Great hotel for walking the bridge.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed out stay very much. Thelocation was superb.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: This hotel was OK. Keep in mind the extra charge for parking. The hotel allows pets, which in our case sucked. We could hear a dog in one of the rooms barking all morning. If you are one of those people that can be spontaneous then dont make reservations, just stop into the nearby hotels. They seem to be accommodating with the parking (and will waive the parking fee all together which is a huge savings). We did this the next day, Holiday Inn was booked and it forced us to pop into other hotels. Marriott had a room available for our family of 4 and totally waived the parking.
review.negativeRemarks: charging for parking, allowing pets
review.locationRemarks: great location for the Wharf

review.title: Clean, comfortable, convenient, costly
review.reviewText:
Super location for a few days; stuff right out of the door, an easy enough walk for much of downtown and great for driving too. However, garage parking at $40 a day, whilst similar to what other hotels appear to be charging and cheaper than some, seemed harsh.

It's clean, comfortable and convenient, but you certainly pay for it. It does seem that's a "San Francisco" premium, yet if you're travelling around a bit it will likely be a pretty poor in terms of value (amenities, space, etc. vs. price paid).

It was our most expensive hotel, yet far from our best - yet it was the only one in SF.

When we return we will stay a little further out and drive in (forgot how easy it is to drive in SF), or spend a little more to stay downtown for a change of scene - the pier/wharf area is neat, but doesn't have enough depth to be a doorstep for two trips.

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: It is a good hotel for San Francisco, the neighborhood is great. Parking a car is $45/night.

review.title: Nice stay, know which building you are in.
review.reviewText: The only drawback was the fact that the Holiday Inn owns 2 buildings. We had to haul our luggage a block down the street after parking in the garage. I would suggest asking to stay in the main building. Other than that all was well. The location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: 2nd building
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the Pier for easy access to attractions

review.title: 3 Night Stay
review.reviewText: Good location, within walking distance of Piers, etc. Parking a little expensive.

review.title: Met expectations
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was pretty much what I expected. It was a little pricier than I hoped for, but, because of the location, it seemed to be in line with the others in the area. The room was clean and the a/c worked fine. There was a little bit of peeling wallpaper in the bathroom - no big deal. The rest of the hotel was clean and well-kept. I wasn't crazy about paying $40 a day to park, but the garage was under the hotel and easily accessible - at least I had parking privileges until 6 pm on the day of check-out. The only real downside was the fact that it was a little noisy into the wee hours (about 2 am) out on the street in front of our room - but we were so so tired from sight-seeing and walking that it didn't bother us too much. We woke up, noticed the noise, then fell right back asleep. A pleasant surprise - soft drinks in the vending machine were priced "normally" - $1.50 for a bottle - it seems like hotels usually use the convenience to price gouge - not here.
review.positiveRemarks:
Good location
Clean rooms
Comfortable beds
review.negativeRemarks:
Noisy on the street outside our room (not the hotels fault)
Parking - but fees seemed to be on par with other hotels
review.locationRemarks: Close to lots of attractions; easy walk to Alcatraz pier, Washington Square, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, Ghirardelli Sq

review.title: Good but overpriced.
review.reviewText:
Over priced for what is offered.
Was send to the "beach" building, reservation should clearly indicate where to go upon arrival, the hotel is 2 buildings with 2 lobby's.

Parking at $40.00 a day is absurd!!! Should be discounted for multi day stays!!
review.negativeRemarks: room price and parking
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Horrible place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: It sucked, parking was way far away them don't tell you how to get there. And I got two rooms and they didn't give me ajoining, even though one of them was. Had to walk a block with all my bags to get there. The employes were rude and unhelpful. I will never stay there again, I would rather pay twice as much and stay where I know its good service

review.title: it is what it is!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very central, but quite noisy in the early mornings. It is also a bit too pricey to feel like yo u were getting value for money. Concierge could be more forthcoming with information
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy

review.title: Nice hotel for a family
review.reviewText: This hotel had very nice rooms, comfortable beds and pillows, and was very clean. The staff was friendly. We never eat breakfast there because we thought it was a little too high but overall, I am glad we stayed there. It was close to the shops, trolley and a lot of other attractions to see. Very pleased.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to a lot of attractions.

review.title: Good hotel for families
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to the attractions like Fisherman's Wharf, dining, shopping, cable car and public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was close to everything we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: We have 3 children and the hotel said they had a sofa bed however they did not, but they did provide us with a roll away bed.

review.title: Great Staff!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was excellent! The Denny's, though, was very expensive. The hotel staff was very helpful when it came to explaining how to use the trolley and bus system to get to the sites we wanted to see. There is a main building and a separate one on Beach street. We got put in Beach and the parking was NOT good.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was NOT good for the price!
review.locationRemarks: The location was the BEST!

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: A bit shocked by the parking fees, but never had to move the car while staying at the hotel. It is Ina great location and made our stay very enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: In walking distance to most attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy neighbors made the walls seem too thin.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location to explore Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The hotel was o.k. and close to attractions. I felt the price was very high for what we received.
review.positiveRemarks: It was pretty close to several things we wanted to see.
review.negativeRemarks: We had to walk a block with all of our luggage upon check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier and attractions.

review.title: Conviently Located
review.reviewText: Conviently located near a street car that will take you anywhere along the pier. Cable car stops are only a few short blocks away.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything. We did not need a car.

review.title: Just About As Close As You Can Get To The Wharf
review.reviewText: Absolutely great location! The hotel is actually 2 different buildings which was a little different. The beds were a little hard but after walking all day I didn't even notice. The bathroom was a little small with very little counter space and the lighting wasn't so great. The A/C worked great (I like it cold). No fridge for leftovers. We enjoyed our stay!
review.negativeRemarks: No fridge - really didn't like the fact that there was no place for leftovers
review.locationRemarks: Awesome!

review.title: Great location for SF
review.reviewText: The parking was expensive and not convenient. We were in the annex and had to roll our luggage from the parking lot to the room over streets and then reverse the process when we checked out.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText:
Location is great, near both Fishermens Wharf and North Beach, near cable car lines and muni lines. The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars is because of the restaurant. The service is friendly but the food is overpriced and underwhelming. Both concierges I dealt with were very helpful and friendly. For those who travel with a carryon only and buy things, there is a UPS store just a couple of steps south from the hotel on Columbus and there's a little breakfast-and-lunch place just west and across the street from the lobby called Pernino's (or something like that) that's on the main floor of a classic victorian home that serves "the greatest waffles". The waffles are fine but it's the whipped cream 'n' butter topping that's to die for, as well as the fresh boysenberry preserves. Highly recommend for breakfast as their omelets are great too.

We found the hotel to be fairly quiet for a big hotel but we were upgraded on arrival to the Priority floor because my friend's husband had a Holiday Inn points card. All in all our experience was quite positive.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk and concierge very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Onsite restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Primo

review.title: Convenient, But Has Multiple Buildings!
review.reviewText:
Bit of a pain to get to using public transport however it is very conviently located for tourists, the F line tram is right out the front of the hotel, quick walk down to Fishermans Wharf or up to Lombard St and cable car lines.

Rooms of a decent standard and size. Only problem is that this hotel has a couple of sites, you need to check in/register on the 1300 columbus building however as I was you might be staying at the other Holiday Inn across the street, not that it was a bad thing as the part of the hotel i was in was newer anyway and has a built in 24 hour Dennys!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, convenience to transport, supermarkets and Tourist Spots. Built in 24 hour Denny's
review.negativeRemarks: The multiple buildings that they use!
review.locationRemarks: Very Convenient! However if you plan to take public transport you'll need to get the BART to Powell St and change for the F line tram!

review.title: San Francisco June 2012
review.reviewText: Pleasant hotel in great location for all waterfront attractions. Restaurant seemed a little expensive but good quality. Room fine though as it was on ground floor backing onto service road a bit noisy at times.
review.negativeRemarks: Evacuating the hotel at 3am after fire alarm going off
review.locationRemarks: Superb location near fishermans wharf

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText:
Arrived at San francisco at 2am. Even though our room was prepaid for 4 nights.. They did not have a room ready for us, instead they gave us a lounge room that adjoined to two other rooms.
They set us up two roll away beds..

The next morning we were provided with an upgrade to a business suite. This impressed us and overall out experiance at this hotel was turned right around.

Would probably stay here again.

review.title: A great stay!
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Holiday Day Inn Fisherman's Wharf and had a great experience. The location couldn't have been better. It was so convenient to everything; Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants, shopping, Ghirardelli, cable cars and the F Line muni. The room was standard but comfortable beds and great shower. We parked our car in the lower garage and never used it again. It was expensive, but not unexpected for a large city. We will stay at this located again when we return to San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an ideal location. The room was large and comfortable for my family of 5.

review.title: The Holiday Inn at the S.F. Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel room was nice and in close proximity to all the sights found alongside the wharf area. The concierge was helpful in choosing tours and at the end of a long day a Denny's was located within the hotel if you chose not to go out to eat. Their food was wholesome. I had a few questions regarding particular sights, shopping and transfers back to the hotel. The employees were very knowledgeable and helpful in answering all questions. I would definitely stay on a return visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Registration was in building 1 and had to walk outside to building 2 with possessions..
review.locationRemarks: Great for sightseeing, tours and people watching.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf a good place to stay.
review.reviewText: The room was very nice and clean. The only drawback was no air conditioning. It was cool so it really didn't matter. It was very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf and the Trolley Car. I am glad we stayed near the waterfront.

review.title: Great position but noisy
review.reviewText: Comfortable and clean but need to get rooms away from streets - road and traffic noise keep you awake and can get very loud.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to fishermans wharf easy walk

review.title: No Impressed
review.reviewText:
Parking Fee is $40/Day, Elevators very slow and old, No stairwell access to upper floors.
Hotel was old and in state of repairs. Bathroom had Mold and poorly patched ceiling.

review.title: Great Location, great room, great price
review.reviewText: Location was excellent. Hotel was walking distance to Fishermen's Wharf and to the Hop on Hop off bus. I felt safe. Close to Walgreens and lots of shops. The room was clean, spacious, and the bed was comfortable. My son n husband was happy that there was ESPN as well.
review.negativeRemarks: pool was supposed to be heated but was a little on the cold side
review.locationRemarks: right by Fisherman's Wharf and close to shops

review.title: 75th Anniversary of the Golden Gate bridge weekend
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was outstanding! Close to everywhere. Housekeepers always had our room clean when we came back to our rooms at night.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator was slow. But we did arrive on a busy Memorial day weekend.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything at Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: South Carolina visits SF
review.reviewText: When we arrived we were greeted by Ed and Ed wasn't too friendly. We were told that parking was $40 per night and with a grin on his face. We went to our room which was actually another hotel about a block away. The room was okay but they were doing work outside our window at 11:30 pm with a jack hammer. Called front office and asked for another room and Ed said there were no more rooms. Called Expedia and aske to be transferred to another hotel due to the construction work going on. They spoke with the front office and told them the situation about the jack hammer and finally got to move to another room in the original Holiday Inn. Thanks to Expedia we were able to enjoy our vacation. Don't take a taxi to the airport - it will cost you $65 - hotel told us $50.
review.negativeRemarks: No free breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Location was great - walking distance to everything.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I go to San Francisco once a year and always stay at the Holiday Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. The hotel is located conveniently close to the bay area making it easy to walk around and participate in the many activities and amenities along the piers.
review.positiveRemarks: Computers are available to check emails and do internet searches.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't really have anything I could complain about.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located around Fisherman's wharf, tour companies, and chocolate!

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to everything. With the exception of the noise on the streets, everything was very pleasant. I know the noise was out of there control. I would highly recommend the hop-on-hop off tour bus to see the sights of San Francisco also get the Airport Shuttle to and from the airport much cheaper than taxi.
review.negativeRemarks: noise from the streets.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, all of the popular piers, Ghirardelli Square

review.title: not bad overall
review.reviewText: a lot of noise from alley behind hotel, seemed to thoroughfair for drunks ,chemically challenged,and mentally ill
review.negativeRemarks: noise between hotel and next building
review.locationRemarks: close to wharf & transpot

review.title: Best Hotel by Pier 39
review.reviewText: The location is great if you are wanting to visit pier 39. There are so many restaurants and shops surrounding this hotel. Everything you need is within walking distance. The staff is extremely friendly and try to make the best out of our stay. The only thing that I did not realize, and I wish they would have included this in the price, was the $45 fee for parking. It was worth it though, we had in and out privileges and were able to keep our car there even after we checked out until 7pm, so if you still want to roam the city, leave your car in the parking lot so you will not have to worry about parking later. I will definitely stay at this hotel in my future visits to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, customer service, and comfortable beds
review.negativeRemarks: additional parking fee of $45
review.locationRemarks: Down the street from all the greatest tourists attractions

review.title: Recommendation
review.reviewText:
Freindly staff who were always helpful and willing to go that extra mile.
Good location and well presented. Would recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee making facilties in room were not what we expected, and no fridge in room.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic. Central to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great location and hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome location. Right next to Fisherman's Whorf and many attractions. Nice and clean hotel and rooms. Staff was nice and concierge was very helpful. Would recommend!
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints

review.title: A hassle
review.reviewText:
1. The TV remote control didn't work. It took ages for someone to come up to look at it; when he did he said "It isn't working." Nothing could be done until the following day.
2. The food service is terrible. The menu has very few items, room service closes early, and there is a 45 minute wait.
3. A friend of mine called three times and left messages but I never saw any of them. The light was not flashing.
4. On the last night I could not reach the operator to request a wake-up call.
review.negativeRemarks: Services. Staff poorly trained.
review.locationRemarks: Fast food, T-shirts. No scenery.

review.title: Hotel rating
review.reviewText:
Excellent location - v close to cable car terminus and to F line streetcar. Handy for lots of restaurants. Especially good location for first time visitors to SF.
We were placed in the hotel annex - not the main building, so a 200m trek across from reception that we weren't expecting, no concierge in the annex and reception only open part time. Denny's restaurant on site. Walgreens (drug store that also sells water and wine) adjacent. Also Starbucks and many places for breakfast.
Room OK - we were three people sharing a 2xqueen bed room to keep costs down so a little tight for space. Rooms have safe. PC available on each floor (but verrrry slow) to enable check in for return flights.
Overall a good deal. With hindsight, would have upgraded room to King + queen if poss. I've previously stayed at Holiday Inn Express (next door) which was v good and downtown at Handlery Hotel, also v good.
Had also booked transfer from hotel with Execucar via Expedia - this didn't work out as no car there to meet us and this caused a lot of stress that we could have done without after 11 hour flight!

review.title: perfect spot!
review.reviewText: This place is a perfect location! One block from Fishermans Wharf! Only down side, we checked in and then we were told we had to walk back outside to a different building. Very odd. But did not change my opinion that it is a very clean and comfortable room. Location is great. Not very many cabs near by, but gave us an excuse to try the cable cars and all the local tours! The walk to different areas is not far but very hilly!
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were super comfy! Great location!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: A block from Fishermans Wharf. A short walk from Ghirardelli square yum!!!! Short walk to Pier 39.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Walking distance to cable cars, bus, trolley and fisherman's wharf. Very quiet at night, able to sleep. Very friendly and courteous staff, they were always willing to give you directions and tips. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Noisy, unauthorized folks in the hotel, great location

review.title: very dissapointed tourist
review.reviewText:
the hotel experience was good but not great.
the reason being is that when i showed up to register at the front counter i was charged $228.00 just for parking that was very unfair and expensive.
a total turn off for a tourist like my self it's not my fault the city is not big enough to have room for parking.
review.negativeRemarks: very cheap coffee and shampoo

review.title: DIDNT LIKE
review.reviewText:
I DO NOT RECOMEND THIS HOTEL .
I EXPECT SOMETHING BETTER AND DIDNT LIKE THE MANAGER .
I WAS VERY DESAPOITED .
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING
review.locationRemarks: DIDNT LIKE

review.title: I'd recommend it!
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly what I wanted. It was clean, comfortable, in a fab location and the staff were all incredibly helpful. I can't fault it.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable, clean and in a great location
review.negativeRemarks: The view from my window was of some bins.. but someone has to have a rubbish view.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was in a brilliant location 3 minutes from Fisherman's Wharf, 4 minutes from the cable car and very close to lots of tourist attractions.

review.title: Inexpensive, but good location
review.reviewText: The rooms were very average. Nothing fancy, but it wasn't a very high priority for our trip because we didn't spend much time in the room as much as we did out and about. Our view was less than good. We faced another building. Although, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was a little small and the beds were not very comfortable, but the location is great, you're 1 block from the Wharf! If you're looking for a nice and inexpensive hotel while visiting San Francisco and all it's sites this is a good one.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds
review.locationRemarks: 1 block form Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: disappointment
review.reviewText: Air conditioning was bad and staff was very unfriendly.

review.title: Great location! Nice staff!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay here. I liked that it was close to a lot of attractions. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. Thought the parking was a little pricey but I'm sure it's normal for San fran.

review.title: starting again
review.reviewText: Every one was great and made you feel at their home away from home.Plan to return and see the people there
review.positiveRemarks: Close to what we wanted to see and do the name
review.negativeRemarks: Prices were high on the memu but ate out more due to seeing the sites
review.locationRemarks: being close and a fair price is a great feeling

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Very simple rooms with generally unhelpful staff. Wireless internet often not worth the effort it was so slow.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the beds were soooo comfortable. Near all the attrations. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and the high pressure shower
review.negativeRemarks: Being on the 5th floor and having to walk over to the other building for the business center
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Highly reccomended, I would stay there again!
review.reviewText:
I had a very good experience. The hotel is in a very convenient location, I did not have a car for this trip but the cable cars actually drop you off about 2 blocks from the hotel. It is close to Pier 39, Alcatraz, The Golden Gate Bridge, and if you're looking to get further there are tons of sightseeing tour buses easily accessible.

I knew I would not be spending a lot of time in my room so my biggest concern was clean beds, and I was pleasantly surprised to find that the sheets were not old and they were clean, I had a big comfy bed! Also the bathroom was bigger than I had expected.
review.positiveRemarks: clean beds, hair dryer already in the bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: they encourage you to reuse the bath towels
review.locationRemarks: very convenient

review.title: San Fran holiday
review.reviewText: Great place, close to Fishermans Wharf. The staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: Staff are very helpful. It is very good for 3 star hotel. very convenient location.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Hotel is older but well maintained, but not well sound proofed. Had an amorous couple next door and heard everything. Parking is $45 per night. When asked for a parking lot nearby that was less expensive the front desk and the concierge both said that there wasn't anything. We found parking for $20 across the street near the Herz rental building.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel's close location to Fisherman's Wharf and to many transit stops makes it a good place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Greaaat location especially if you are in family vacations
condition is great and roomservice was good too
it is near all attraction areas and nearby the waterfront. shops and activities around you and you will find resturants and coffeeshops around you only walking distance, even pharmacy and small shops an great places for breakfast in the morning
their prices are reasonable
It made my experience in San Fransisco even better:)
I will come back to it with family.

One thing I hated when Ichecked in I had to walk to the other building cross the street where my room is at night with children .So if they just build a briedge between the building it will be great
review.negativeRemarks: going to the other hotel building cross the street
review.locationRemarks: great great great great I took the 48 hrs bus tour to visit everywhere in SF and I didnt have to ride a taxi execpt to airport

review.title: Perfect Location for a San Fran Weekend Trip
review.reviewText: Great hotel in the perfect location for transportation and the piers. Really great rooms I just wish that the breakfast wasn't so expensive. Other than that, wonderful hotel and would definitely come back!
review.negativeRemarks: Price of breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located near shopping, transportation, tourist attractions, and restaurants

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: nice clean, well kept room. parking was dreadfully overpriced. hotel needed better handicap access, but excellent location, and room was comparably priced.

review.title: Room placement is everything,
review.reviewText:
Room selection is critical. The hotel is on a diagonal with one end facing a intersection. If you get a room on the end facing that intersection, the outside traffic noise is unbearable. Mainly the buses and diesel delivery trucks making the majority of the noise during the day.

At night about 11-12, there is some local yahoo that has a unmufflered vehicle that comes screaming through resonating off the hotel and neighboring buildings.

While this is out of the hotels control, any perspective booker needs to know this stuff.

Only other complaints is to expect and pay a mint of $40 a day for the luxury of parking your vehicle there. Do not expect valet service for that $40 either.

Hotel is nice and clean and services are slightly better than an average HI. Expect some language barriers at times with the front desk staff as they have hispanic and Asian immigrants who speak English as a second language.

Did watch a door person act like a tool when a British lady asked for help getting a cap and help with her bags getting loaded. The door guy acted put off and eventually hailed a cap for her but just flat out ignored helping the lady load her luggage.

review.title: fall back hotel
review.reviewText: visit in early march 2012. in SF on business (i visit monthly for 5 days/month). low availability of the 4 start + hotels i usually stay at in SF. Pros: clean, price reasonable, nearby restaruants good. Cons: distance from downtown, thin walls (i could hear my next door neighbor talking on his cells phone - and the person on the other end of the phone- as at 5 am if he was in my room), no frills.
review.negativeRemarks: thin walls, neighbor noise
review.locationRemarks: too far from downtown but nearby restaruants ok.

review.title: Quick trip!!
review.reviewText: I had an excellent time on this trip! This hotel was in an excellent location. It is literally walking distance from fisherman's wharf which was quite convient. It also appeared to be very clean and well kept. Our room was very nice and bed was very comfy. The bathroom was kind of small however. We also had a little bit of trouble with the ac/heater in our room. Sometimes we would put it on ac and heat would blow out and viversa. We also were not pleased we had to pay about 45 dollars to park the car for one night. And lastly they screwed up our bill when we were leaving. They almost charged us an extra $190 but on a brighter note they were very good about fixing it after I almost had a heart attack!! The good points of the hotel were the wifi they offered and they also had a business center of computers you could use if needed. They also had a restuarant down stairs which was pretty good food and not too bad of a price. Over all I would probably stay there again due to the excellent location!

review.title: Great Place to stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Very clean and close to where we wanted to be. It was even better cause we got a free upgrade.

review.title: I'd go back for second's
review.reviewText:
From the moment we walked in the front door we were greeted with warmth, from the desk clerk to the Concierge and you must try them for breakfast as you'll go back for a second helping plus. I enjoyed the workout room and the first floor pool as well.
For convenience and location the Wharf is right at your front door and I recommend it and would go back on my next visit.
Thanks to Expedia for giving me the best deal in town.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't have one
review.locationRemarks: it's just steps from the Wharf

review.title: Good location, clean and comfortable rooms....but
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and room was comfortable for the price point. We experienced two major drawbacks from our visit. One was out of the hotel's control where it was impossible to sleep on a Friday night as the noise and commotion outside from people partying was unbearable. The second drawback is most definitely within the hotel's control. The attitude and demeanor of the wait staff in the restaurant and lounge area at night left a lot to be desired. Most of the employees seemed indifferent at best, and some even seemed taken aback that a customer wanted service. On a similar note, it definitely seems that the front desk is under staffed a lot of the time. I attempted to call the fromnt desk from my room a couple times, but no one would pick up. I even let it ring for over five minutes one time. These are some service points that I think the hotel staff can improve. Overall, the hotel is well located, clean and safe and is an pretty good recommendation for anyone's visit to San Francisco.

review.title: holiday inn san francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok but for a holiday Inn I would have expected a little more. The bed was definately in need of an upgrade and there was some black mold in the shower. the rest of the room was fairly clean.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved that it had coffee service available downstairs starting at 6am.
review.negativeRemarks: The room really wasn't up the the standards I usually see in a Holiday Inn.
review.locationRemarks: It was a quiet location and had restaurants close by within walking distance.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: They were very helpful on where to go to eat and gave us maps on how to get there.
review.negativeRemarks: small selection on the food menu
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to get around for all the hot spots, fisherman wharf, little Italy, Chinatown

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great Location..... Older Hotel, could use an upgrade on the beds and TV

review.title: GOOD
review.reviewText: GOOD -- BUT DIDNT LIKE WALKING IN THE RAIN TO BUILDING #3 FROM THE MAIN BUILDING

review.title: Pleasant holiday experience
