review.reviewText: The only downside was having a room in the annexe. Would have preferred to be informed of this at time of booking.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and access to Fishermans Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: room in the annexe away from main hotel

review.title: lovely and clean but noisy
review.reviewText:
this hotel is great to stay at but the only problem is the trains right behind the hotel,the tracks are directly behind it and I could see them out my window,,,every half hour the amtrak train would come pass blasting its horn and not just once..it continued to do it all the way along the track..and the horn is like a ships horn so very loud that you can actually feel the vibration of it and the whole hotel shakes from the train going past.
Its a shame about this as the hotel is very nice to stay in
review.negativeRemarks: the trains at the back of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: only a ten minute walk to downtown san diego

review.title: nice room
review.reviewText:
Good location in Fisherman's wharf. Clean room and spacious. the building is not so pleasant.
Satisfied

review.title: Noisy room
review.reviewText: We have stayed here before but this time we arrived late in the evening and were put in room 202 a good sized room which is on the corner at the front of the main building near the Denny's. It was a bit noisy with traffic mainly buses pulling up early in the morning. The curtains at the window left gaps and I didn't feel comfortable with this so I had to use a chair to pull them accross more. The room was grubby and needed redecorating although the shower was excellent nice and hot and powerful. $40 to park the car each day was excessive.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is in great location for Pier 39, Cable Cars and within walkong distance of China Town and Golden Gate Bridge if you are fit.

review.title: v
review.reviewText: The hotel was a good hotel. I had a good time there.

review.title: Great Place to Stay!!
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was very helpful, hotel was clean, rooms were good. would receommend close to everything.

review.title: Love the city but not the Holiday Inn

We stayed there for 8 days .
service is very low and quite rude sometimes , you can tell that this people don t like their job there and dont care about guets
restaurant is quite bad cooking , they get very little business at night
no atmosphere at all !
breakfast buffet is very expensive for such a low quality food , nothing is eadible if you care about what u put in your stomach !
the location is great though .
review.negativeRemarks: rudeness of employees
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
Like the location of the hotel and Fisherman's Wharf.
Felt very safe around the hotel's location.
Staff took care of our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: Lady working coffee counter spent more time talking to other staff than taking care of customers. She did not meet or exceed my expectations.
review.locationRemarks: Good safe location to walk day or night

review.title: Vaule for money

In all the hotel experience was a good one,,Clean tide hotel withing a good location..
I wouldnt put anyone off staying here.....

There was quite a bit of noise from people back and fore during the night
review.locationRemarks:
withing walking distance of all your fav things to do....Alcatraz tour just down the road.
fishermans wharf just 50m away..right amonst all the shops

review.title: Garbage!
review.reviewText: Garbage!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Excellent location and quite affordable. The hotel staff was very helpful and pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: We stayed on the first floor, you could just walk out of your room to the street without going throgh lobbies and elevators.

review.title: We just like being near the Wharf
review.reviewText: Finding the gum wrapper in between what looked like slept in sheets wasn't a good start. The view of another building and just off the elevator near the ice machine wasn't too special either. On the latter, I should've gone back to the desk and asked for one better. I usually do....

review.title: Great location but ask for a quiet room
review.reviewText: The hotel is great and the front desk personnel is very helpful though parking $45 a night after tax. Nearby there are garages where you can park for $32. The hotel is in a great condition, no hotel smell, lobby is nice, and the restaurants of Fisherman Wharf are right around the corner. The neighborhood is great - pleasant for a walk even late at night. The hotel is in the noisy neighborhood, so I asked for a quiet room. I got one on the second floor facing a wall of some other building (no view but no noise). However, I got the room with the connecting door and the guests next door partied late into the night. I called the front desk to ask for another room, they were not able to change the room but offered to send security to the room next door to break up a party.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman Wharf - great food. Also get a bus tour around the city if the weather is great and you have seniors or kids with you. The best Italian food in 10-min walk away on Columbus street. Concierge has a free map with public transportation if you do not like to look for parking at each attraction. Golden Gate park is great but getting a taxi to get out of there is almost impossible - so go by car or plan for a trolley or bus ride.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: Nothing overly special, but nothing wrong with this hotel. I thought that the street noise was borderline loud, but i have high expectations in this regard.

review.title: Looking forward to going back
review.reviewText: This is my 4th time staying at this hotel. I absolutely love it. It is very clean, staff is friendly, location is perfect. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking to experience the heart of San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Good location for the nearby cable car routes. Buy a daily / multi day ticket and you can ride as much as you like & save on the usual $6 one way charge. Lots of good local cafes to eat at rather than the hotel

review.title: Well located, comfortable and clean.
review.reviewText: Excellent location to visit all the Fishermans Wharf attractions, stores and restaurants. The neighborhood is safe and quite. The hotel is so comfortable and clean that we will reserve there next time we visit SFO.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf and Union Square are the two areas with more attractions, restaurants and stores.

review.title: Decent Budget Choice
review.reviewText: We arreved late and got the "scenic" 5th floor corner room that overlooked the wharf. Room smelled like vomit and the room was the extremely noisy. Staff was very helpful and we were reassigned to a room that faced into the courtyard. This room was quiet and comfortable. Enjoyed the stay after changing rooms and staff was helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Try Cioppino's restaurant. On the Wharf but not a tourist trap.

review.title: Just a few feet away from Fisherman's Wharf - my kids loved it
review.reviewText: Convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, parking underneath convenient. Good location, room clean, quietier than I expected. Overall, good hotel for families or people who don't want to spend an arm and a leg but stay in a nice, convenient place.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Golden Gate Park, Marin County

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, within walking distance to most Wharf attraction, clean and comfortable room.
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf area

review.title: reasonably priced for what you get
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and staff was courteous. The hotel itself could use some updating. In the mornings, the whole hotel smelled of bacon and eggs. The air could me more controlled. Restaurant menu was limited and incredibly expensive! There was nothing gourmet about the food. Room is outdated but liked the fact they used white sheets and blankets so dirt can never be hidden. You knew they were clean.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermann's wharf. It is very central!

review.title: Good hotel with great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was what I expected a Holiday Inn to be like - not too extravagant but clean. It is located right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf so it is very convenient to restaurants, Pier 39, Lombard Street. The only concern I wanted to express was that you really could hear the noise on the street below. I'm not sure what type of windows they use, but you could hear people partying in the street below......sleep at times was difficult.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf area is a nice area to stay in - downtown San Francisco was a little rough.

review.title: Close to everything!!!
review.reviewText: My only complaint is $40.00 per day for parking. Great location (1 short block from fishermans warf and a 15 minute walk to little Itally) clean rooms and friendly, helpfull employees. A truly good experience...except for $40.00 a day for parking.

review.title: Great location to Pier 39 where all the action is
review.reviewText: Great location, 5 min walk to Pier 39 maybe 15 min walk to Pier 33 for Alcatraz tour, bus stop out the front. Food in the restaurant was really nice.
review.locationRemarks: The whole place was safe - we walked at night and had no problems - bus tours are around the corner, Pier 39 where all the action happens - shopping, restaurants etc. Catch a cable car - great experience - into town and do a bit of shopping and exploring - we loved San Francisco

review.title: Noisy at morning
review.reviewText: We stayed at first floor room. Every morning, I woke up around 5 am by big noisy sound from outside (I guess it was trash or garbage). Very disturbed.

review.title: Great first Trip
review.reviewText: Perfect location in center of everything!

review.title: Not impressed at all!
review.reviewText: Apart from the location of the hotel, which is quite convenient to Pier 39, the hotel itself was lousy. Right from when we checked in it seemed like our room had been given away to someone else and they had to 'find us' a room. This room #263 was right above the airconditioning plant which you heard all night and directly across the street from the pub "The Cannery" very loud patrons at 2 & 3 AM! With a 9 & 11 yo not much sleep was had. Darkened curtains had lots of holes in them, letting in light - didn't matter that much as we were awake from the pub and airconditioning noise. The advertised "free' buffet didnot include the kids - they had to eat off of a very limited menu for it to be free. Finally the laundry only opens at 8.30am so for those of us that wanted to see the sights you had to forgo them so you could have clean clothes. The laundry shut and was locked at 10.30pm - even though it was in the underground basement. Didn't matter though there was only 3 washers and three dryers to go around anyway!! None of the Conceirges were really interested in helping us to busy reading the new on their laptops. Was told there was no chance to hire a car as a convention was in town and they wouldn't ring anyone. We rang a car hire place direct and got one straight away. Says it all. Wouldn't bother if I were you.

review.title: Had to drag my luggage for 2 blocks.
review.reviewText: This Holiday Inn has 2 buildings. You check in at one, but if you're staying in the other, you must drag your luggage the two blocks to get there. Also, if you need directions or suggestions, you must return to the main building to talk to someone. There is very little parking so again you must walk to the main building to retrieve your car. The hotel was clean and nice and right on the Wharf for easy dining and shopping. Access to the cable cars was only a few blocks away, but dragging my luggage 2 blocks was definitely wierd.

review.title: Nice Room for a 3 Star Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleasantly surprised with our room at the Holiday Inn. We chose the hotel because it had a guest laundry and were not expecting too much from the room, but it was large, nicely decorated and clean.

review.title: worked well
review.reviewText: This hotel was located just off the wharf so you were not so close as to be in the busy area, it was close enough for a very short walk to everything. Thought it maybe priced a little high, paid the same price as Waldorf Astoria in New York.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
My mom, sister and I stayed at the Holiday Inn, Fisherman's Warf for 4 nights. We stayed at the Beach street building, not the main building. Denny's was in the lobby of our hotel, convenient for coffee in the morning.

The room was fine, the beds were very comfortable and pillows too. The maids did a very basic cleanup daily but could've done a little better. It would've been nice to have a small fridge in the room for bottled water and the wine you may pick up on a Sonoma wine tour.

The location is great if you're planning on taking tour busses through gray line tours because they pick up at the piers there on Fisherman's Warf. The F line is right outside the hotel for convenient street car rides to ans from several areas of San Fran. We also took the city bus which was easy to figure out.

The one complaint I had was at the end of our trip the front desk clerk told us to take a taxi to the airport becase it was faster and she said it would cost $45.00. It ended up costing $65.00 and the driver was nuts. I would definately suggest taking the Airport Express shuttle service. Its only $17.00 per person. So don't always take the advise of the hotel front desk clerk, they steered us in the wrong direction :(

review.title: Good place for a family stay
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay - the place and the location was perfect.
Parking charges unreasonable

review.title: Nice but a bit pricey especially the food
review.reviewText: We stayed for a few days at the start of a road trip and are reasonably familiar with the area which is why we chose the Holiday Inn. I can recommend going about ten minutes up Columbus avenue to find some good local bars and restaurants

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: We were not in the main hotel, but put in annex in the next street. Otherwise the Hotel was in a good location and was reasonable for the price.

review.title: expensive
review.reviewText: Parking and breakfast should be included in high price

review.title: very good budget hotel, clean and convenient location.
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a budget stay in SFO.

review.title: Would love to stay there again
review.reviewText: Great hotel, location and service.

review.title: "Excellent location"
review.reviewText: Easy access to tourist attractions, walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, and to many restaurants in the area.

review.title: Too much noise
review.reviewText: The room we were placed in faced an alley and another builiding. The air conditioner for the other building in the alley was so loud that when it went on it was impossible to talk, hear the tv or sleep in our hotel room. The front desk was well aware of the problem and refused to allow us to change rooms and did notthing but make excuses, saying there was nothing they could do about the noise. Upon talking to other guests who had the rooms near our room, the front desk appeared to be placing only Expedia customers in these noisy rooms that faced the alley and saving the quiet rooms for other guests who book directly with Holiday Inn or paid higher prices. If you want to stay at this hotel, do not book it through Expedia or you will likely get a noisy room. Book it directly or stay somehwhere else.

review.title: question the parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice-too bad they have to gouge a person to park a car -unfortunately they do not want a specific rate mentioned but it was a bit excessive to park a car per night. a night -especially since the lot was not full. Maybe charge less amount and they could have more patrons. It is ridiculous to charge a paying customer that kind of money to park a rental car-no matter if they are there for business or pleasure. There must be other hotels around that don't take advantage of their clients in this manner. The hotel was OK but this excess charge did not sit well.

review.title: Centrally located on the Wharf.
review.reviewText: Wonderful city. The Holiday Inn was centrally located, and within easy walking distance to all activites on Fisherman's Wharf. If you book a tour, most tours will pick you up at the front door.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfectly located within walking distance of pretty much everything including public transporation. For the price and location, a perfect choice.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText:
If you were to rate this hotel on location alone it would score a perfect 10. Alas, it is one of the few positive aspects of our 3 night stay at this hotel.

Good points:
- Reception staff when we arrived were fantastic. We were early and they organised for our parking so we could explore the area and not worry about the car or our luggage.
- Location is one block back from the main esplanade at Fisherman's Wharf, about 100m from the cable car turn-around.

Bad Points:
- Incredibly rude security & reception staff at night
- Laundry locked at 10pm (even if you are in the middle of a load)
- Ground floor rooms have an external access door to a publicly accessible alley between building wings which is a bit of a security concern
- Parking is extremely expensive
- Rooms have only one available power point (outside the bathroom) and in a room that sleeps 4 people there was one chair which is really inconvenient.
- Internet is slow
- Dining options are limited in the hotel
- There were no towels at the pool area even after requesting them from reception

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: old carpets and odd smell in the room. No fridge and really noisy AC. We paid too much and was absolutely not worth it.

review.title: OLD Hotel...$40 to park a car? Buffett for $25 for Army food....
review.reviewText: Hotel Sucks

review.title: San Fransico
review.reviewText: Great location--close to all major attractions--Staff more than helpful-Would recommend to all------------

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: our visit's purpose was to see as much of San Fran as we could, and this hotel's location was perfect! We could walk almost everywhere, the cable car was nearby, had a great time. The only issue we noticed was that the traffic outside was loud if your room was facing the street, thankfully we had a room that was not, but our travel mates were unfortunate to have a room that was on the loud side at times.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Very good location - slightly worn but certainly acceptable - cheapest in area - gym and pool very small and basic - stayed for 5 days and found it perfect fro our needs.

review.title: Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: A good hotel in prime location for many of San Fran's attractions. This hotel is spread over 2 buildings. Denny's restaurant on site. Gym has some running machines and a few free weights. There is a swimming pool. Free pc access on 3rd floor. Cable car pick up point round the corner. Fantastic city with a laid back atmosphere.

review.title: Excellent spot in the Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Overall, I've been extremely satisfied by my experience at the Fisherman's Wharf's Holiday Inn.

The room was small, but great. The service was particularly good, the room were well kept and the concierge gave us great advices.

I have one regret about my choice, though. San Francisco is expensive. Very expensive. I would have appreciated having a mini fridge and included breakfast. The breakfast at the hotel's restaurant was both expensive and ordinary, but I've been told the breakfast included at the Holiday Inn Express is good, and it's just across the street.

So if you want to save a few bucks by having a fridge and included breakfast, go for the Holiday Inn Express.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We stayed here for our anniversary and can't complain...everything was great!

review.title: very nice location
review.reviewText:
i liked everything about this hotel except the front desk woman. she was not friendly. she answered your questions, made no suggestions and did not go out of her way to be helpful. we were in the jones street annex. it was a pain to walk from the main front desk out to the sidewalk, with our suitcases, over to the annex. no one offered to help. but once in the annex, we were very pleased.
it was quiet, the housekeepers were friendly, helpful, kept the shampoo and soap stocked. i would stay at the jones street annex every time.

review.title: Enjoyable place for an affordable last minute get away....
review.reviewText: For a last minute decision weekend getaway it was well worth it's price. There was a restaurant adjacent to the hotel that was decent for late night munchies; nice quiet hotel bar/restaurant. Within extremely easy walking distance to the wharf itself. Absolutely no complaints. I would stay there again.

review.title: Great location ... but don't sleep-in
review.reviewText: Great location so close to the wharf and all the attractions. Right near the hop-on hop-off bus. Secure parking. Clean, comfortable well appointed rooms and very nice friendly staff. Breakfast as nice. Quiet during the night. But our room back on to the alleyway, noise from trucks, utilities and a couple of harley motorbikes every moring at 7am was annoying. Overall I recommend the Holiday Inn. I'd stay again but don't expect a sleep-in

review.title: San Francisco Girl Friends trip
review.reviewText: This Hotel was in a great location, with in walking distance to the wharf. I would go back to this location on any future visits.

review.title: Excellent choice of hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was clean. Excellent service. I would go back again next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: San fran trip
review.reviewText: Excellent accommodations

review.title: Very Clean and Comfortable!
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable!

review.title: The last place you dream of staying on your honeymoon.
review.reviewText:
Sadly, this was the last hotel we stayed at on our honeymoon, I wish it was not. We honeymooned in San Fran, drove to Santa Cruz, Big Sur and then back up to San Fran. Every hotel was absolutely fantastic, except for this one. The Holiday Inn Civic center wasn't very good, but it was sure better than this Holiday Inn. We stayed at a total of 4 different Holiday Inn hotels on the trip and this one was by far the worst.

After driving in from Big Sur that day (over 4 hours) we checked into our room only to find someone elses luggage in the room. The other fun part was that there were two double beds in the room as well, even when we mentioned that this was our honeymoon. After trekking back to the lobby through the danky halls which reminded us of an aging hospital corridor, we were given a new room.

Yes we were happy to find a king bed, but no, we were not happy to find nasty hair, only 1 outlet, dingy lighting, and furniture that was broken/haphazardly arranged. The stay was barely okay.

To top it all off, we were quite disturbed by the hotel staff's response when a lady fainted in line while we were checking in. They did not call the paramedics, but instead insisted that she make the decision, even though she was extremely worried and completely disoriented.

There are far better hotels to stay at in San Francisco, the other ones we visited were in Union Square and the Holiday Inn Express in the Civic Center.

Retuning? No thank you.

review.title: Will book here again.
review.reviewText: Great location and great views...would return easy access to all the shoping and dining and entertainment.:)

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Can't say enough about how perfect of a location this hotel is in. Within walking distance to the piers, and tons of shops and restaurants, while still being far enough away from the busy areas to still feel relaxing. Hotel was clean and well maintained, and the staff were nice. It was too cold to swim in the pool while we were there, but it looked decent. Didnt love the food at the hotel restaurant, but we may have just ordered the wrong things. Would stay here again just for the location and price.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Only one block from the wharf.

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and the location is great. But the room was not as clean as it should have been.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Excellent Location. Simple but clean, roomy and comfortable accommodations. Good service.

review.title: Would go back in off season and at the right price
review.reviewText: For a tourist it was an excellent location. A bit of noise with our room facing Fisherman's Wharf but what do you expect from being a block from the tourist attraction. Service was excellent. Might be a bit pricey in the peak tourist season but for an off season visit to San Fran, a clean, friendly, and conveniently located hotel

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Right in the centre of fisherman's wharf. Easy walk to attractions. Close to cable car for a ride downtown.
Decore slightly dated but comfortable. Staff helpful.

review.title: No complaints, but be aware of the split location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in two buildings. We were located in the secondary building. To access the concierge and to check out, there were limited hours that required walking around the block to the main location. The room was clean and modern. The location was great, right on the F trolley line connecting to BART and the Piers. The Piers were within walking distance along with little Italy and Chinatown. A touristy area, but a great location for our needs.

review.title: Wish we'd had more time
review.reviewText: See above

review.title: It was a fun experience for the most part.
review.reviewText: The staff was more than willing to help my fiance and I with any questions we had, and when our car battery went dead the everyone was so nice and helpfull.

review.title: highly recommend
review.reviewText: This hotel served our needs perfectly. We attended an international conference and we could go to and from the conference easily and inexpensively. The cable cars and trolly were a quickly 3 blocks away and we loved riding them to our conference and in the evenings. The hotel staff was pleasant; we only used the hotel restaurant once for breakfast and it was ridiculously overpriced; however, the service was superior. A great place and we would stay again!

review.title: It all true San Francisco and the Hoilday Inn were all beautiful and friendly
review.reviewText: Clean Hotel close to everything...good food and friendly staff..

review.title: Great place to stay busy, your never bored
review.reviewText: This location was the perfect getaway for people who like to stay busy, you never run out of things to see and do, there is alot of history to the city and the buildings are beautiful. Seeing alcatraz was the highlight of our trip and the audio tour narrated by the inmates that used to stay there was awesome.

review.title: The Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is located within a few blocks of the Wharf. The hotel and staff was very nice. The concierge was very helpful with recommending restaurants for dinner. The hotel was in walking distance to China town, Little Italy and Fisherman's Wharf. The desk allowed us to check in early upon our arrival. The only bad experience was the noise from the local bars. If you're a light sleeper stay towards the center of the hotel. Do not sleep by the west side of the hotel. Too many bars and loud noise. I could hear the loud conversations outside. My wife was't bothered, but I hard a very hard time sleeping. I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Not fancy, but well located.
review.reviewText: I did not expect to pay so much for parking. Also, the rooms are probably overdue for a makeover. There were many wear spots on the walls where the wallpaper had been cleaned repeatedly. The breakfast buffet was more than $20 per day. The extra cost of breakfast and parking need to be considered when comparing prices.

review.title: Best hotel near the wharf for such a low price
review.reviewText:
This was one of our top trips that me and my girlfriend have taken together, during this trip I asked her to marry me at the Palace of Fine Arts and she said YES!!!

The Holiday Inn at the wharf has the perfect place to stay for a romantic weekend.

review.title: Best journey ever.
review.reviewText: It was awesome. Hotel met all our expectations. We got exelent location and very nice room for very good price. I would say thank you for hotel's staff and Expedia's users for extremly high service and good advices. Warm regards, Anton.

review.title: I don't really want to hear what's going on in the next room
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a really good location, super close to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and Alcatraz. One hold up with this hotel is there is a chance that u get a room in their other building which is a block away. It is such as hassle to park in their garage which is in the main building and wAlk with your luggage to your room. Also, walls are thin so you can actually hear your next door neighbor.

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and the rooms were fine. However, there are multiple buildings for the rooms. The parking structure was located at the main building only. The other buildlings are located a block away with no valet. The shuttle from the main building to the other buildings does not run 24 hrs. Not a bad walk unless it's raining (which it was.) Also, the temporary parking at the other building was full inspite of the fact that there was no one in the lobby. The same cars were there the entire day and the hotel did nothing about it. (I guess those guests were pretty disappointed with the parkiing too.) There are several other hotels located, literally, accross the street. Although we didn't hate our stay, we wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful. All major activities and sights were within walking distance of the hotel. We'll stay there again next time we go.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location of the hotel and the Dennys restaurant downstairs is great.

review.title: Awesome Hotel Overall!!
review.reviewText: I was put in a room that was not accomadating to me and they were happy to put me in another room!!! They were friendly and understanding about the situation which makes me love this hotel!!! Holiday Inn is 100% awesome awesome awesome!!!!! :)

review.title: The Best Time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was a very positive experience. It was centrally located so we could do everything we wanted to do (i.e. The Bridge, Alcatraz, Fisherman's Warf, Little Italy, etc...) . They also gave great directions to the 49ers game.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This was in the best location for us. It was easy to walk around( very flat ) it was close to all the tour buses ect. It was close to the cable car station and a 2 minute walk to Fishamans Wharf . We felt very safe here and the The hotel was helpful in organising trips ect: and it has a good laundry with 3 washers and 3 dryers. The down side was parking is expensive so we droped our car in when we got to San Fransico and picked up another one when we left as both Hertz and Avis is just around the corner ( you don't need a car if you stay here) and the restaraunt was expensive for breakfast but a short walk you will find many places for a good cheap breakfast. I would highly recomend this hotel on our experience

review.title: Excelent location !
review.reviewText: This is older hotel but in good condition, room was clean .

review.title: Great location. Good hotel, except for one thing. But I'd go back.
review.reviewText: The best thing about this place is the location, so close to the wharf! It's so easy to get around from there. We flew into San Francisco and were debating on whether to get a car or not. Parking everywhere is difficult/expensive. (Especially at the hotel!) On that note, public transportation was the way to go! We got there probably around 1pm. Our flight landed at 11:45. Check in time wasn't until 3, so they let us keep our bags there until our room was ready, which was nice. They also let us keep it there after we checked out, since our flight wasn't until later in the evening. Now, if you're expecting a 5-star hotel experience, don't come here! It's really for people not spending much time in their room. Very spacioius, nice king bed, nothing special. Although we were on the priority floor. All is good except for one thing. On our first night's stay we were laying down in our bed, and noticed some red spots on our sheets. (Gross, it looked like blood) We went down to the front desk and asked them to change the sheets. They said: "Is it alright if I leave them on the bed, and you can make the bed?" What was i supposed to say? No!? I said sure. There was no apology. AND they brought the wrong sheets. The next morning we decided to make it obvious that the wrong sheets were on the bed, and room service would notice and change them. Sure enough, they did. We were finally happy campers.

review.title: 2nd Time Stay
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for walking to restaurants and attractions. We were very pleased that the hotel waived the parking fee one night while we took a side trip.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay there again. Check in was quick, and staff friendly. Room was large and clean, although walls were on the thin side. Location was great-can walk to a lot of sites and electric trolleys are across the street which go downtown. As well there are 3 car rental agencies within a block or two of the hotel. The hotel has 2 buildings, and we were in the second one which is about 1/2 a block from the main one. Took a drive to Napa Valley which was easy to get to from the hotel.

review.title: Mixed feelings
review.reviewText: Requesting a quite location meant that we were allocated a room in the Beach Road site, which is opposite the main hotel. The initial greeting was that of stale cooking oil from the "Denny's" fast food franchhise located in the lobby. Location is excellent for a tourist but the general cleanliness of the room was poor especially having seen the room maid spending 3 hours "servicing" 1 room!

review.title: Wonderful Location - Cleand and Quiet
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was fabulous for checking out the city highlights - walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach and, of course, Fisherman's Wharf. It was clean and quiet and the staff was very friendly. Our room was in the annex building (I might have prefered the main building), but it was easy to come and go, not too crowded. I would definately recommend the hotel to people traveling with children.

review.title: can't wait to go back. Vey impressed with location and hotel.
review.reviewText:
We want to go back and we will be staying at the same hotel.
Walking distance to the Wharf, Cable Car. Area was ok, felt safe at all times.
We felt that San Francisco is a lovely place.

review.title: Comfortable hotel for Wharf Area.
review.reviewText: Parking costs were $39.00 per day!!! Too much!!!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and convenient to many attractions. I would stay again if I did not need to park, the parking was expensive and I would probably shop around to find a less expensive parking situation.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel. The rooms are clean and the staff was very friendly. The location is unbeatable!

review.title: Our S.F. Giants Hotel!
review.reviewText:
We will come back here again, and again! we love this hotel! This is our 4th time staying here and love it! We even found out one of the Giants players was staying there (darn would have loved to seen him).

Great hotel, staff, location!!! THANK YOU

review.title: I would stay again
review.reviewText: I would stay again.the parking is very very very expensive.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: loved it

review.title: Great Hotel Experience - Holiday Inn-Fisherman's Whaf
review.reviewText:
The Holiday Inn-Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco was great.

Convenient location - on the western side of Fisherman's Wharf (one block east of Ghirardelli Square, two blocks east of the north end of the Powell-Hyde cable car line, about 5 blocks west of Pier 39).

Service - our room was always tidied when we returned (we generally left by 8 am and would return early afternoon). The cleaning staff restocked the supplies (ie. soap, lotion, shampoo, coffee) every day - in fact, we couldn't keep up with all the soap and coffee they left. We did have to request additional tea though.

Room amendities - there was an in-room safe (at no charge). Our room had two double beds, a desk, a dresser, a TV, and a one-cup coffee/tea maker. There was no mini-bar (does anyone really use them anyways?), though mini-fridges could be rented for an additional charge. There wasn't a microwave.

Cost - no issue with price, seemed to be comparable to other hotels in the area. Holiday Inn-Express had a free continental breakfast, but we couldn't get a room with two double beds without paying extra. There was a small charge for local calls.

Hotel amendities - outdoor pool, a kiosk for printing airline boarding passes, free wireless, 24-hr business center, and an onsite restaurant (which we did not try).

I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
- Convenient access to the Wharfs and other city attractions
- Close to the action but still quiet
- Would definitely go back

review.title: Good hotel for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: After touring many sites inland in California, it was good to get the buzz of San Francisco again, where there was plenty of people milling around.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is a clean, comfortable hotel in a great location with reasonable rates. We were able to walk to all of the sights in the Fisherman's Wharf area. The sightseeing tour departure site is just a block away which allowed us to catch a double decker bus and see the landmarks in other parts of the city. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone going to San Francisco.

review.title: Vicki
review.reviewText: We had stayed at the Holiday Inn 4 years ago, however we were put in a different building just arround the corner. The problem we encountered was that at night the room was very noisey, if it wasn't from the street, it was a very loud air conditioning unit in the room.

review.title: Well worth the very reasonable price!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location! Extremely helpful staff and concierge. Will always use this as my SF hotel when wanting to do the "tourist" thing.

review.title: "Great Location" in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf - San Fransisco
review.reviewText:
This hotel has a great location to fisherman's wharf, and surrounding tourist attractions. Cable Car access within walking distance, and hotel easy to find
if driving. Disappointment was there is no continental breakfast included in the stay, and the restaurant is very expensive within the hotel. There is a
Starbucks close by around the corner though. The parking is quite expensive as well. The rooms were very satisfactory and clean, as well as a good size. All in all I would definitely book this hotel if vacationing in San Fran again.

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Several attractions including Alcatraz tour and pier 39 are within walking distance. Street car station 2 blocks away which will take you across San Francisco towards golden gate park. Hotel parking is difficult as is having a rental car in this city. Try and reserve a room in the main building. If not you will have to park in the underground garage and walk a block to the second building, but it's not a long walk. The hotel has a dennys resturant, but its expensive and gets packed on weekend mornings. If you are staying at least a week you don't need a rental car. A taxi round trip from the airport is about $90 and you can take public transport from there. If you are only staying a few nights a rental car is a must to be able to see everything. Be prepared to figure out the parking signs because parking is scarce and difficult.

review.title: Best location.
review.reviewText: Location was very nice. I like the fact the hotel parking allow you to park until 6pm the next day.

review.title: will give it another try when we go back to San Francisco
review.reviewText: SEE ABOVE

review.title: Happy choice
review.reviewText: I picked the hotel after quite a bit of intenet review searching, and though there were a few negative reviews, they were mostly good, the location seemed good, and the price was great! We (Two 50-ish ladies and our 11 year old daughters) loved being walking distance to almost everything, including breakfast and bike rentals, the wharf, and cable cars. I was pleasantly surprised at the absence of the usual hotel annoyances (air conditioner rattles, thin walls, bad smells, bad water, etc.). It was a bit of a walk from our room to elevator to lobby, but not a problem, and the elevators were always quick. The bathroom could have been bigger, but with the price and location, it was a great deal! We all enjoyed it, and would recommend to all! 2 other tips -- get your tickets a week early to Alcatraz, and get the all inclusive bus/cable car pass -- definitely well worth it!

review.title: Perfect location for San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was located in the heart of the Wharf -close to everything, reasonable, comfortable and clean.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location and great value compared with other Wharf hotels. We would stay there again, even though we booked a room with two double beds and they gave us a King. Our kids slept on a pull out couch. The room was smaller than other hotels, with a smaller bathroom sink, but overall a good visit.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. It is conveniently located near restaurants, shops, site-seeing areas, bus and cable cars. We didn't need our car while visiting.

review.title: San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel--could use a bit more help checking in. Only one person was working and there was quite a long line.

review.title: good but...
review.reviewText: They have two buildings, and at first it wasn't a big deal until we had to walk a block back and forth several times. Parking and the main desk were a block away. Nice hotel and GREAT location but very annoying. Plus house keeping came at 8 am on the Sunday morning! 4 hours before check out on a vacation! Will not stay again.

review.title: Close to everything important
review.reviewText: Very neat, very simple and surprisingly comfortable. The hotel is placed where you can go anywhere in the city with the public transports (tramway, cable cars and buses).

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location - walking to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, street cars, shopping, etc. Clean room, polite staff - no complaints ... would definiately stay there again. The Denny's restaurant was very expensive, not good quality food (out of chicken nuggets, cold food, left off the bread, slow service) eat at the Wharf or Boudin's or any of the other great restaurants near by.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time! Location is unbeatable, 1 block from the water. Ghiradelli Square three blocks, North Beach easily accessible.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
This is not a palace but clean enough and conformable for the money you pay. a block away was a four start Hotel that would charge lot more money just because the area location. So if you're paying for location , why to pay more at other hotels.

Great Location, no doubt.

The downside is there was no fridge in room or they charge if you ask. a little inconvenient for families with small kids.

I will stay here at my next visit to San Francisco, for sure

review.title: Nice hotel - close to tourist area
review.reviewText: Nice, clean rooms. Make sure to ask for a fridge &/or microwave at check-in. Homeless people close to hotel make a lot of peculiar noises @ night. Close to Walgreen's, F-line street car & transit. Lots of restaurants & attractions nearby.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: This hotel is reasonably priced, in good condition, conveniently located to the wharf, and clean. I would get a room there again.

review.title: Can't get any closer to the Warf
review.reviewText: Great location!! AMAZING beds and pillows.

review.title: Thoughts on San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Hotel very adequate and breakfast service exemplary. Conveniently sited for Fisherman's Wharf, but disappointed by area - more tacky than on previous vists. Should possibly have opted for downtown. Cable cars still wonderful.

Sea fog a major problem in June - only one sunny day in four.

review.title: MGomez
review.reviewText: Location is great. But the elevators were down all week. The parking was about one block away and didn't always have a space after paying $40 per day. We had a truck that would not fit in the underground parking. The Denny's was pricey.

review.title: Great Hotel in the middle of all the excitment
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn at the Warf is clean, centered perfect for all you need to do in San Francisco, the Warf is one block away, pier 39 3 blocks, trolly 2 blocks, short walk to Little Italy and China Town, everything you want to see and experiance is just around the corner

review.title: Best location for Value and will stay here again!
review.reviewText:
At first I was really skeptical of this hotel since it was so far up North in San Francisco literally 8 minutes from Fishermans wharf. This Hotel is convieniently located to most of the tourist attractions mentioned in the SF city pass(a definite must have) except for the Palace of fine arts and the Califonia Academy of Sciences. Since my friend & I didn't rent a car(parking fees are expensive beware!) for this trip traveling to and back from the hotel was a breeze. There are 4 ways to return to this hotel using the Muni 30 or 47 bus which will pretty much drop you off at the door or the last stop of the F line streetcar in front of the Walgreens and it's a 4 min walk or the Powell & Hyde cable car last stop about 10 min walk.
The walgreens around the corner a definite plus easy access to decently priced Bottled water, fresh juice and pretty much anything you'll need. The staff kept the room clean everyday and when we asked for more toiletries we were given a ton of stuff enough for 4 people everyday and fresh towels to boot. The 24hr Denny's downstairs is a nice place for the late evening munchies since most restaurants close or stop serving food by 22:00. Safety in this hotel was great we were away from the homeless people and it was quiet at night.
I would totally recommend this hotel to friends and Family and the fact that the Boudin Bakery (open at 8am) is just minutes away to enjoy your 1st and defintely not last clam chowder bread bowl a major bonus! Cheers! ^_^

review.title: I've received better customer service
review.reviewText: After arriving at the hotel, I approached the front desk and was asked to wait while another staff member was going to check me in. While as that staff member walked away and never came back, two others where standing two feet away talking personally and joking. I waited for about 4 minutes before I was finally asked if someone was helping me. I stated that someone was suppose to, but they walked away and left me standing there.

review.title: rooms and service ok. parking & restaurant somewhat expensive
review.reviewText: the rooms were clean and nice, with no view worth mentioning. the desk personnel were nice, as were the restaurant staff. restaurant meals were a bit steep, although probably not by fishermens' wharf standards. covered parking, under the hotel, was about $20 a night, but probably not bad for the area, and certainly convenient.

review.title: Great Location, BUT...
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location and the parking available are very convenient. However, what they do not tell you is that there are two buildings the hotel is located in. The parking garage is located underneath the "main" building. Our room was located in the second building which meant we had to walk across the street to the main hotel and take the elevator to the parking garage to get to and from our car (not fun in the rain might I add). Another major downside to this hotel is that the windows are paper thin and you can hear ALL street noise...even with the AC on! I bought ear plugs after my first sleepless night and slept better from then on. All in all, good location, great price, but come prepared with ear plugs!

review.title: Best deal in the Wharf!
review.reviewText: Just a great deal close to everything ,clean,great price,denny's on site,what can i say ,,,book it!

review.title: Would definitely visit again!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a great location--easy to walk so many places and also easy to access highways to get to Napa and other places. The room was great, however, for the rate, a fridge would be nice--with food so expensive, leftovers, etc. We found out when checking out we could have paid more to have a fridge. The parking rate was really high, too.
The biggest advantage here was the concierges. Three different concierges helped us during our 6-day stay. They were all very helpful and gave easy to follow directions, great restaurant recommendations...really made out trip even better. Nito was exceptional. Very knowledgeable, professional and friendly. He greeted us and would ask how we liked something he suggested, too. Loved the city and the hotel!

review.title: Room a block away.
review.reviewText:
When checking into the hotel, they told us our room was in a seperate building a block away and we would have to walk there with our luggage. Luckily it was a nice sunny day. However, had it been raining, we would have been very upset.

I don't remember anything on the website stating that there is another building that we would have to carry our luggage to. No offer for a shuttle service.

review.title: Great Location, Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, it's within walking distance of all the main attractions on the wharf. Two blocks from the cable cars, two from the streetcars which can take you right downtown. Just a few blocks from Pier 39 and the Sea Lions. The hotel was clean and well maintained. Friendly staff, helpful concierge. We really had no complaints at all!

review.title: excellent spot to stay
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay. We walked upto Ghiradelli and Fisherman's Wharf, even to the piers.......saved on parking too.

review.title: really enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient for fisherman's warf and all the attractions. Cable car was a short walk away as was the tram stop.

review.title: Great location, terrible restaurant
review.reviewText: The location in Fisherman's Wharf was great. We were able to walk or ride the trolley everywhere and never drove our car during our stay. The hotel was nice, but the hotel reataurant was overpriced and the food was not even good.

review.title: Great memorable experience
review.reviewText: Wonderful time. Great hotel. Clean, convenient.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Being our first time there, we had no idea where to stay so we picked this hotel hoping it was a good one. Good choice it was really close to everything, kid friendly more than what I had expected. One down fall, the parking! When we checked in there was no parking in the hotel so we had to park in the street, luckily for us we found a parking behind the hotel where there was no meters so we parked for free for the entire weekend (lucky for us).

review.title: Will definately go back
review.reviewText: Great location close to the Wharf and also to transportation. Loved the fact that we could walk around and did not have to cab it every time.

review.title: Holiday Inn Stay @ SF
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is awesome. Walk distance to cable cars and main tourist attraction places. Hotel is not luxurious but very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Holiday Inn - stay out!
review.reviewText:
I will begin with the positive. The room was clean and the beds comfortable - these are the 2 most important qualities a hotel must have to most travelers.

What I did not perfer was the parking was located under the building with the smoking rooms and I was staying in the OTHER building where the non-smoking rooms were located. I guess the they figure the smokers would get out of breath if they had to walk to their cars. It would not have been so bad but it happened to be raining the weekend we were there and therefore it was an inconveninece. The other aspect I didnt' care for was the building we were staying in did not have a 24 hour receptionist nor did it have a business center (printing boarding passes). I will not stay ther again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: very helpful staff, prompt attention to help with a problem with the in-room safe, and cleaned up after I broke a coffee cup on the bathroom floor - silly small coffee maker barely fit on the counter

review.title: Good place to stay in Fishermans Wharf Area
review.reviewText: Clean & comfortable. Pool was warm and well maintained. Staff and concierge service was great. Hotel was conveniently close to street car, trolleys, busses and many restaurants. We stayed 5 nights and had no complaints other than a little too much street noise at times.

review.title: Main Building looks good second should not be a Holiday Inn
review.reviewText: The Hotel is in a great area. Holiday Inn should not charge guest a parking fee.They should also notify them when they will not actually be staying in the main Hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Overall it was a good hotel: clean, great location, friendly staff.
There are a few buts. There was no refrigerator, and we like to do a quick breakfast in our hotel room. We didn't check out the restaurant in our hotel, so I can give you no info on that.
Further: if you want to sleep in on Monday morning, make sure you don't have room 158 or any of the surrounding rooms. Room 158 is located directly above the hotels waste container and waste pickup is 6:30 am on Monday morning.
We had to get up early anyway, so for us it didn't matter.
Parking is very pricey, but since the location is so good we didn't need a car: we walked or used public transportation and a taxi from/to airport.
I would definitely recommend this hotel and when I go back to San Francisco I would love to stay there again.

review.title: Mike Adams
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic, situated right at the heart of fishermans wharf. The quality of the hotel is one of the best I have stayed at at that rating. Doiuble bed, clean and excellent facilities. Don't eat at the hotel though. Made the mistake on the first morning and was hit by a $50 bill for some toast and a croissant. Loads to do in the area, loads of restaurants and all in all an awesome experience

review.title: Location - Location - Location
review.reviewText: The internet was BAD very BAD

review.title: great hotel, wonderful staff
review.reviewText: i would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Holiday Inn-Great location at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
We had a great time. Spent only a small time actually walking around Fisherman's Wharf. But due to the Hotel's location, it was easy to find after returning from all different directions - from Yosemite, Napa, etc.

The hotel was very clean and service was great.

Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: This hotel location is very convenient for a shorterm traveling visitor to SF. Fisherman's Wharf is two blocks away. Two bus stops are down the street. Nice service attitude. Good place to stay.

review.title: Good times.
review.reviewText: The hotel had everything we needed. Close to everything, clean, free internet, flight check-in kiosk....ect And the price was very reasonable. I would definately stay there again.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The concierge was so friendly; he helped us get all around the city. There is a 24-hour Denny's in it which we went to more than once. It is right by the water and it is easy to get from there to all the sights. Nice rooms, friendly staff, great, great, great.

review.title: Great location-beware street side rooms
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco. The Holiday Inn was in an excellent location, just blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel was clean and up to date. Our only problem was that our room was on the street side and very noisy. Even though we were on the 4th floor, we heard MUCH street noise (trucks, trash pick up) very early in the morning (beginning between 4-5am) which disturbed our sleep. I ended up buying ear plugs to use after 2 nights of this!

review.title: It was the best Hotel for the price :)
review.reviewText: the hotel was clean and comfortable. It was located right in the center of all the places that I wanted to see. Great place to stay...

review.title: good choice for an inexpensive vacation
review.reviewText: We got this hotel as part of a vacation package partnered with Virgin America. Overall the hotel met expectations. If you're in town for a touristy time it is the perfect location right next to Fisherman's Wharf with plenty of cable car and bus services nearby. The hotel staff was very friendly and informative.

review.title: Great Location and Value.
review.reviewText: It is well known that nothing is inexpensive in San Francisco, but the Holiday Inn was a great value. The location is convenient, the service good and the hotel is very well maintained and clean. I will stay there again!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location to the trolley, buses, and the wharf. The staff was very friendly and accommodated us very well. The rooms were nice and the beds were firm which is what I like.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Our stay in SF was great! The hotel was OK!

review.title: We'll be back
review.reviewText:
The hotel was accurately portrayed in the review/pics online. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location is excellent-within walking distance of many things and close to the public transportation for places too far.
My one complaint is that I called ahead to find out if they had a public computer and Internet service. I was told that they do and the hotel did have a computer, however, it was unusable.

review.title: a vacation of a lifetime
review.reviewText: our hotel was within walking distance to almost everything.the resturant had a fabulous buffet.very classy and comfortable.

review.title: Quite Impressed
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Holiday Inn was better than expected. We were very satisfied with our room and the location of the hotel. Everything was within walking distance. Though I must mention that our encounter with the concierge was not the greatest. He was very sarcastic and seemed miserable with his job. Other than that, I would recommend staying at the Holiday Inn - very affordable.

review.title: San Frans best Warf Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel

review.title: Good price, Good hotel
review.reviewText:
Overall we were fairly impressed with the hotel for the price we paid. We got a really good package so the price was very fair for the location.

We were unimpressed when we checked in at a very nice hotel and were then told to walk down the block to a seperate building where our hotel was! Overall the room was fairly clean although a few stray hairs on the bedding made me wonder if it had been changed. The door handle on the bathroom kept falling off. Also I have no idea why but we got put in a disabled room with accessible bathroom, I wasn't very impressed with this.

Apart from this the room was a really good size and had nice decor. I appreciated the small touches like the note in the bathroom offering COMPLIMENTARY toiletries such as razors, shampoo etc that you may have forgotten to pack.

Overall a good hotel for a good price.

review.title: We'll be back
review.reviewText:
Check in time is 3PM but we arrived at 9:30AM and the front dress was nice enough to let us check in. Several times we took advantage of their Concierge service whose friendly service was quite helpful with directions.
We asked for a refrigerator when we checked in and by the time we returned to the room after lunch, it was already in our room. When we had trouble printing our Boarding pass, a person was there to help us through it. We found all their staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: Road Trip 2010
review.reviewText: The hostess at the Front Desk was not very personable, and I didn't appreciate the $39 parking fee that I wasn't notified of until my credit card was already charged.

review.title: Not impressed, The staff was not very friendly, The parking price was very high.
review.reviewText: I would not stay here because of the parking and the staff was not very helpful or freindly. , It was too high and it should have been included in the price of the room,. It ws a big shock to realize that I had to pay out 138 dollars to park my rental car, It would have been different had I known this ahead of time and I could have planned for it.

review.title: Overall not bad, nice area
review.reviewText: Hotel over all was nice, food in area and at hotel was pricey...minor downside over all. Woudl I recomend the hotel, yes, nice location and clean, but I would suggest calling and checking on your reservation prior to arrival :o) Just to make sure you get the correct size bed you requested. Fisherman's Wharf area was a great experience, if you are a runner you have to get up in the morning and go for a run, amazing! Not crowded and very enjoyable! No bum's out begging for $$ at 6 am! Highly recomend researching on the local options for public transit, we didn't get a pass (wish we would have) we used public transit or walked where we wanted to go and one day rented a car down the road from Enterprise to go to Napa. Very nice trip!

review.title: Bring Ear Plugs
review.reviewText:
Bring ear plugs!!

Very Noisy Club across street in Cannery building If your room faces the Club expect to be kept awake from loud music, especially Friday and Saturday night.

review.title: I "heart" Holiday-Inn Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Good location, just a couple of blocks from the Fisherman's Wharf.
Safe, clean, nice people. We'll be my favorite place when visiting & staying in San Francisco.

Affordable price thru" Expedia.com account.

review.title: Best Location next to the Wharf
review.reviewText: The location was awesome. Convient to everything. Do not eat the hotel. Food not so good and over priced. QUick and easy checkin/out. The room we stayed in had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Much better experience than anticpated. Would have liked the hotel to over a continental breakfast or something but it was well worth the money otherwise

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly what we needed. We weren't in the hotel very much but it was very tidy and staff were very helpful. We had absolutely no problems.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location for SF Fisherman's Wharf activities However, the hotel consists of a main building with convenient parking and lobby amenities and an auxiliary building with neither. We were in the auxiliary building and found it to be completely inconvenient - no on site parking at that building and no portico from which to unload. The lobby was staffed only occassionally. According to the person who checked us in, the rooms were supposedly recently renovated and would be nicer than in the main building. We didn't find this to be true. Our bathroom door stuck badly and the room wasn't clean. Lots of choice in this area so I wouldn't choose this one again.

review.title: Great location for piers, restaurants, cable cars, sights, tours.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location. Walking distance to the piers, cable cars, restaurants, etc. was very convenient. The Cable car location was a short distance and allowed us to go the Union Sqare, Chinatown and other places with little effort. I would definitely stay at Holiday Day Inn Fisherman's Wharf again. The concierge readily handled setting up tours, and the desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant nightly buffet was overpriced for the sparse selection of food items. The breakfast buffet was better, not spectacular, but better than dinner. I have recommended this hotel to my girlfriend who is planning a trip there in the spring.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A lovely Holiday Inn, better standard than in the UK. Our room was on the ground floor which was a bit noisy as the road went past the window. Reception staff were helpful as was the concierge who booked our transfer back to the aiport matching a cheaper quote without hesitation. Rooms had single cup coffee makers with Starbucks coffee sachets provided. No tea bags or hot chocolate though. Also had a choice of firm or soft pillows which was a nice touch. Beds very comfortable. The hotel is one block from the bay - excellent location. Also right next to the office for the hop on hop off bus and on the edge of Little Italy/North Beach.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: If you don't have a car, this is a great place to stay. The sight seeing buses are all over, lots of places are within walking distances, and cable cars are fun. You can use the double decker buses for two days cheaper than one day of car parking. There is lots to do.

review.title: Nice hotel, location is excellent! Will go back!
review.reviewText: nice hotel friendly service, good location, can enter through back door with room key.... good idea.....

review.title: well worth it
review.reviewText: stay near fishermans wharf is ideal. you are close to the sea and its only a 10-15 minute walk into the city. lots to see and do everywhere, if you cant enjoy san francisco from here then you cant from anywhere. its only a small city so you can walk anywhere; failing that take a cable car. once again san fran is a must for all travellers

review.title: see you soon
review.reviewText: I hope I can come back soon to enjoy this beatifull city.

review.title: Will go here again!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a great location. The additional charge for parking was worth it. I was able to park until 6pm the following day of our check out. We put luggage in the car and had a chance to go to Alcatraz and return to the parking garage.

review.title: Already planning our next trip!
review.reviewText: Had a great vacation! The accomadations were perfect! The hotl is within walking distance to the embarcadero, pier 39, the Metro Muni and Bart. The consierge service was excellent and the staff was very helpful! Additional cost for parking but well worth the secure lot and with everything is within walking distance!

review.title: Would recommend to others
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great experience. It's location within a touristy area did not detract from its comfort. The rooms were impecable. The hotel was very clean and the personnel was friendly and helpful.

review.title: ITS OK TO STAY HERE
review.reviewText: Not a bad hotel, near points of interest and transportation routes, satisfactory service, but quite noisy at night (cars mostly and i dont know if it was the wind, but it was also a hard sound.

review.title: Enjoyable
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location! We were able to walk just about everywhere. The parking wasnt so great though. It was on New Years Eve that we went, so that may have been part of the issue.The hotels parking was all full so we had to go park 2 blocks away and walk to the hotel carrying our bags. The hotel it self was very clean and nice but the staff was awful. First i was told breakfast was included then in the mornming when i went downstairs they told me no. They were very rude about. Also, when i asked about sushi resturants they told me there wasnt any in walking didtance but when i went online i found 3 just a few blocks away. If you dont mind having not so great service but want a hotel in a great location this would be great.Despite the service i would probably go there again, you cant let unfriendly people ruin your trip!!

review.title: Great Fishermans Wharf location
review.reviewText: Location was great, we were put in a room in the other building on Beach and Jones Street. A wonderful view of Alcatraz and the bay. I found a good rate for New Years eve and was happy with it's proximity to the restaurants and places. The rail is just below but thankfully it stops running at night. There was some weird white residue above the window on the wall and the wallpaper was peeling back, maybe water damage. It didn't affect my stay, was just weird. Slightly hard beds.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Good clean hotel in a good location, the only criticism would be that the restaurant is nothing special, we only ate there because our flight was delayed though.

review.title: Perfect location.
review.reviewText: Same as above

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Is a wonderfulk city, nice people very safe place and lot a pleces to know.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Location is a block from the wharf - great restuarants in walking distance

review.title: Good deal, good location
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a weekend as a couple. Chose this hotel for its affordable price and convinient location - within walking distance of the piers, some shops, and restaurants, and nearby many transit stops when we wanted to venture further. The only real complaint is that the cleanliness of the in-room bathroom did not meet our expectations.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel location is great. It is less than two blocks from the water,and about three blocks from pier 39 and ghirardelli square. The only negative, is that this hotel charges you $39.90 per night, to park your car in its garage.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Staff and room were good, breakfast a little pricy

review.title: Great Location, friendly check in staff, Management struggled with restaurant staff labour dispute
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed 5 great days in San Francisco, Fisherman's Wharf neighborhood. This hotel is located in the heart of the action. The hotel staff were very helpful and genuinely friendly.

On our first evening, we checked out some of the local shops, restaurants, bars and attractions and decided to settle in to the hotel lounge for a night cap. We sat down, chatted about what a great time we were enjoying. It took at least 20 minutes to get the attention of the waiting staff. We were told that there was a labour dispute and the cocktail waitress did not show up. There were 4 staffers, who obviously worked inthe restaurant/bar, but none of them would serve us. (We were told that the union agreement did not allow them to) Well, fair enough, I believe in workers rights, but where is management. None of them picked up the slack. In fact, when I registered a complaint, the manager acted as if he didn't know there was a problem. Also, we observed this same scene with every customer who came in. I wrote it off to inexperienced management so that I could move forward and not let this effect my vacation.

In-spite of this disapointment, we enjoyed our time in the hotel and recommend it anyone who asks.

review.title: Nice place to stay in Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: We stayed in the annex building, as this Holiday Inn is two separate buildings; one is across the street from the other. It's very close to a bus stop and other transportation methods, including taxis. The hotel is very close to the Warf. They had a very nice staff and our stay was very pleasant.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel! The room was nice and clean. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was unmatched, within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and other local attractions. We would absolutely stay there again!

review.title: "Can't wait to go back"
review.reviewText: Perfect location on the Warf, can walk to a lot of the main attractions, very clean, helpful staff, and good prices! Defiantly recommend!

review.title: Perfectly Fine
review.reviewText: San Francisco is great and our hotel was fine. We faced the wharf I would request a room in the main building next time.

review.title: Would definately stay at the Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf, San Francisco again
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a great location to visit all the attractions that San Francisco has to offer, Including Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39 & 33 for Alcatraz tour and also a short cable car away from Union Square and Chinatown.

The staff were very friendly, and the hotel was lovely and clean and i would definately stay here again.

review.title: Okay for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay. What you would expect of a Holiday Inn. The concierge was very poorly trained, and couldn't help us with the simplest requests.

review.title: Will return here next time in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Very well situated to cable cars, wharf, restuarants and tourist attractions. The rooms very clean and comfortable.
Staff very helpful.
We highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great location; wonderful service; comfortable beds & pillows

review.title: Loved the location, didnt love the room
review.reviewText: OK first off I would like to say the overall of this hotel is a 6 out of 10. Location being a 10. We first arrived and we were suppose to get a king size bed in a non smoking room. We were first told that they do not have king sized beds. Our first room was a smoking room with two double beds. I went to the counter and they gave us another room, but it was out and down the street. Not knowing to much of San Fran and I might say we arrived at 11:30PM I was not to thrilled about this. Our second room was OK was non-smoking but again we had two double beds. I might have tried to get another hotel if I knew this was going to happen, but all said and done, it was in a perfect location.

review.title: Squeaky Clean
review.reviewText: The room was so squeaky clean I even tipped the cleaning lady. A short walk to everything at Fisherman's Wharf. And at such a reasonable price, I will use this hotel on every trip to SF from now on.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location if you are visiting Fisherman's Wharf. The room seemed clean enough, but not super clean. We needed bedding for the sofa bed and it took 2 phone calls and almost 2 hours to get it. The breakfast buffet was good, but higher price than I would have expected. I would have liked to have seen more information or assistance about how to get around town using public transportation.

review.title: Location, Location, Location!!!!
review.reviewText: In perfect spot- close to all

review.title: Fabulous city - next time we'll include a kitchenette....
review.reviewText: We stayed in one of the alternate buildings, not the main building, and although it was quiet we had difficulty regulating the heat in the room either too hot or too cold. The first night we stayed we found a shampoo bottle under the bed that did not belong to us which made me wonder how clean or what type of attention had been paid to the rest of the room. We could also hear people walking around above us early in the morning.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Best localization and very good hotel.

review.title: Good location, reasonable rooms
review.reviewText: I stayed almost 10 days in this hotel. Personnel and employee are quite friendly and helpful. Room is capacious and beds are large. Location is great for whoever wants to stay in fisherman's Wharf. The only snag is that they have two buildings, the one that I stayed in the one located in Beach street. The receptionists and concierge of that building work only until noon or a little after. The reception is gloomy and needs to be renovated.

review.title: Very Comfortable Motel
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with the service, cleaniness and comfort of the room.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Stayed in the annex down the street from main hotel. Loved the location as it was very close to Fisherman's Warf and we could pop back to our room to regroup before heading out again. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Hotel - Very convenient ... however,
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights, the room was very comfortable & very clean. We requested a king size bed & were told the ONLY rooms with a king sz. bed were on the corner of the building, all other rooms have double beds & asked about a queen sz. bed , they replied there are NO queen sz. beds. Soooo, we were subjected to street noise, trollies, cable cars & deliverey trucks - from 7:00 am. - 10:30 pm. Fortunately, we were generally up early & it was quiet by the time we got to bed... "Maybe we were noisey"!!

review.title: Great location and Hotel
review.reviewText: We could walk to Pier 39, Chinatown, Lombard Street, etc. We were close to Cable Cars, Cable Bus pickup, GrayLine tours, etc. Just a block away we rented bikes to bike across the Golden Gate Bridge. We only ate at the hotel once in the evening and it was fair but we were close to endless places to eat within walking distance. The hotel was very clean. I was disappointed that they gave us the wrong kickoff time for the SanFrancisco/Vikings game but other information they gave us was correct and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: location location location
