review.reviewText: The Hotel was great. block and a half from Fishermans Wharf -- Trolly cars -- Cable cars. A decent walk to Little Italy and it's shops, cafe's, restrnts. Don't know where something is as the desk. very helpful and nice staff. If I go back I would deff stay here again.

review.title: Won't get any sleep here!
review.reviewText: I found this holiday inn's quality to be lower than other locations. I was peeved from the first moment when we went to check in and they told us we were located in a different building and that we would have to bring all our stuff with us another block away. Why not name it a different hotel? And I am sure the quality of our room was a direct result out of them trying to use the Holiday Inn name for a substandard hotel. There was a Denny's in the entrance of this hotel that immediately doused us in fried oil. Not the nice restaurant or coffee bar that the main hotel had...but a Denny's. We got over the hotel issue pretty quickly considering we were happy with the general location near the F Market Cable Car line, as well as the Powell-Mason turnaround. However, that night after a long day of touring and needing a night sleep, the curtains did little to keep the glaring street lights out. Anyone would know sheer curtains are not a good choice. Also, the windows were very poor quality and as a result, much of the traffic throughout the night; buses, garbage trucks, and much more noise penetrated the room. I would definitely not recommend this hotel if you are planning on sleeping. It's not worth the money and the proximity to Fisherman's Wharf is the only thing going for it. Try somewhere else.

review.title: Right choice for a great trip.
review.reviewText: WE spent 5 days at the hotel and were extremely satisfied. Hotel service was very good, they were very kind and switched our room for us as we wanted to have one bed instead of initial room with two beds. This hotel is very close to various attractions on Fisherman's Wharf, both Ghirardelli Square and famous cable car turn-around are only two short blocks away, lots of nice places to eat nearby. We would definitely come back and stay here again. The only thing that could make out stay even better would be a hot-tub, we would have surely used it after many miles of walking we did each day.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: the hotel staff was helpful and wonderful, the hotel was cloe to fishermans wharf, everything was in walking distance, cable cars were 2 blocks away

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location if you want to hang out down by the wharf, although I think that can be done in one day. Our room was clean but very small and it was in the building across the street from the main hotel. I should have asked for a room in the main hotel because you feel like your just in a building with no hotel services. Dennys restaurant was right outside our window and was very loud, as its open 24 hours.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel accommodations were average, however, the location definitley made up for. It's walking distance from everywhere I needed to be.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Not excellent, but it's good enough unless you are expecting some special night in San Francisco. A coupld of minuites walking distance from Fisherman's Warf. That allows you to find a nice seafood restaurant easily at night. Not maintained well for interia and a bit busy at lobby but room is neat and confortable. At the price point, it's recommendable.

review.title: Would try other options before staying here again
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable room. Disappointed with the parking. Was shocked when told had to pay $35 a day for parking at the hotel and in a very congested area.

review.title: Hotel OK but room in different building
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and spacious, but was in a different building to the main hotel. Therefore we were away from most facilities - also, we didn't enjoy the trek along the street with baggage from check in to the 'annexe' after such a long journey from UK. Breakfast choice was Denny's (you get what you pay for) in annexe or main building buffet (good but pricey). Hotel is well placed for Fisherman's Wharf and attractions.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: There was no issues with this hotel beyond the fact that the first night we were on the 2nd floor right along the street which meant that we heard all the conversations of the people passing on the sidewalk below. We turned the air conditioning on in the room to help drown out the noise. We also were under the impression (and had written confirmation) that we were to have a king bed. The first night we had 2 doubles in the room and were unable to move due to no vacancy. The remainder 3 nights were accomodated in a king bed on the 5th floor which was much quieter even though we were still over-looking the street. I would definitely stay here again due to the great location and value for the money spent.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Front desk and concierge couldn't be more accommodating. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and many other attractions. Would certainly recommend this to anyone not driving (parking @ $40 a night + tax is a little steep!). Public transportation system is wonderful and stops are right out front. Would definitely stay there if we were to go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Convenient Locatiion
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn at the Wharf was conveniently located near many sights and neighborhoods such as Little Italy, Chinatown, Telegraph Hill and of course, the Wharf. Tour lines were also around the corner as was the cable car line and several fine restaurants for fine dining and particularly, breakfast such as Joanies and shopping. The concierge at this hotel were very helpful as was the front desk--it made our stay very satisfying.

review.title: Pretty Good!
review.reviewText: First day our room was missed being cleaned - but not a big deal. The food was very good at Denny's but a bit pricey. They charge for local calls being made from your room - that irratiates me a little for the price you pay per night, but it is at least posted. The location is great! Hotel staff is very good too and it is a very clean buliding & felt very safe!

review.title: Concierge is the pits
review.reviewText: Concierge was terrible. Very unhelpful. Was given wrong directions on more than one occasion. Hotel was fine if you were familiar with area and wanted to go it alone.

review.title: Love San Francisco
review.reviewText: Friendly service and personnel, reasonable rate

review.title: Would return in a minute
review.reviewText: This hotel met all our standards for comfort, cleanliness and facilities including the restaurant. It is walking distance to major sites, transportation and restaurants. Would reccommend the hotel to anyone looking for good price and comfort all in one.

review.title: Great location - lousy parking
review.reviewText: We loved being within walking distance to everything in San Francisco and the room was very comfortable. However, there are two buildings that they don't tell you about, and if you end up in the "beach" side, there's nowhere to park. Dragging our luggage for a few blocks and across the street wasn't fun - especially when we were paying a very high price for the parking spot.

review.title: A good place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: This is about 1 block from Fisherman's Wharf, which makes it very attractive. You can be close to all of the excitement within 5 minutes, but it's not in your face. If you need to get "downtown," i.e. to Market St., it's about a $10 cab ride -- unless you prefer to walk steeply uphill. Close to Knob Hill and Coit Tower

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Concierge was not too friendly. But otherwise pretty nice, oh but NO extras and food and drinks were a little over priced. But the location was close enough to all venues.

review.title: Don't bring a car
review.reviewText: All in all I liked the location and the hotel. I was a little surprised to get charged 40 dollars a night to park my rental car.

review.title: Ideal location for the Wharf
review.reviewText: Clean, tidy and reasonably modern rooms. Staff were pleasant and helpful without being false. Breakfast is way too expensive but there is a nice cafe right across the street for breakfast. Parking is also a rip off. Overall, a good place to stay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Good location, very comfortable and affordable. Delivered what I expected from Holiday Inn

review.title: I have recommended this hotel to all my friends and family
review.reviewText: My son and I enjoyed staying at this hotel! we were close to the bus stops, cable cars,street cars and Fishermans Wharf and walking distance to all restaurants. We did not need to rent a car. My son was soo happy staying at this hotel he learned his way around the area.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights. Room was clean, modern and well equiped. Hotel is in excellent location only one block from the open top bus tours. Only slight issue was car parking charges are a bit steep.

review.title: Location Great
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf. The whole staff was friendly and helpful and the location can't be beat. Taxi and public transportation was convenient and many sights are within walking distance. Would stay here again.

review.title: Holiday Inn near the Wharf
review.reviewText: Overall the room was good. Its in a great location. The only draw back is the parking, roughly $40 a day or you risk parking on the street and get a ticket.

review.title: Will definitely return!
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf was wonderful! It was only one block from the wharf. The room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. The free breakfast was a nice touch that I didn't expect. My only complaint was that it cost $40 a night to park at the hotel. I have never had to pay to park a car at a hotel where I was staying.

review.title: Great location and very convenient
review.reviewText: I wound up staying at the beach hotel for holiday inn. They have a restaurant on site and if you exit the back of the hotel it takes you right to the wharf. There are tons of things for visitors to do immediate area including pier 39 which is within walking distance. The best thing was how easy it was to get around. If you just hop on the F line right outside the hotel (make sure to get a muni pass first, you can grab one at the airport) you get transported to downtown in the blink of an eye. For me personally it was a great experience and I look forward to going back.

review.title: Not impressed, given the price
review.reviewText: Can't say the hotel is not a good one of course, but the price is mostly justified by the location, not services. I had no fridge in the room , the car park was extremely expensive for hotel guests. Also, I was disappointed as I left a camera battery charger in the room before leaving and it was not found after one hour. However the hotel is a good one generally speaking and a "safe" choice for a family.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: It is located within a walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Parking is still allowed after checking-out.

review.title: Parking Fees $$
review.reviewText: We were shocked to find out that there was an additional $$ per day parking fee. This was outrageous, but what could we do? There was no on street parking available unless we wanted to move our car every few hours. Hotel is located close to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and cable cars. A bit older hotel with older style decor. Housekeeping staff was very nice.

review.title: ok if you just want somewhere to sleep
review.reviewText: The main hotel was booked so we had to go down and across the street to the other bldg. All the ammenities and pool was at the main bldg and didn't want to carry stuff or walk a block in bathing suit. So didn't get to use. Was given a handicap bathroom and the tub was about 2in.deep not good! Other than that it was a typical hotel room. Good thing was the king size bed.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Room was clean, in good condition. My only complaint was the AC unit. It was so loud that it would wake you up at night when it came on.

review.title: Perfect Location...
review.reviewText: what a fantastic location in san franciso.. close to pier 39, public transport, out of the hussle and bustle of the city life, with a fantastic family astmosphere, and close to all travelers neeeds.

review.title: Definitely will go back
review.reviewText: Perfect location

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: No view. Our room was not ready and we had to switch rooms during our stay. Parking at the hotel was very expensive. The room service and restaurant left a lot to be desired.

review.title: Terrible for the money
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely expensive for what you get........... a lumpy bed, no view, no breakfast. In fact not very much. You are paying for location but there are other hotels with just as a good a location. We were not even in the main hotel. We were in an annexe a street away. We had to walk along the road with our luggage trailing behind us. Parking was extortionate and was back at the main hotel. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Poor, poor service and amenities.

review.title: I have stayed many nights in a Holiday Inn and this one I was not impressed
review.reviewText: This place needs a major overall. Decore was out dated and hotel looked old, Food prices were high.

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. During our stay we were close enough where we were able to walk to, from, and over the Golden Gate Bridge; take the trolley to Union Square but walk back to the hotel touring Chinatown, North Beach, Telegraph Hill along the walk; and walk to the pier where Alcatraz Cruises depart. There are also a series of bars 1 block away! The hotel itself was mediocre but when we vacation we're barely spending time in our room, aside from sleeping and showering. I would recommend this hotel for price and location.

review.title: Good deal for the price
review.reviewText: If you're wanting to spend time near Fishermen's wharf, this is a good deal. Located next to the trolley, very neat and clean.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice. I short walk to the Wharf. But I would NOT ever recommend the breakfast BUFFET. $21.00 is out ragious...

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: This was a nice place to spend a few days. Located just two blocks from Fishermans Warf and about a five minute drive from Golden Gate Bridge it was the perfect place for us considering why we were in San Fransisco to begin with. The Staff is very friendly and met our needs promptly. I will stay there the next time I visit and will recommend it to my friends and associates

review.title: holiday inn 4th of july
review.reviewText: great location. large room with comfortable beds and pillows. large bathroom

review.title: Impressive interior and location
review.reviewText: First off, the interior of the room was fanastic. It was very clean and nicely modeled. The hotel location was very near to the piers and ocean. My room was in the second building and having to carry luggage for a block was a pain. Also, the walls were very thin. You will hear your neighbors doing whatever they do. I had a room near the street and I was woke up around 6AM everyday. Regardless, I would stay there again for the cleanliness, location and price.

review.title: Very nice hotel, will definitely go back....
review.reviewText: Very competitive rate, and it's an excellent hotel! Inside hotel has two restaurants, and one restaurant serves pasta and salad bar at dinner time, very nice family restaurant. Service is good, and food tastes delicious! Swimming Pool is outdoor, and size is perfect for family vacation. Will definitely recommend this hotel to others, and will stay there again at our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: I plan to stay there next time
review.reviewText: Not only is the hotel located on Fisherman's Wharf, their customer service was very good, the room very clean, and there was a Denny's on location for good, inexpensive breakfasts.

review.title: So Close to the Wharf!
review.reviewText: We had a great visit to SF and the location of this hotel coudl not have been better- everything was only a couple of minute walk away.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: This newly built branch of Holiday Inn was perfect in every way. There are Internet computers available in both buildings, plenty of pop and ice machines, and it was very clean. The desk clerks were very helpful and cooperative. Bicycles may be taken to the rooms also.

review.title: San Francisco-Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The enfasis of the hotel should be more tourist oriented. Not only mainland tourists, but from other countries (other languages). So, the hotel need more service oriented workers(all levels) and to be a better link between their clients and San Francisco City.

review.title: Holiday Inn - Fishermen's Wharf
review.reviewText: It is in an excellent location for visiting many of San Franciscos attractions. The room was spacious and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that needs or wants to stay in this part of the city. A 24-hour restaurant located in the hotel worked out great for those days that we were on early morning tours. I would not have any reservation about staying in this hotel on a future visit.

review.title: Wonderful Vacation!
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with the hotel....price...comfort...employees....within walking distance to just about everything!!!! Great "sticky buns" at the coffee counter in the lobby....

review.title: Nothing special but good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a bit run down but the location can't be beat if you want to do touristy things near the Wharf. You could hear everything in the hallway all night long and the cable car going by but we let it go given the price and location.

review.title: Prime location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, with the exception of not having filled my requests, refrigerator and microwave. I was told my room would have both. After a hour and a half wait I did get the refrigerator but no microwave. Parking fee's outragious!! But overall was I was satified with their service, and the room was very clean, prime location.

review.title: Great Hotel for a decent price
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel for what you're paying. If you want fancy and expensive, there are many other hotels in SF to choose from. If you want a comfortable hotel with a fantastic bed at a good rate, stay at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good value and great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is divided into two buildings. One building has smoking rooms, the other building (which is across the street)has non-smoking rooms. The smoking building has better amenities than the non-smoking building. It has nicer restaurants,a gift shop and a more attractive lobby.

review.title: unhappy with parking lot fee
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice ,clean and comfortable, but I was very unhappy with the $47.00 charge to park in thier parking lot.A small fee would have been exceptible but I felt that was way to much to pay.I think paying for your stay at the hotel should entitle you to a free parking space.That is the only thing that would keep me from staying there again.

review.title: Beware of Extras
review.reviewText: Thought we got a good rate on the hotel when we booked but then upon checkout, learned that the parking was 1/2 the price of the room per night! Ouch! A good thing to look into before booking your room.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: The Staff was very helpful, rooms were clean. Close to the fishermans wharf. Had a great stay.

review.title: Holday Inn stay @ San Francosco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. You have to pay for your breakfast & parking, which was a little pricy, but I guess that's the cuty for you! We were within walking distance to Ghiradelli Square, which is a MUST GO place. We were also within walking distance to some of the piers, which was nice because we were able to see the ships. $5 gets you on to look. There were sidewalk vendors & art shops all around. Great visit!

review.title: Very nice building, comfortable rooms, perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is well kept, and the rooms are in great condition. You get a large room for what you pay for: small kitchen, full size sofa, large sleeping area. The bed was very comfortable and soft. The room didn't have much of a view (we were looking down into an alley with graffiti in several spots along the wall) but it's in the perfect location along the 'west' Fisherman's Wharf area. You can walk to all the restaurants and tourist stops along the Embarcadero. The Pier 39 area is a little further, but you'd save on their ridiculous parking fees. Speaking of parking, I was annoyed by their outrageous nightly parking fee, but that seems to be the trend in San Francisco. Parking is a luxury, and you WILL pay for it. Every other hotel I quoted had roughly the same dollar amount for their overnight parking.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Great location for walking around the Wharf. Room was clean and reasonably comfortable. Parking is a bit pricey and not very convenient if you are in the Beach St. section of the hotel. Although it is secure.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Nice Location since it is right next to the Warf. The view from the room was also really nice--could see the ocean and without even requesting it. Parking was about $45 a night--but we got to park when checking in and didn't have to get the car until 6pm the next night. My only issue was that the part of the hotel we stayed in was not attached to the main hotel or parking garage and had to walk across, and down the street to get to our room (all outside--no inside pathways). Not sure how to get a room in the main facility, but we will be sure to request that next time. Otherwise, we will for sure stay there when we go back to the area!.

review.title: Darn good hotel
review.reviewText: Only problem we had was street traffic could be heard through window, but if you are facing the front of the hotel, you won't have to worry about that!

review.title: Great place to stay in San Fran.
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn on the Warf was a great place with a great location. Go down one block and you are at the piers. Would recommend this spot to anyone visiting. We visited San Fran to be tourist and that is the spot for your best experience. Locals tried to convince us to stay downtown but we are glad we didn't. Great Price also!

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean, lobby was nice. Convienent location to everything on the Warf and short walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Wasn't aware that while booking at the hotel we would have to walk a block to actually get to our room. Front desk staff could be a little more helpful. I tried to call a few times for a cab and information and had to try several different numbers to actually get someone to answer.

review.title: was impressed.
review.reviewText: Has visited before and decided that I wanted to stay near Fisherman's Wharf. The Hotel is divided into 2 buildings, mine was the one on Beach Street which allowed me to walk across the parking lot and right there at the Wharf. The parking lot was a thing for around $15 to park for my friend who met up with me at the Wharf. Nice thing, is that if you wanted to eat breakfast there is a Denny's inside the Beach Street building.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel was a nice place to stay although if your are not in the main building you have to walk over with you luggage to the next building around the corner. Staff were pleasant and the stay was comfortable and also close to all of the Bay activities.

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: Parking at this hotel (and the area in general) is expensive. Forget your car or rental you can walk anywhere, and if you do need a cab, it's still cheaper in the long run than parking.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: the hotel's location is perfect to access all the area of the wharf, close to multiple restaurants and tours departures

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed with our 2 boys (11 and 9) for 5 nights in April'09. Best thing about the hotel is the location. Close to Fisherman's Wharf and to the Powell-Hyde cable car turnaround. We only had breakfast one morning and it was expensive and disappointing compared to the vast array of other places available a short walk from the hotel (Starbucks, Italian Bakery, Boudin Bakery etc). Car parking an expensive extra but was secure and convenient. Staff at front desk very helpful.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Stayed here before in 2003. Great location. Great pricing offered by Expedia. Would recommend. Only a few short blocks to Fisherman's Wharf attractions.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel mid March 2009. Location is great, close to Pier 39, Lombard St, Cable Car etc. Rooms are excellent with comfy beds but ask for a room off the main road due to noise.

review.title: Was good for Location
review.reviewText: Beds were a bit hard and if you are sent to the 2nd building, a cable car runs right outside, which is very loud! But very easy access to all types of transport, which is very helpful to see main tourist attractions!

review.title: Satisfied customer
review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff. Nice hotel although maybe needs a little updating. Very accessible to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Cable cart Station, Pier 39, Alcatraz and a lot of shops. If you are looking for just a place to sleep in and you are planning to go visit these places during the day, then this a good hotel choice.

review.title: Great Location & Clean
review.reviewText: My husband & I just got back from our San Fran trip April 6th-11th. The hotel was a great location, close to all tourist spots, most of them walking distance. It was one block off the water. There was also a cable car station right across the street. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone. Room was clean & friendly staff as well!

review.title: great place to visit
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable, very handy for all fishermans wharf attractions,close to cable cars and trams for travel into city centre.

review.title: Needs updating. Non smoking room smelled like smoke
review.reviewText: First impression of the room from both my children and I was that the room smelled like smoke. It was supposed to be a non-smoking room. The room was in the older portion of the hotel and had I known, I would have requested a room in the newer portion. The older portion is in serious need of updating. It looks aged. The breakfast the first morning which was ordered from the menu was not cooked to order, but instead taken from the buffet by the wait staff and was cold. The second day it was cooked to order and arrived hot. No problems with the Wi Fi and the location was unbeatable for the attractions. Next time I will stay at the Holiday Inn and Suites or another more updated hotel in town. The smoke smell in the room was a real turn off and paying $41 per day for parking is outrageous.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf - great food, shopping, excursions of all kinds, and other San Fran attractions. We love the location. Give it a try!!!

review.title: Ask for a room in the main hotel
review.reviewText: Assigned room in annex which was not as nice as the main hotel. Will consider Holiday Inm Express for next visit.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Location, comfort, everything was just what I needed on my vacation. This isn't for people wanting the fancy lifestyle. This was perfect for someone who spent the day exploring San Francisco and wanted to return to a comfortable, clean, quiet room. Next time I go back to San Francisco, I will be staying here again for sure. Highly suggest using a shuttle from the airport though. Parking is expensive everywhere in the city, and the roads are not easy to navigate unless you are familiar. The hotel staff is great at booking shuttles for you too.

review.title: Like to return
review.reviewText: I would stay again as it's location is very convenient for Fisherman's Wharf area. Concierge was very helpful as was the main desk personnel. Rooms were imaculate and fresh ! Only downfall was parking, it is $41.00 per day at the hotel so consider a shuttle from the airport if you are not driving around San Francisco. All in all a great experience and will consider if I return .

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location, easy to walk the wharf and Ghiradelli Square, The Cannery, etc. A clean hotel, spacious room, good price, just what we were looking for.

review.title: great location...but...
review.reviewText: over $40 dollars of parking a day!!!!! this is unreasonable and should be part of the description the internet connection in the room was so bad, it was VERY frustrating one night we wanted to stay in the room and watch a movie, it took us about 5 calls to the front desk and over 2 hours before we could! and of course no apologizing from anyone

review.title: Great location but rooms with no view
review.reviewText: The hotel location was great. Just a short walk to pier 39 and Ghiradelli square. Very close to trolley car stops and the F-line streetcar (which goes along the embarcdero to Union square and ends in the castro district). Overall the lobby and room were pretty nice, especially for what we paid. A few annoying things... our room was on the ground floor with sliding doors into an alleyway between two sections of the hotel. A bit noisy when people walked past and somewhat un-safe feeling. Two sides of the hotel seem to face into alleyways. I think if you wanted any view (or any privacy with your curtains open) you would have to request a room overlooking the pool. Coffee was also a pain. Instead of a normal coffee maker they provide one with specific little plastic pre-filled trays. Bad for the environment and only enough packets provided to make one reg and one decaf cup of coffee each day. Although they did oblige when we asked for more (every day) next time I would just pick up a cheap coffee maker from the Walgreens next door.

review.title: Moderate hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Just stayed one night and quite comfortable. However, had an argument over whether breakfast was included, despite an E-Mail from Expedia saying full breakfast was included. Hotel insisted that the Expedia rate only included a voucher towards the cost of breakfast. Eventually hotel agreed to provide an additional voucher, nearly covering the cost of two breakfasts.

review.title: Very Nice Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is excellent. We arrived early and were able to go to our room. I was allergic to the down pillows, notified staff and received hypoallergenic pillows within minutes. My 17 year old daughter traveled with me and thought the bed was too hard and uncomfortable. She also loved the soap that was available in the bathroom. No HBO available, this would have been nice. We had breakfast at the hotel. A little expensive, but well worth it. The overall service of the hotel staff was above average. Anything needed or wanted was taken care of. This Mother-Daughter get away was a blast.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: this was a great hotel,and it was so close to everything,no need for a taxi.had a great time

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was OK but nothing startling. Room was alright but had crack in ceiling. Lousy coffee machine. Room we had was on Premier floor but was very close to air conditioning/refrigeration unit which was very noisy plus conditioning unit in room was also very noisy. Didn't use restaurant at all and it appeared neither did most guests as it was usually quite empty.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the location of this hotel. We were SO close to Fisherman's Wharf and public transportation was very close as well. The rooms were nice and big. They had a computer on every floor where guests could surf the internet and another one where you could print out boarding passes for your flight.

review.title: Worth the money
review.reviewText: This hotel is worth the extra little bit of money for the location of it. You step out the doors and go a couple blocks and there is fishermans warf. About 1/2 mile the other direction is North Beach which has some of the best food we have found in San Francisco. The hotel was clean and the beds we comfortable.We will be back for sure.

review.title: not very accommodating
review.reviewText: Hallways; lounge; and common areas had absolutely no heat. Was frigid throughout our stay. We requested two items of assistance from the concierge; dinner reservations and a car reservation for one day. He failed to secure any dinner reservations; which we were counting on since we were sight-seeing during the day (s). More importantly; he never contacted us to advise us that he was unsuccessful; even though we had given him our room number; and two cell phone numbers. HE advised all the wrong details for the car rental; including that the rental agency would drop the car off; and pick it up. They came to pick US up to drive over to sign for the car; and at the end of the day; they were closed; and we had to taxi back to the hotel; at our expense. Just no coordination; incorrect details; and no follow-through.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Was a bit pricey when all was said and done, but nice. They are fairly good about helping out their guests in any excursions etc.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location, rooms were spacious and comfortable. We paid extra to get breakfast included but when we got the breakfast voucher we were advised it didnt cover the cost of breakfast and we would need to pay the difference. If I had of known that was how they did it I wouldnt of bothered and had breakfast in the bay which im sure would of been nicer, more of a selection and not as pricy!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Very close to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradilli Square. Also a large and well stocked Walgreen's around the corner with food and other useful items. The WiFi (free) did not work when we got there, and was later fixed temporarily, but the signal was so weak it was useless. The heat did not work in one of our rooms and it took 3 hours and many phone calls to get it to work. The hotel restaurant/cafe is very expensive for a sit down breakfast there or in a Denny's next door. There are a few take out pizza places nearby. Eat at the most crowded restaurants on the Wharf. They are the best. When you ask for a cab from the hotel, be sure to ask for a yellow cab. I didn't and got a white cab with no meter that charged $50 for the airport instead of the $40 on a metered cab. I would go back for the location.

review.title: a great hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: We've stayed in the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf for a total of four nights after Christmas. We had an early flight in and so we weren't so sure about being able to check in at 8 am in the morning. However, we were given a very large room in the Beach/annex building as soon as we arrived from the Airport. I was very impressed with the size of the room and we rested before heading out after an early flight in. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was large and clean. There are computers with working printers on each floor so it made it very convenient to print out boarding passes, check out weather, and research on activities around the area. We did not rent a car since public transportation is readily available. There are a couple of bus stops near the hotel and we made use of that to go to various places in the city. The only thing I wish they would look into is the service of their front desk staffs. They were almost non-existent at the beach/annex hotel and when they are there, they were not very customer-oriented. But since I've been to the city a few times before, I was able to get around to where I need to be without much help.

review.title: Not worth
review.reviewText: The room was stuffy. The bed was a bit squeeky. Carpetting was old and looks yukky. Service staff at the restaurant were unprofessional.

review.title: Good service
review.reviewText: I booked at the last minute during the holiday season, was given a fine room and helpful suggestions about local New Years Eve events. Parking was pretty steep, though.

review.title: Well situated for the location.
review.reviewText: Clean and friendly hotel, we were placed in their second building, which was not a problem for us, as there is a Denny's at the entrance, great for coffees and breakfast first thing. Prime location for Fisherman's Wharf, where there is stacks of things to eat, see, do. Try the clam chowder, you wont find it like this anywhere else. Not the best hotel we have stayed in before, but certainly not the worst.

review.title: none
review.reviewText: good

review.title: Very happy with this location
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location. It is in walking distance to most warf activities and has both bus and trolly stops within 1 block. The staff was very helpful and changed one of our rooms so our 3 rooms were togather. Be aware there are 2 buildings and our front desk was only staffed in the morning. This wasn't a problem for us, but one lady was very angry about it.

review.title: Parking fee is very expensive
review.reviewText: The hotel is unable to provide free parking, and the parking fee is very high. Not recommended if drive your own car to the town.

review.title: everything went smooth and it was very clean and helpful with sight seeing
review.reviewText: Great hotel and helpful with sight seeing

review.title: Hotel is OK
review.reviewText: The rooms are spacious. On check-in and -out, many people accumulated at the reception and it took a long while until more personnel occupied the counters. The desires of customers could be taken more seriously.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great place to stay. The fishermans warf is in walking distance and there are plenty of places to eat and drink in the area.

review.title: Fairly priced - Great location
review.reviewText: Located only a block from all the attractions at Fisherman's Wharf, this hotel was a find. The staff were very cordial, from the housekeepers to the front desk. The rooms were neat and clean. The Concierge service was accurate and friendly. Van transportation to and from airport was available. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: The place to stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel is well suited for all eg. singles, couples and the family.

review.title: it's worthing itself
review.reviewText: It's near Pier 39. I can go to the Pier 39 by feet.In the neibourhood there is one city sightseeing office. One can take advantage of the sightseeing programm to visit almost all the places of interest easily.

review.title: Left my heart in San Franscisco
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express that we stayed in was very comfortable except for the A/C-Heating system. It was very noisy but my wife and I did not let this affect our stay.

review.title: Less than satisfactory
review.reviewText: I'll start with some of the nice things about this hotel: Overall, the sheets, bathroom, carpets, etc. were clean. The staff was quite helpful and very polite. I'd take nothing away from them. However, I had some issues with my room. For one thing, there was a mouse in my room one evening. The air pressure in my room caused the bathroom vent to emit a low howl constantly. The room had a network jack, but it doesn't work because they only use wireless (some of us still have older laptops that need a cord), and their 'business center' consists of 3 PCs that are nearly always taken. Overall, the experience left me disappointed. Sorry.

review.title: Not the hotel we thought we would be in
review.reviewText: When we arrived at hotel told we were in the other building in the next block. Asked how do we get our bags there the concierge was no help at all. Had to take ourselves. Overall did not feel welcomed.

review.title: I loved San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel in San Francisco was nice. It was clean and the employees were very helpful. It did take a while to check-in. The desk person kept disappearing into the back room. Apparently the hotel was booked. They asked if I used Expedia and then said they were trying to get a room that would accomodate us for our full stay without having to move us around to another room half way thru our stay. That irritated me. We did get a room for our full stay, but it didn't have a microwave or refrigerator like the website said.

review.title: terrific location
review.reviewText: terrific location to all piers, great shopping and many different dining options. I plan to visit San Francisco again my plan to stay at this hotal again. It was beautiful and the staff was wonderful.

review.title: Average Hotel Above Average Price
review.reviewText: Average hotel room, great location,clean. The price is 5 Star plus parking ouch!!!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The only hotel that I have been to where I've had to park my own car, bring my own luggage up to my room, and hail my own cab! TERRIBLE service! And what kind of bar isn't open between 11am and 5 at night?!?!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Stayed in the Beach St side.Very convenient location, very friendly staff, comfortable, clean, concierge very helpful. Great breakfast in main hotel- enough to last the day. Just don't go to Denny's in Beach St Building!Awful.

review.title: convenience
review.reviewText: hotel is situated close to all Wharf activities with easy access via public transportation to all other areas

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Nice facility. We would have prefered a queen or king size bed, instead of two double beds.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location. All of the staff that we encountered were pleasant and very helpful.

review.title: Not really on the Wharf
review.reviewText: Not really on the Wharf; about a 2 block walk. For the price I would expect more choices. We needed two beds and ended up with 2 doubles. They stated that they didn't have queens. Had to wait to check in even though they had plenty of people behind the counter; only one person seemed to be working. Had no ideas on where to eat dinner. Even the concerige was no help.

review.title: Nice centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, trolley, bus and ferry lines. Room was sufficient and clean. Staff was friendly, courteous and efficient. Good mid-priced hotel.

review.title: Go back again
review.reviewText: be more clear & conditions on kids eat free campaign. Were told two different things. Nothing mention had to pay parking at the hotel

review.title: EXCELLENT FOR VACATIONEERS
review.reviewText: Worked well for us, could walk any where on the wharf. rental car only a block awqay. Hotel staff great with sight seeing.

review.title: Good stay for the price
review.reviewText: I was in the adjacent "Beach Building" rather than the main building. This was less inconvenient to get to and from my automobile in the hotel parking garage (below the main building). I did get a refrigerator moved into my room immediately (it was not in my room when I arrived). The beds were comfortable, and the high speed internet was quite good. The location was reasonably convenient to everything that I wanted to do. There's no view, and there is a little street noise, but overall I was happy.

review.title: Great hotel, Great Location!
review.reviewText: We stayed for a week this past July with our 9 year old and an infant. The hotel was located right at Fisherman's Wharf and within walking distance to many attractions. The F line runs right by the hotel which will take you right down to Market so there is no need for a rental car. The staff was great and I have been recommending this hotel to others and would definitely stay again in the future. What a beautiful city!

review.title: Great location. Convenient for sightseeing.
review.reviewText: We stayed in the remodeled Beach Street addition. It was a little noisy. You could hear through the walls, and street noise on the lower floors. Ask for a room on fifth floor. Other than that, it was clean and comfortable and we were happy with the service. There was a Denny's restaurant attached to the lobby, which we thought was not a class act, but there were plenty of good restaurants nearby. The fitness room was very small but well equipped.

review.title: Great location to Fisherman's Wharf-walking distance.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel service was just okay. The room was your average room. The restaurant was way too expensive. Overall we had a good stay there and would recommend it to friends.

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location, clean, and typical EXCEPT the front desk kept closing for hours at a time (and I mean physically closing the desk off!). My key wouldn't work one time and I had to wait and wait after using the house phone for someone to come. When the shuttle came to pick me up for the return trip to the airport, it was closed again and it took almost a half hour for someone to come retrieve my stored luggage. Again, it really was convenient and less expensive, but I wouldn't stay there again. It was okay.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Did not agreed with extra high parking fees,too much,I do not recomend

review.title: would go back
review.reviewText: Stayed at the holiday inn fisherman's wharf 19/5-26/5, and had a really enjoyable stay.On check-in we were upgraded to the 5th floor,room was clean and bed was really comfortable just what we needed after 10.5hr flight,staff were helpful and cleaning staff friendly and efficient,close for cable car turnaround and the wharf and local attractions,had a very enjoyable and relaxing holiday.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this hotel. Overall, the staff, conditions of the hotel, room service and maintenance was very good. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel, which I found more economical than some of the other ones located in close proximity. I stayed there from 5/18-25/2008 and would return again. It wasn't too crowded and I escaped the Memorial Day weekend rush of people coming in. I would definitely rate this hotel among the 4 or 5 star hotels.

review.title: Good tourist location.
review.reviewText: The hotel was right on the wharf close to all the tourist attractions. The staff was very accommodating. Our hotel room was clean as was the hotel overall.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed this hotel. The only downside is that there is never anyone at the front desk in the beach building. It is really clean though and very nice. Close to the wharf too. No breakfast did suck a little though.

review.title: Convenient, clean & comfortable
review.reviewText: Very convenient location, staff was friendly & helpful, and our room was clean. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: We were surprised at our satisfaction!
review.reviewText: We were a little nervous about staying at a downscale hotel, but were willing to make the sacrifice for the location in Fisherman's Wharf. Check in and check out were quick and easy. Our room was clean and well maintained. Maid service was good. There are 3 restaurants connected to the hotel, which was very convenient. The only possible complaint I can come up with is that the maid's don't follow the water conservation policy. Our towels were changed every day even though we had hung them up signalling that we would re-use them. I'd definitely stay here again!!

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: it was really comfortable to stay at the hotel.

review.title: an impressive experience
review.reviewText: I had never been to San Francisco and was quite impressed with the city and the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful in the questions I had. The room had been so confortable that at one point a comment was made about going to the medicine cabinet, when we realized we were still in a hotel we both laughed. What does that say about the comfort we felt?

review.title: excelent location
review.reviewText: if you are in a tourist plan it is an excelent option. close to atractions expensive parking lot

review.title: good quality and great location!!
review.reviewText: this hotel is in a great area--easy to get around everywhere! Very convenient, clean, and well-priced!

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very clean and comfortable , quite close to Pier 39 which had real buzz about it. Quite pricey for an annexe room which we were sent to above a Denny's Food place. However for the location we would probably go back there again. Make sure that the Hotel gets your name correct in their computer becasue we almost didn't get our room because someone was sloppy and entered our name incorrectly in their reservation system.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Clean room, great location, easy access to public transportation

review.title: Hotel air conditioner
review.reviewText: Unfortunatly the aircondicioner was broke and SF is a very cold city, also the hotel should have double window on rooms. The consierge service was excelent thank you

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is very well located for all of the Wharf activities, and also centrally located if you are going to be using public transportation.

review.title: Within walking distance of everything
review.reviewText: We chose not to rent a car and walked everywhere we wanted to go. We did take the F line (antique cable car) down town and to Pier 39 after several days of walking. We will definitely go back to this hotel....only two things we would have liked was a continental breakfast and microwave in room.

review.title: Short Sheeted!
review.reviewText: The very short Chinese maids, short sheeted my bed nightly. I'm 6'2". It's not a big deal, but I had to remake my bed every night.

review.title: Great Location, Really uncomfortable bed
review.reviewText: I was not really impressed with the hotel. The room was large enough and the amenities were fine. We were on the second floor, looking out at the entrance to the restaurant. The windows were covered only with white sheers and although I went outside to check and couldn't actually see through them, they made me feel less than comfortable. One side of the valance over the window was hanging down a bit - the carpets were oldish and the room had a shabby look. The thing I really disliked was the bed. We had a king, and the blanketing arrangement was several layers of sheets and light blankets, covered by a heavy, coarse bed spread, all wrapped and tucked in so tightly, it was impossible to get in without dismanting the whole thing and then sheets and blankets got all displaced. I really loathed the bed, and I normally can sleep anywhere and don't mind at all. The check in was slow. The layout of the hotel, with the different buildings was awkward. The housekeeping people were excellent. The girl at the desk in our building was really great as well. The location, at Fisherman's wharf and near to the various transit lines, was wonderful. We took full advantage of this and enjoyed our stay in S.F. very much. We are planning to take our 2 younger children there this coming fall, but I will definitely look for another hotel next time.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: This hotel had friendly customer service. We did have challenges with parking our rental car the rates were extreme especially since we were staying at this hotel and it took three trys for our magnetic card to work in the lot. The working staff (staff cleaning room) were extremely friendly.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and it has a great location. Right at fisherman's wharf and a walk away from Pier 39, and Ghiradelli station. There is a trolley station two blocks away that will take you anywhere in the city. It's not a bad walk from Chinatown either.

review.title: Great Hotel CLOSE to Fishermen's Warf - CLOSE!!!! :)
review.reviewText: Dennys was in the lobby of the building I was staying in. (there are two buildings across the street from one another) Room was clean, big, quite, overall a wonderful stay.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Staff at front desk of main hotel were ok. Staff at the breakfast buffet and the annex front officer were very RUDE. It seemed like it was a trouble to serve us and/or answer any of our questions. With all of the other choices nearby I certainly would not stay here again.

review.title: Great location close to all Fisherman's Wharf Sites
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf is a pleasant relatively new hotel in the heart of the tourist area. The rooms were clean and comfortable. There was no free continental breakfast as the Expedia website indicated, but there was an exorbitantly priced Denny's in the adjacent Holiday Inn accross the street. We felt the rooms were overpriced but I suppose that's to be expected during spring break in San Francisco.
